description: Your words alone can keep the attention of a small crowd of people, especially in times of crisis. For as long as you speak, a small group of people will pay attention to you, ignoring other things that may be happening in the area.
tooltip: For as long as you speak, a small group of people will pay attention to you, ignoring other things that may be happening in the area.

name: Communication
description: You can convey a basic concept to a creature that normally can't speak or understand speech. The creature can also give you a very basic answer to a simple question. Can ask multiple questions, but the creature's knowledge may be limited.
tooltip: You convey a basic concept or ask a simple question to a creature that normally can't speak or understand speech.

name: Competence
description: You have an additional 1d6 Competence die which you roll at the same time as your dice pool, but does not count towards you dice count. Instead, you can choose to substitute the number rolled on one of your dice with the result from your Competence die.
tooltip: You can choose to substitute the number rolled on one of your dice with the result from an extra 1d6 Competence die.

name: Concussive Blast
description: A pulse of concussive Divine force explodes out at a point you choose within short range. The pulse extends up to short range in all directions, dealing damage to everything in the area.
tooltip: Divine force explodes out at a point you choose within short range, dealing damage to everything in the area.

name: Conditioned Berserker
description:
Anytime you take damage in combat, you must make a single die Logic roll; if you fail, you go berserk. If you succeed, you don't go berserk, even if you want to (you can't choose not to roll, or to use an exact roll as a failure).

While berserk, you have three dice total for every combat roll, and your mixed successes are considered regular successes instead (you can still get Intrusions on failed rolls). You automatically fail on all positive social interaction Tasks. For the duration, you Attack every living being within short range, starting with the closest. If no living being is within short range, you move to seek out potential victims.

In addition, sometimes you spontaneously go berserk when angered, surprised, or scared. When this happens, the GM may allow you to attempt a Logic roll to avoid going berserk.

Once you are berserk, you remain so for up to ten minutes, unless you succeed on a Logic roll to return to normal. When you return to your normal state of mind and body immediately after going berserk, you can't go berserk again until after you have taken a Long Rest.

There is no longer any lingering effects if you cancel your berserker state early.
tooltip: Anytime you take damage, make a single die Logic roll. If you fail, you go berserk.

name: Confess
description: Add a die to your dice pool when asking questions to a person who is entranced by your presence.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when asking questions to a person who is entranced by your presence.

name: Confidant
description:
You are known beyond the borders of your patrol area and can exert authority anywhere you go, and people trust you with rumours related to trouble in your area. Add two dice to your dice pool on all social interactions where you are trying to gain information on known sources of trouble.

You are known beyond the borders of your patrol area and can gain information on trouble anywhere within the star cluster.
tooltip: Add two dice to your dice pool on a social interaction Task where you are trying to gain information on trouble.

name: Confound
description: You pull talents and abilities seemingly out of nowhere. You can attempt one Task in which you have no training as if you were trained. This Ability refreshes every time you rest.
tooltip: You attempt one Task in which you have no training, as if you were trained. You must Rest between each use.

name: Confusion
description: In addition to dealing damage, the Nightmare’s Attack confuses the target for one round. On its next Action, the target Attacks an ally.
tooltip: The Nightmare’s Attack deals damage and confuses the target for one round.

name: Confusion
description: Instead of dealing damage, the Nightmare’s Attack confuses the target for one round. On its next Action, the target Attacks an ally.
tooltip: The Nightmare’s Attack confuses the target for one round.

name: Connected
description: You have connections, resources, and a head for business. Whenever you spend at least an hour in a community with a population of 1000 or more, you can find comfortable accommodations for you and your Companions for as long as you stay there. The accommodations also provide you with food and whatever Inexpensive or Moderately Priced Items you need.
tooltip: Communities with 1000 or more people provide you and your Companions with generous hospitality after visiting for at least one hour.

name: Connections
description: If there are people to interact with, you can easily locate a desired, Moderately-priced Item, including restricted Items. The sought-after Item must be available in the setting.
tooltip: You locate a desired, Moderately-priced Item (including restricted Items) through interactions with people in the area.

name: Constantly Dying
description:
Choose one of the following:

  • You are one of many in a team, expendable in your position but part of a team nonetheless. Whenever you die, you assume control of another member of the team in the next round. You should figure out the team ahead of time, including character setups, size, and functions. All team members must have your Focus (but having no other restrictions), and you can only control one member of the team at a time, switching characters only once one dies. You can replenish team members on your Long Rests. If you don't have any team members left before a Long Rest, you must wait until your Long Rest to get a new character.
  • Whenever you die, you assume control of an entirely new character next round. Roll a character sheet for this new character. You must select your Focus again, but you can change either the Descriptor, Species or type when setting them up. You can also choose whichever name or gender you wish. You begin with this new character on the same Tier as your now-dead character, but lose any XP and equipment not retrieved by your party. There is no explanation for where this new character comes from, nor do they need to justify their participation in current events.

Your Abilities have what seems to be tipsy-turny logic when it comes to success. The more successful you are on a roll, the more likely you are to die and give a benefit to your allies. The less successful you are, the more likely you are to survive and put your allies in danger instead. As an example, if you get a mixed success when trying to detect a trap, you might find the source of the danger, but lose a hand in the process. This doesn't kill you, but severely inhibits your abilities. With enough failures, it may be better for your allies to "put you down" rather than carry around dead meat.
tooltip: Whenever you die, you control a new character in the next round.

name: Consume Magic
description: You touch a target, consuming its Magical essence, if it has any. If the target is an object, the Magical essence is removed and renders the object powerless, if it required Magic to function. If targeting a creature or character, consuming their Magic weakens and harms them, or may kill them outright.
tooltip: You touch a target, consuming its Magical essence, if it has any, removing power or causing harm in the process.

name: Consume Object
description: With a touch, you cause shadows to envelop one non living object that is smaller than you, destroying it. If the GM feels it appropriate to the circumstances, you can have the shadows consume a portion of an object (the total volume of which is smaller than you) rather than the entire thing.
tooltip: With a touch, you cause shadows to envelop an object that is smaller than you, destroying it.

name: Contact Network
description: Whenever you enter a place of civilization, you can perform this Feat to recall a temporary Contact. This person does not remain a Contact like others, only being available for one interaction. Perhaps they are a friend of a Contact or someone who owes you a favour. For this interaction, they will act like all other Contacts and have two Skills in which they are trained.
tooltip: You recall a temporary Contact (with two Skills) that can be interacted with once, but can never be Contacted again.

name: Contacts
description:
Choose a location. At that location you either have:
  • One Contact trained in two areas of your choosing.
  • Two Contacts trained in one Skill of your choosing each.
The Contact(s) will provide you with any information they are capable of supplying.

name: Control
description: You use trickery, well-spoken lies, and mind-affecting chemicals (or other means, like Magic or high technology) to make others temporarily do what you want them to do. You control the Actions of a target you touch. This effect lasts for one minute. You can allow it to act freely or override its control on a case-by-case basis as long as you can see it. When the duration ends, the target doesn't remember being controlled or anything it did while under your influence.
tooltip: You control the Actions of a target you touch for one minute.

name: Control Machine
description: You can control the functions of any machine, intelligent or otherwise, within short range. This effect lasts for ten minutes.
tooltip: You can control the functions of any machine, intelligent or otherwise, within short range. This effect lasts for ten minutes.

name: Control the Field
description: You maneuver a target into a position you desire within immediate range instead of dealing damage to it.
tooltip: You maneuver a target into a position you desire within immediate range instead of dealing damage to it.

name: Control the Savage
description: You can control a calm nonhuman beast within short range. You control it for as long as you focus all your attention on it, using your turn each round. The GM has final say over what counts as a nonhuman beast, but unless some kind of deception is at work, you should know whether you can affect a creature before you attempt to perform this Feat.
tooltip: You can control a calm nonhuman beast within short range. You control it for as long as you focus all your attention on it.

name: Control Weather
description: You change the weather in your general region. If performed indoors, this creates minor effects, such as mist, mild temperature changes, and so on. If performed outside, you can create rain, fog, snow, wind, or any other kind of normal (not overly severe) weather. The change lasts for a natural length of time, so a storm might last for an hour, fog for two or three hours, and snow for a few hours (or for ten minutes if it’s out of season). For the first ten minutes after activating this Ability, you can create more dramatic and specific effects, such as lightning strikes, giant hailstones, twisters, hurricane-force winds, and so on. These effects must occur within 1000 feet (305 m) or up to fifty hexes ⬢ or squares ■ of your location. You must spend your turn concentrating to create an effect or to maintain it in a new round. These effects inflicts damage each round.
tooltip: You change the weather in your general region, inside or outside, and do damage each round for the first ten minutes.

name: Controlled Berserker
description:
Anytime you take damage in combat, you must make a single die Logic roll; if you fail, you go berserk. If you succeed, you don't go berserk, even if you want to (you can't choose not to roll, or to use an exact roll as a failure).

While berserk, you have three dice total for every combat roll, and your mixed successes are considered regular successes instead (you can still get Intrusions on failed rolls). You automatically fail on all positive social interaction Tasks. For the duration, you Attack every living being within short range, starting with the closest. If no living being is within short range, you move to seek out potential victims.

In addition, sometimes you spontaneously go berserk when angered, surprised, or scared. When this happens, the GM may allow you to attempt a Logic roll to avoid going berserk.

Once you are berserk, you remain so for up to ten minutes, until you choose to return to normal. When you return to your normal state of mind and body immediately after going berserk, you can't go berserk again until after you have taken a Long Rest.

You can now end the berserk state at will.
tooltip: Anytime you take damage, make a single die Logic roll. If you fail, you go berserk.

name: Controlled Detonation
description: Add a die to your dice pool to deal double damage against unattended objects. Additionally, you can reduce the blast zone to practically nothing so that any explosion affects only the targeted object. Alternatively, you can have the explosion create difficult terrain within the blast radius.
tooltip: You position explosives so that they deal double damage against unattended objects, or you reduce the blast zone to a controlled area.

name: Convincing Argument
description: Add a die to your dice pool in interactions where you are attempting to convince someone that you should be exempt from being charged for minor offenses, or that you should be spared from punishment for some minor infraction.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when attempting to convince someone that you should be exempt from being punished.

name: Coordinated Action
description: If two or more allies with this Feat work together to accomplish a Task, even if one or both are not trained in that Task, all squad members get an extra die on their Task roll.
tooltip: Add a die to a Task roll if all squad members are performing the same Task together.

name: Corrosive Agent
description:
Add a die to your dice pool to throw a bomb that deals ambient damage to everyone in immediate range of the initial explosion. Over the course of two rounds following the explosion, a circle of corrosive acid grows from the impact point, first covering a diameter equal to short range in the first follow-up round, then a diameter equal to long range in the second follow-up round. If a character or creature is within the corrosive circle when it grows, remain in the circle on their turn, or move into the circle on their turn, they take additional ambient damage.

The corrosive circle of acid remains dangerous for a total of 3+1d6 rounds, at which point the ground can be walked on again, though it may collapse from the strain. The ground may collapse earlier depending on the material.
tooltip: You throw a bomb that deals damage to everyone in immediate range, then causes a growing circle of corrosive acid.

name: Cottonmouth
description: Whenever you get a mixed success on Tasks involving verbal communication or relaying information, you fail the roll instead and get an Intrusion.
tooltip: If you get a mixed success on Tasks involving verbal communication or relaying information, you fail the roll instead and get an Intrusion.

name: Countermeasures
description: You immediately end one ongoing Magical effect within immediate range. Alternatively, you can perform this Feat as a defense action to cancel any incoming Magical Ability targeted at you, or you can cancel any Magic device or the effect of any Magic device for 1d6 rounds. You must touch the effect or device to cancel it. You can use this Ability if you’ve already acted this round if performing this Feat to defend against an Attack of some kind.
tooltip: You end one ongoing Magical effect, cancel an incoming Magical Ability targeted at you, or you cancel a Magic device for 1d6 rounds.

name: Covering Fire
description: You two arrows at once from your bow, causing the target to be stunned for one round, and dazed in the following round.
tooltip: You two arrows at once from your bow, causing the target to be stunned for one round, and dazed in the following round.

name: Cracked Mask
description: Cracks begin to show in the mask you have constructed for yourself. Add a die to your dice pool in any social interaction in which you decide to show your true nature. People may become hostile toward you once they learn of your true nature.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool in any social interaction in which you decide to show your true nature.

name: Crash
tooltip: Intrusions do not award XP until you've had a Long Rest, and are specific to your drug's side-effects.

name: Crawl Out of Bed
description: Can only be used if you're Resting. Attempt to get up from your Power Nap Rest by rolling for Logic. If you succeed, you can resume normal Actions next round. If you fail, you continue Resting.
tooltip: Attempt to get up from your Power Nap Rest. If you succeed, resume normal Actions next round. If you fail, continue Resting.

name: Create Darkness
description: You cause shadows to spring up from a spot within short range for up to one minute, enveloping the area in darkness. The shadows must fit within a 10-foot (3 m) cube. You can choose to simply make bright lights dim or completely dark (blinding any target within the area that can't see in the dark). You can move the area of shadows up to a short distance each round as part of another Action. You can also create a scene within the area of darkness, intimidating or scaring those within.
tooltip: You cause shadows to spring up from a spot within short range for up to one minute, enveloping the area in darkness.

name: Creeping Frost
description: You create a creeping circle of frost at a point you choose within short range. The circle extends up to short range in all directions, dealing damage to everything in the area as it chills the air and climbs surfaces that contact the floor. The circle creeps about an immediate range each round, only stopping only once you Rest, it hits a heat source or you use an Action to stop it.
tooltip: You create a creeping circle of frost that deals damage to everything in immediate range at a point you choose within short range.

name: Creeping Shadow
description: You are able to meld into shadows into the floor or wall, and re-emerge anywhere within short range, as long as a shadow exists where you want to exit. If a shadow can pass through a physical barrier, such as under a door or through a crack or keyhole, then so can you. If for some reason there are no longer any shadows once you disappear, you exit in the first available source of shadow—regardless of how far away it is.
tooltip: You meld into shadows in a floor or wall and re-emerge anywhere within short range, as long as a shadow exists where you want to exit.

name: Critical Help
description: When you successfully Help someone with a Task, you cause the target to automatically succeed at their Task.
tooltip: You Help someone with a Task, causing the target to automatically succeed at their Task if you succeed.

name: Critical Hit
description: Add two dice to your dice pool when Attacking with your chosen weapon.
tooltip: Add two dice to your dice pool when Attacking with your chosen weapon.

name: Crucial Information
description: You receive a brief vision of an important person or event chosen by the GM. This could be a villain, a disaster, or a private conversation. This power may only be used once per day.
tooltip: You receive a brief vision of an important person or event chosen by the GM. This could be a villain, a disaster, or a private conversation.

name: Cruelty
description: When you use force, you can choose to maim or deliver painful injuries to draw out your target’s suffering. Whenever you inflict damage, you can choose to remove one die from your dice pool for the Attack. In exchange, you get a guaranteed success the next time you Attack the same target.
tooltip: Remove a die from your dice pool when you Attack. In exchange, get a guaranteed success the next time you Attack the same target.

name: Crush
description: You crush one non living object that is smaller than you. The object crumbles to dust. If the GM feels it appropriate to the circumstances, you can crush a portion of an object (the total volume of which is smaller than you) rather than the entire thing.
tooltip: You crush one non living object that is smaller than you. The object crumbles to dust.

name: Crystal Adept
description:
Select one of the following Abilities:

  • Lightning Flash
  • Stasis

The Ability is represented by crystal you've embedded into your skin, in whatever form you've decided on.

name: Crystal Beginner
description:
Select one of the following Abilities:

  • Psionic Burn
  • Fleet of Foot

The Ability is represented by crystal you've embedded into your skin, in whatever form you've decided on.

name: Crystal Enhancements
description:
You either have whole crystals embedded into your body through Cyberware, or you have tattoos made from crystal dust ink. Whatever the case may be, these crystals give you access to Psi Magic without needing to master it as a Recondite would. Whenever you use a Magical Ability, your crystals noticeably glow in response. Proficiency in the use of Psi Magic is dependent on the knowledge of the individual and is limited by their constitution. Individuals can only use Psi Magic for so long before succumbing to fatigue or worse.

If you already have Magical Abilities, you may use the embedded crystals as a focus, adding an additional die to your dice pool on Magic rolls; this means you can roll at least two Magic dice instead of just one when you use Magic. However, you must roll twice for all other (non-Magic) Tasks you perform for the following ten minutes and take the least favourable result. You can use this effect as often as you want, but the negative effects accumulate. So, if you use the crystals twice in a row, you will be at a disadvantage for twenty minutes, thrice in a row results in a thirty minute period of disadvantage, and so on.

You cannot use your crystals to focus the Abilities you have gained from your Focus.
tooltip: You have crystals embedded in your body that give you access to Psi Magic without needing to master it, and allow you to focus Magic.

name: Crystal Exhaustion
tooltip: Roll twice on every (non-Magic) roll and use the least favourable result. Add another 10 minutes each time you use your crystals.

name: Crystal Expert
description:
Select one of the following Abilities:

  • Elemental Protection
  • Show of Force

The Ability is represented by crystal you've embedded into your skin, in whatever form you've decided on.

name: Crystal Focus
description:
You use the embedded crystals as a focus, adding an additional Magic die to any Magic roll; this means you can roll at least two Magic dice instead of just one when you use Magic. However, you must roll twice for all other (non-Magic) Tasks you perform for the following ten minutes and take the least favourable result. You can use this effect as often as you want, but the negative effects accumulate. So, if you use the crystals twice in a row, you will be at a disadvantage for twenty minutes, thrice in a row results in a thirty minute period of disadvantage, and so on.

You cannot use your crystals to focus the Abilities you have gained from your Focus.
tooltip: Add an additional Magic die to any Magic roll (at least two Magic dice instead of just one). Causes Crystal Exhaustion.

name: Crystal Infuser
description:
Equipment necessary to embed crystals into your skin, or a Contact that will do it for you at no charge. Select one of the following:

  • Crystal Expert
  • Crystal-Embedding Device

name: Crystal Master
description:
Select one of the following Abilities:

  • Psi Barrier
  • Door

The Ability is represented by crystal you've embedded into your skin, in whatever form you've decided on.

name: Crystal Novice
description:
Select one of the following Abilities:

  • Command
  • Obscure

The Ability is represented by crystal you've embedded into your skin, in whatever form you've decided on.

name: Cure
description: You attempt to cancel or cure one malady (such as disease or poison) in a target.
tooltip: You attempt to cancel or cure one malady (such as disease or poison) in a target.

name: Cure
description: Add a die to your dice pool to attempt to cancel or cure one malady (such as disease or poison) in a target.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool to attempt to cancel or cure one malady (such as disease or poison) in a target.

name: Curiosity
description:
You are trained in one of the following:
  • Conduct Tests
  • Pathfinding
  • Storytelling

name: Curse
description: You cause an effect equivalent to an Intrusion against a target within short range.
tooltip: You cause an effect equivalent to an Intrusion against a target within short range.

name: Curse of the Nox'zh'r
description: The Nightmare’s Attack causes a film of darkness to cover the victim’s eyes like a caul. The target is blinded until it rips off the caul, which inflicts damage once removed.
tooltip: The Nightmare’s blinds its target. The target is blinded until it rips off the caul blocking its sight, which inflicts damage once removed.

name: Curse of the Nox'zh'r
description: The Nightmare’s Attack causes a film of darkness to cover the victim’s eyes like a caul. The target is blinded until it rips off the caul.
tooltip: The Nightmare’s blinds its target. The target is blinded until it rips off the caul blocking its sight.

name: Cyclone of Hate
description: You focus on the objects moved by your Emotional Storm Ability, making them move faster to deal damage to everyone (including allies) within immediate distance from you.
tooltip: You cause the objects moving around you to damage to everyone (including allies) within immediate distance from you.

name: Cyclone of Rage
description:
You focus on the objects moved by your Emotional Tempest Ability, making them move faster to deal damage to targets within immediate distance from you.

You now have more control over your power, allowing you to choose which targets to hit with objects levitated by your Emotional Tempest Ability.
tooltip: You cause the objects moving around you to damage to all targets within immediate distance from you.

name: Damn the Attacks
description: If you are aware of an Attack, you can easily avoid or shrug them off. You cannot get Intrusions if you move and take another Action in the same round.
tooltip: You cannot get Intrusions if you move and take another Action in the same round.

name: Danger Zone
tooltip: Small objects swirl around you as you experience heightened emotions, adding a die to all social Tasks for 1 minute.

name: Dangerous Inventory
description: To use the Abilities from your Focus, you must have the bombs or materials to make the bombs at hand. Discuss with the GM the best way for you to have the proper "ammunition" at hand. As a standard rule though, if you don't have a bomb or other concoctions in your inventory, you can mix the concoction and use it in the same round, as long as all of the necessary components are within immediate range.
tooltip: You must have bombs or materials to make bombs at hand to use the Abilities from your Focus.

name: Daring Maneuver
description: If you use your Action to urge your mount or boost your vehicle to take Action—such as jumping a ravine—add one die to your dice pool for the Action.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool to urge your mount or boost your vehicle to take a risky riding or piloting Action.

name: Dazzling Radiance
description: You send a barrage of blinding light at a target within short range, blinding them until the end of the next round. Has no effect if the target relies on senses other than sight to “see.”
tooltip: You send a barrage of blinding light at a target within short range, blinding them until the end of the next round.

name: Deadly Aim
description: Add a die to your dice pool when making a ranged Attack with a single-action weapon (like a rifle, bow, semi-automatic pistol, etc.)
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when making a ranged Attack with a single-action weapon (like a rifle, bow, semi-automatic pistol, etc.)

name: Deadly Attack
description: If you strike a target and get your exact number or a critical success with your chosen weapon, you kill the target instantly. Cannot kill PCs in this way.
tooltip: You strike a target with your chosen weapon. If get your exact number or a critical success, you kill the target instantly.

name: Death Gaze
description: You project a chilling gaze at all living beings within short range who can see you. Success means that the target is frozen in fear, not moving or taking Actions for one minute or until it is Attacked. Some beings without minds (such as robots) might be immune to Death Gaze.
tooltip: You project a chilling gaze at all living beings within short range who can see you.

name: Debate
description: When trying to establish the truth or come to a decision, you can sway the verdict with masterful rhetoric. Add a die to any persuasion or deception Task.
tooltip: You can sway a verdict with masterful rhetoric. Add a die to any persuasion or deception Task.

name: Debilitating Strike
description: You make an Attack to deliver a painful or debilitating melee strike, damaging and dazing the target for one round.
tooltip: You make an Attack to deliver a painful or debilitating melee strike, damaging and dazing the target for one round.

name: Debilitating Strike
description: You make an Attack to deliver a painful or debilitating strike, damaging and dazing the target for one round.
tooltip: You make an Attack to deliver a painful or debilitating strike, damaging and dazing the target for one round.

name: Decipher
description: If you spend a moment examining a piece of writing or code in a language you do not understand, you can get the gist of the message.
tooltip: You spend a moment examining a piece of writing or code in a language you do not understand to get the gist of the message.

name: Deep Thinker
description:
While you are alone, you are able to remember something from your prior experience that can help you in your current situation, such as a map of the caverns you are exploring. You can also recall important lore or history, where you would otherwise be at a loss when with a group of people.

Also, if working alone on a puzzle or problem, you can ask the GM for a hint once per problem you are trying to solve. If tackling multiple problems at once, the GM will determine how many hints to provide.
tooltip: You recall a piece of knowledge, or receive a hint when working on a problem on your own.

name: Deep Water Guide
description: While underwater, any target you choose that can see you can follow in your wake at the same speed as you.
tooltip: You help a target that can see you can follow in your wake at the same speed as you while underwater.

name: Defend
description: You can take the Guarding Action once per round without spending your Action to do so, so long as you are defending someone physically weaker than you. Your second Action can be a Feat, if you wish.
tooltip: You Guard someone physically weaker than you, allowing you to take another Action in the same turn.

name: Defend All the Innocent
description: If beings you have designated as an innocent stand next to you, you can Take an Attack for them in addition to your normal Action on your turn. You can perform this Feat multiple times in a single round.
tooltip: You Take the Attack for all beings in immediate range you've designated as innocent.

name: Defend the Innocent
description: If someone you have designated as an innocent stands next to you, you can Take an Attack for them in addition to your normal Action on your turn. You can protect only one innocent character or creature at a time each round, but you can perform this Feat multiple times to protect that one being.
tooltip: You Take the Attack for a being you've designated as innocent. Can use multiple times each round.

name: Defense Against Robots
description: You have studied your enemy and can anticipate the actions that an automaton or machine is likely to take in a fight. Treat mixed successes against robots as successes, avoiding the negative effects in the process.
tooltip: Treat mixed successes against robots as successes, avoiding the negative effects in the process.

name: Defensive Phasing
description: You can change your phase once per day so that some Attacks pass through you harmlessly, avoiding the negative effects of a mixed success in the process. You can perform this Feat even if you've already acted this round.
tooltip: You change your phase, avoiding the negative effects of a mixed success in the process. Only usable once per day.

name: Desensitization
description: It just gets worse and worse; you're just used to it by now. With each Intrusion you receive, you become more and more numb to the effects. Your first Intrusion occurs normally. On your second Intrusion, you still fail the roll, but instead of an Intrusion, you get the equivalent of mixed success negative effects. On your third Intrusion onward, you still fail the roll, but you ignore the Intrusion. This effect resets after a Long Rest.
tooltip: On your second Intrusion, fail the roll but get mixed success negative effects. Ignore your third Intrusion onward.

name: Designate
description: You assign an “innocent” or “guilty” label to a being within immediate range, based on your general assessment of a given situation or a predominant feeling. In other words, someone who is labeled “innocent” can be innocent in a certain circumstance, or they can be generally innocent of terrible crimes (such as murder, major theft, and so on). Likewise, you can declare that a being is “guilty” of a particular crime or of terrible deeds in general. The accuracy of your assessment isn't important as long as you believe it to be the truth; the GM may require you to give a rationale. Henceforth, add a die to your dice pool when you socially interact with someone you designate as innocent or guilty. You can change your assessment, but it requires another designation Action. The benefits of the designation last until you change it or until you are shown proof that it is wrong.
tooltip: You assign an “innocent” or “guilty” label to a being within immediate range. You must rationalize your assessment.

name: Destined for Greatness
description: You enjoy uncanny luck as if something was watching over you and keeping you from harm. Whenever you get an Intrusion, make a Feelings roll. If you succeed, you do not get the Intrusion. Otherwise, you can treat the Intrusion as normal (including the option to refuse it, if you so desire).
tooltip: Whenever you get an Intrusion, make a Feelings roll. If you succeed, you do not get the Intrusion.

name: Destroy Weapon
description: If you are wielding a melee weapon, add two dice to your dice pool to Attack your target, destroying the weapon in the process. For example, you may swing a staff so hard that it explodes into splinters, or snap a sword at the hilt once it's wedged in the enemy's armour. If wielding a ranged weapon, you can quickly disassemble it so that it is no longer functional, and would require several minutes to repair or put back together.
tooltip: Add two dice to your dice pool on a melee Attack with a weapon, destroying it in the process, or to disassemble a ranged weapon.

name: Devoted Defender
description: You are more capable when finding, healing, interacting with, and protecting your ward. You can have only one ward at a time.
tooltip: You are more capable when finding, healing, interacting with, and protecting your ward. You can have only one ward at a time.

name: Diffuse Situation
description: During the course of an investigation, your questions sometimes elicit an angry or even violent response. Through dissembling, verbal distraction, or similar evasion, you prevent a living being from Attacking anyone or anything or one round.
tooltip: Through dissembling, verbal distraction, or similar evasion, you prevent a living being from Attacking anyone or anything or one round.

name: Dirty Fighter
description: You distract, blind, annoy, hamper, or otherwise interfere with a target, dazing them for one minute.
tooltip: You distract, blind, annoy, hamper, or otherwise interfere with a target, dazing them for one minute.

name: Disable Mechanisms
description:
With a keen eye and quick moves, you disrupt some of an automaton’s functions and inflict upon it one of the following maladies:

  • The robot is dazed for one minute.
  • The robot’s speed is halved.
  • The robot can take no Action for one round.
  • The robot is unable to speak for one minute.

You must touch the robot to disrupt it.
tooltip: With a keen eye and quick moves, you disrupt some of an automaton’s functions. You must touch the robot to disrupt it.

name: Disappear
description: You become invisible for ten minutes. While invisible, you are almost imperceptible to others. This effect ends if you do something to reveal your presence or position—Attacking, using an Ability, moving a large object, and so on. If this occurs, you can regain the remaining invisibility effect by taking an Action to focus on hiding your position. Action to initiate or reinitiate.
tooltip: You become invisible for ten minutes. This effect ends if you do something to reveal your presence or position.

name: Disarm With Humour
description: You can use your Action to convince a hostile, intelligent being who can understand you to take no Action for one round. They must be able to perceive and understand you.
tooltip: You convince a hostile, intelligent being who can understand you to take no Action for one round.

name: Disembody
description:
With a touch, you separate a spirit from its host body, launching the spirit a short distance away from the body. The body falls prone to the floor, while the spirit is stunned for one round. The spirit can only move and speak while separated from its body (unless otherwise modified by another Ability), which it must return to in order to regain control. The spirit is invisible to all but those sensitive to its presence.

If the body is destroyed before the spirit reaches it, or the spirit takes a significant amount of time to return to the body, it will dissipate and the target is effectively dead. The body is inert until a spirit or some other means animates it.
tooltip: You separate a spirit from its host body, launching the spirit a short distance away from the body, stunning the spirit for one round.

name: Disguise
description: You appear to be someone or something else to all targets within long range, roughly of your size and shape, for up to one hour. Once created, the disguise requires no concentration. For each additional Action you spend, you can disguise one other target at your touch. All disguised creatures and characters must stay within sight of you or lose their disguise. If you encounter a new set of targets, you must re-create the hallucination for them since only those affected by this Ability will view you in your disguise.
tooltip: You (or a target you touch) appear to be someone or something else to all targets within long range for up to one hour.

name: Distant Activation
description: You can activate or deactivate any machine you can see within short range, even if normally you would have to touch or manually operate the device. To perform this Feat, you must understand the function of the machine and it can't be connected to another intelligence (or be intelligent itself).
tooltip: You can activate or deactivate any machine you can see within short range.

name: Distinctive Physical Trait
description:
You have a unique physical aspect that is, well, bizarre. You might have purple hair or metal spikes on your head. Maybe you have nothing but a massive scar where your nose used to be, or you were born without a nose. Perhaps your hands don't connect to your arms, although they move as if they do. Maybe a third eye stares out from the side of your head, or superfluous tendrils grow from your back. Whatever it is, your quirk might be a mutation, a supernatural trait (a blessing or curse), or a feature with no explanation.

This physical trait makes it so you are unable to refuse Intrusions as a result of social interactions, though you still receive XP for them. You weirdness also seems to react to Magic, causing you to receive no XP for Magic Intrusions, though you can still refuse those kinds of Intrusions.
tooltip: You have a strange physical quirk. You can't refuse Intrusions from social interactions, and you receive no XP for Magic Intrusions.

name: Distortion
description: You modify how a willing target within short range reflects light for one round. The target rapidly shifts between its normal appearance and a blot of darkness, making Attacks against it more difficult. For the duration, the affected target can ignore negative effects from mixed successes for combat Tasks (including Attacks).
tooltip: You modify how a target reflects light for one round so they ignore negative effects from mixed successes for combat Tasks.

name: Distortion
description:
You modify how a willing target within short range reflects light for one round. The target rapidly shifts between its normal appearance and a blot of darkness, making Attacks against it more difficult. For the duration, the affected target can ignore negative effects from mixed successes for combat Tasks (including Attacks).

You may only perform this Feat through your Flash of Genius or Brilliant Blaze traits.
tooltip: You modify how a target reflects light for one round so they ignore negative effects from mixed successes for combat Tasks.

name: Distract
description: While talking, you annoy and distract a target, even if they can't understand you. For as long as you do nothing but speak (you can't even move), the target takes no Actions other than to defend itself, even over multiple rounds. If they are Attacked, the effect ends.
tooltip: You distract a target by talking to it, forcing it to do nothing else but defend itself against Attacks until you stop or it's Attacked.

name: Distraction
description: You distract a target within immediate range, causing them to take no Action on their next turn.
tooltip: You distract a target within immediate range, causing them to take no Action on their next turn.

name: Divide Your Mind
description: You split your consciousness into two parts. You can take two Actions on your turn, but only one of them can be to perform a Feat.
tooltip: You take two Actions on your turn, but only one of them can be to perform a Feat.

name: Divine Avatar
tooltip: Your body becomes irradiated with Divine light, emitting enough light to illuminate a 100 foot radius around your body.

name: Divine Cleric
description:
Divine Magic was barely understood before Terrans colonized Plumeth. Psi Magic has always been easier for Erelen and Aeyen to use, so that they rarely dabbled in Divine Magic. However, Terrans seem naturally attuned to Divine Magic, wielding it with an uncanny familiarity. The Divine religion was founded by Terrans in reverence to the power Divine Magic brings. The Fellowship of the Divine is an organization composed mainly of Divine Clerics who heal and provide spiritual support while simultaneously preaching the Divine pact. Aeyen and Erelen were eventually able to learn how to use Divine Magic more effectively by emulating Terrans, though they are not necessarily a part of the associated religious organizations.

Whether you are an active member of the Followers of the Divine or use Divine Magic without adhering to any specific beliefs, you have a connection to the Divine that allows you to heal and cleanse your allies, as well as attack your targets with burning light. Divine Magic is particularly effective against Psi users, artificial lifeforms and cyborgs. You also have access to the specialization Focus:

  • Enforces the Divine's Will

name: Divine Infusion
description: You touch a target and restore it back to full health. A target can benefit from this Ability only once each day.
tooltip: You touch a target and Restore it back to full health.

name: Divine Magic
description: Whenever you use Magic, you are calling on the power of the Divine. Divine Magic is driven by virtues strongly tied to spiritual beliefs, so practitioners of Divine Magic normally have a strong sense of conviction to drive them forward. It promotes the growth of organic life while repulsing artificial constructs and spiritual remnants.
tooltip: You can use Magic, and your Magical Abilities use Divine Magic. This applies to both offensive and support Abilities.

name: Divine Radiance
description: Your prayer calls Divine radiance from the heavens to punish an unworthy target within short range with burning light. If the target is an artificial lifeform, spirit, or something similar, it also stands in unwilling awe of the divine energy coursing through it and is unable to act on its next turn. Once exposed to this blessing, the target can't be awed by this Attack again for several hours.
tooltip: Divine radiance comes down from the heavens to punish a target within short range. Also dazes artificial lifeform, spirits, or similar.

name: Divine Shield
description: Divine Magic forms a protective aura around you, emitting faint light to those sensitive to such things. Psi Magic users, cyborgs and artificial lifeforms feel a burning sensation at your touch.
tooltip: Divine Magic forms a protective aura around you, emitting faint light to those sensitive to such things. Psi users, cyborgs and artificial lifeforms feel a burning sensation at your touch.

name: Dodge & Resist
description: If you get an Intrusion on your Attack roll, you can roll again and take the more favourable result.
tooltip: You make an Attack roll. If you get an Intrusion, you can roll again and take the more favourable result.

name: Dominate Spirit
description: You can command a spirit remnant or an animated dead being within short range. If you are successful, the target cannot will never Attack you and will follow your verbal commands if it can hear and understand you until it dissipates. However, it will not follow you if you leave the location it originated from.
tooltip: You can command a spirit remnant or an animated dead being within short range until it dissipates, or you leave the area.

name: Dominating Cry
description: You control the next Action of up to four targets in immediate range if they take that Action within one round. This effect does not grant you mental contact with the targets or the ability to sense what they sense. A dominated target fully remembers that you took control of it.
tooltip: You control the next Action of up to four targets in immediate range if they take that Action within one round.

name: Don't Go Alone
description: You fall to pieces when you have to undertake a dangerous Task alone. If you get a mixed success on a Task for something potentially dangerous (such as Attacking a creature by yourself), you fail the roll instead and get an Intrusion. If you get your exact number under these circumstances, you cannot ask the GM a question and must treat the roll as a regular success.
tooltip: If you get a mixed success when alone, you fail the roll and get an Intrusion. On your exact number, you cannot ask the GM a question.

name: Don't You Know Who I Am
description: You verbally harangue a living being who can hear you so forcefully that it is unable to take any Action, including making Attacks, for one round. Whether you succeed or fail, the target is dazed on the next Action it takes.
tooltip: You verbally harangue a target so forcefully that it is unable to take any Action for one round, and is dazed on its next Action.

name: Doom
description: Every other time the GM uses an Intrusion on your character, you cannot refuse it and do not get an XP for it (you still get an XP to award to another player). This is because you are doomed. The universe is a cold, uncaring place, and your efforts are futile at best.
tooltip: Every other time the GM uses an Intrusion on your character, you cannot refuse it and do not get an XP for it.

name: Door
description: You create a simple opening in a barrier of wood, stone, metal, or other solid substance. The opening is no more than an immediate distance across, and it extends up to a short distance through the material.
tooltip: You create a simple opening in a barrier of wood, stone, metal, or other solid substance that extends up to a short distance.

name: Double Hit
description: You can use two weapons at the same time, making two separate Attack rolls on your turn as a single Action. You can only Attack one target with this Attack.
tooltip: You can use two weapons at the same time, making two separate Attack rolls on your turn as a single Action.

name: Double Shot
description: As part of the same Action, you make two ranged Attack rolls against two separate targets that are within immediate range of each other.
tooltip: You make two ranged Attack rolls against two separate targets within immediate range of each other.

name: Down With the System
description: Nothing can hold you back anymore. You've steeled yourself against society and its constant demands. You do not feel the negative effects of mixed successes from non-physical Tasks.
tooltip: Nothing can hold you back anymore. You do not feel the negative effects of mixed successes from non-physical Tasks.

name: Dragoon
description:
Dragoons are part of an elite martial force that helps to keep order and police criminal behaviour on Plumeth. They are primarily made up of Terrans, though there are a small number of Aeyen and Erelen officers as well. The Dragoon Corps are organized by Plumeth's numerous sectors, with each squadron focused on keeping order within their own district. The Dragoon Corps answer to the Terran Republic, and have no direct relationship to the Coalition of Planets. Dragoon authority extends to Plumeth's moons, but does not apply to any other colonies within the Terran Republic.

As a Dragoon, you have had the necessary physical training to make you an effective peacekeeper. You also have a limited amount of authority, depending on who you interact with.

name: Drain Charge
description: You can drain the power from an Artifact or device, allowing you to regain a small amount of health.The GM determines whether the device is fully drained (likely true of most handheld or smaller devices) or retains some power (likely true of large machines). May also work on beings that require electricity to live.
tooltip: You can drain the power from an Artifact or device, allowing you to regain health in the process.

name: Drain Power
description:
You affect the main power source of the robot, inflicting upon it all of the following four maladies:

  • The robot is dazed for one minute.
  • The robot’s speed is halved.
  • The robot can take no Action for one round.
  • The robot is unable to speak for one minute.

You must touch the robot to disrupt it.
tooltip: You affect the main power source of a robot, disrupting all of its functions for up to a minute.

name: Drained
tooltip: Remove a die from all social interactions until you’ve had the time to recharge.

name: Drained Battery
description: You feel physically drained after spending an hour or more with a large group of people without at least an hour by yourself. Remove a die from all social interactions if you have not had time to recharge.
tooltip: You feel physically drained after spending an hour or more with a large group of people without at least an hour by yourself.

name: Draw Conclusions
description: After careful observation and investigation (questioning one or more NPCs on a topic, searching an area or a file, and so on), you can learn a pertinent fact. Only usable once every hour.
tooltip: You learn a pertinent fact after careful observation and investigation. Usable once every hour.

name: Draw Liquid Fire
description: You cause lava, magma or some other superheated material (more than 500°C or 1000°F) to bubble up from a spot on the ground you can see. The planet or ship you are on must have a source of superheated matter for you to draw on, though you don't need to see it. The matter flows from that spot for as long as you concentrate, at a rate of one gallon per round.
tooltip: You cause lava, magma or some other superheated material to bubble up from a spot on the ground you can see.

name: Draw Water
description: You cause water to bubble up from a spot on the ground you can see. The planet or ship you are on must have flowing water for you to draw on, though you don't need to see it. The water flows from that spot for as long as you concentrate, at a rate of one gallon per round.
tooltip: You cause water to bubble up from a spot on the ground you can see.

name: Drive Back
description: When you deal damage with an Attack, you can drive your target away from your companions.
tooltip: You deal damage with an Attack and drive a target away from your companions.

name: Drug Consequences
tooltip: Remove one die from your dice pool for all Tasks for one hour after taking your drug.

name: Dual Defense
description: When you wield two weapons, you ignore the effects of mixed successes in combat.
tooltip: When you wield two weapons, you ignore the effects of mixed successes in combat.

name: Dual Distraction
description: When you wield two weapons, your target’s next Attack is hindered. You deal damage and daze the target for one round.
tooltip: You deal damage and daze the target for one round when you Attack with both weapons.

name: Duel to the Death
description: Choose a target. Add two dice to your dice pool when you Attack that target, or three dice if the target is engaging someone else instead of you. You can only duel one character or creature at a time. A duel lasts up to one minute, or until you break it off.
tooltip: Choose a target to duel, and add two dice to your dice pool when fighting them (or three dice if they're fighting someone else).

name: Dust to Dust
description: With a touch, you disintegrate one non living object that is smaller than you. If the GM feels it appropriate to the circumstances, you can disintegrate a portion of an object (the total volume of which is smaller than you) rather than the entire thing.
tooltip: With a touch, you disintegrate one non living object that is smaller than you.

name: Ear to the Ground
description: While within the region you patrol or defend, you always hear rumors relating to the troubles faced by the people there. Word spreads to you fast. Add two dice to your dice pool on all social interactions where you are trying to gain information on trouble within your patrol region.
tooltip: Add two dice to your dice pool on a social interaction Task where you are trying to gain information on trouble within your patrol region.

name: Earth Magic
description: Whenever you use Magic, you are unleashing the primal power of the Earth element. All sentient beings have an affinity to the elements, whether they are aware of it or not. You are particularly attuned to the element of Earth, though you still have a connection to the other elements. Those attuned to the earth are pragmatic and prefer to keep things simple.
tooltip: You can use Magic, and whenever you use Magic, you are unleashing the primal power of the Earth element.

name: Earthen Prison
description: You surround a target with impenetrable rock, keeping it from moving or acting for one minute. You must be able to see the target, and it must be within short range. While inside their earthen prison, the target is impervious to harm, cannot be moved, and is immune to all effects.
tooltip: You surround a target with impenetrable rock, keeping it from moving or acting for one minute.

name: Earthquake
description: You trigger an earthquake centered on a spot you can see within 1000 feet (305 m) or up to fifty hexes ⬢ or squares ■. The ground within 250 feet (76 m) or up to eighteen hexes ⬢ or squares ■ of that spot heaves and shakes for five minutes, causing widespread damage to structures and terrain in the area. Buildings made of wood, stone, or brick collapse; walls topple; cliffs crumble; ceilings cave in; some areas of ground rise up; and other areas sink. Creatures or characters inside collapsed buildings or beneath a crumbling cliff or falling wall are subject to crushing damage and may have to dig themselves free, as the GM decides. Furthermore, the force of the quake is sufficient to knock creatures and characters to the ground, preventing them from standing until the shaking stops.
tooltip: You trigger an earthquake for five minutes, causing widespread damage to creatures, characters, structures and terrain in the area.

name: Easily Intimidated
description: Any time you are confronted with a situation where you could suffer damage, you must first make a Logic roll. If you fail, you cannot act for one round, and when you do act, remove one die from your dice pool whenever you interact with that same threat again.
tooltip: If you fail a Logic roll when confronted with damage, you are paralyzed for one round and remove a die from your dice pool for that threat.

name: Eidetic Memory
description: You can come up with a random fact pertinent to the current situation when you wish it. This is always a matter of fact, not conjecture or supposition, and must be something you could have logically read or seen in the past. You can do this one time, although the Ability is renewed each time you Rest.
tooltip: You come up with a random fact pertinent to the current situation. You cannot do this more than once between Rests.

name: Electrical Abilities
description: You Magical Abilities Focus now use electricity. Additionally, there is a chance that your electrical Abilities will stun the target. In practice, this means the GM must roll 1d4 whenever you use your electrical abilities to determine whether they stun the target. This effect cannot happen two rounds in a row.
tooltip: Your Magical Abilities are electrical in nature. There is a chance that you will stun your target for one round when using electrical Abilities.

name: Electrical Overload
description: You create an explosion of electrical energy at a point within short range, affecting an area up to immediate range from that point. You must be able to see the location where you intend to center the explosion. The electricity inflicts damage to everything in the area.
tooltip: You create an explosion of electrical energy at a point within short range, affecting an area up to immediate range from that point.

name: Electrostasis
description: You surround a target with electricity, keeping it from moving or acting for one minute, as if frozen solid. You must be able to see the target, and it must be within short range. While in stasis, the target is impervious to harm, cannot be moved, and is immune to all effects.
tooltip: You surround a target with electricity, keeping it from moving or acting for one minute.

name: Elemental Ascendant
tooltip: You are the embodiment of the element you choose for one hour. Those who touch you take damage from your chosen element.

name: Elemental Blast
description: You Attack a target within short range using whichever element you choose. You must be able to see your target. You could shock an enemy with lightning, send a cascade of rocks at them, cause them to catch fire or cause stinging permafrost to form on their body.
tooltip: You Attack a target within short range using whatever element you choose.

name: Elemental Magic
description: Whenever you use Magic, you are unleashing the innate power of the elements. Different Magical Abilities use different elements. These include: Storm, Frost, Earth and Fire. All sentient beings have an affinity to the elements, whether they are aware of it or not.
tooltip: You can use Magic, and your Magic Abilities use Storm, Frost, Earth or Fire Magic.

name: Elemental Prison
description: You imprison a target using an element of your choice, keeping it from moving or acting for one minute. You must be able to see the target, and it must be within short range. While imprisoned, the target is impervious to harm, cannot be moved, and is immune to all effects.
tooltip: You imprison a target using an element of your choice, keeping it from moving or acting for one minute.

name: Elemental Protection
description: You and every target you designate within immediate range negates direct damage from one type of elemental damage (such as Fire, Storm or Frost). The protection is removed once the target is hit by direct damage of that element, or once you do your next Long Rest. Perfoming this Feat again before it expires on the target replaces any other elemental protections you've placed on them.
tooltip: You and every target within immediate range negates an Attack from one type of elemental damage until consumed by an Attack.

name: Elemental Scout
description: You compel the elements to create an immobile, inconspicuous elemental scout within immediate range that lasts for twenty-four hours. At any time during that duration, you can concentrate to see, hear, and smell through the elemental, no matter how far you move from it. The elemental doesn't grant you sensory capabilities beyond the norm. Action to create; Action to check.
tooltip: You compel the elements to create an immobile, inconspicuous elemental scout within immediate range that lasts for twenty-four hours.

name: Elementalist
description:
All life forms within the Artilum Tem galaxy have some kind of Magical affinity, allowing them to interact with elemental forces that make up their worlds. Elementalists are those who can tap directly into these elements, allowing them to control them to shape the world around them or bring destruction down on their foes. Few people are able to master elemental Magics, as they are chaotic and require intense focus. But those that do accomplish terrifying feats of Magic—unmatched even by psionics.

As an Elementalist, you have a lot of freedom in what element(s) you want to control. You can specialize based on your species' Magical affinity, or diversify for more utility. You also have access to a few specialization Foci:

  • Changes the Nature of Things
  • Harbours a Familiar
  • is Born of Flame
  • is Stoneskined
  • Rides the Storm

name: Embraced
tooltip: You no longer remove a die from your dice pool for social interactions, but there's a chance your actions will not be your own.

name: Emergency Repairs
description: Add a die to your dice pool to repair a modest amount of damage done to your vessel. You must be within range of the damage, or have some way to repair the damage remotely.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool to repair a modest amount of damage done to your vessel. You must have some way to physically repair the ship.

name: Emotional Gale
description: Your emotions overcome you as all small objects in your immediate area are lifted into the air, adding a die to your dice pool on all social Tasks for one minute. You must be in a heightened emotional state for this Ability to function.
tooltip: Small objects in your immediate area are lifted into the air, adding a die to your dice pool on all social Tasks for 1 minute.

name: Emotional Storm
description:
Your emotions overcome you as all small objects in your immediate area are lifted into the air, adding a die to your dice pool on all social Tasks for one minute. You must be in a heightened emotional state for this Ability to function.

You also now ignore the negative effects of mixed successes for the duration as objects begin spinning around you quickly.
tooltip: Lift small objects around you to add a die to all social Tasks and ignore the negative effects of mixed successes for 1 minute.

name: Emotional Tempest
description:
Your emotions overcome you as small objects in your immediate area are lifted into the air, adding a die to your dice pool on all social Tasks and making you ignore the negative effects of mixed successes for one minute. You must be in a heightened emotional state for this Ability to function.

You now have more control over your power, allowing you to choose which objects to pick up in your immediate area.
tooltip: Lift small objects around you to add a die to all social Tasks and ignore negative effects of mixed successes for 1 minute.

name: Enable Others
description: Whenever you choose to Help another character with a physical Task (including Attacks), add two dice to your dice pool regardless of your training in that Skill.
tooltip: Add two dice to your dice pool when Helping someone with a physical Task, regardless of your training in that Skill.

name: Enchant
description: You render a hostile person friendly, or a friendly person obsessed with you for the next hour. The target must be able to see you.
tooltip: You render a hostile person friendly, or a friendly person obsessed with you for the next hour. The target must be able to see you.

name: Encourage
description: While you maintain this Ability through ongoing inspiring oration, your allies within short range add a die to their dice pool for any one Skill that you are trained in.
tooltip: Through ongoing inspiring oration, your allies within short range add a die to their dice pool for a specific Task of your choice.

name: Enhance Natural Biology
description:
You've developed drug cocktails specifically designed to work with your own biochemistry. It makes you smarter, faster, or tougher, but when it wears off, the crash is a doozy, so you use it only in desperate situations. When you take your drug, you can spend an Action to automatically succeed on the next Task you attempt. Immediately after though, you start going downhill, removing one die from your dice pool for every subsequent Task for one hour.

You can't gain the benefit of your drugs again for one hour after consuming them.

Taking your drug consumes the Item in your inventory. It is possible for you to not have the drugs on hand.
tooltip: You take a drug of your own design so that you automatically succeed on your next Task, but causing you to crash right afterwards.

name: Enhanced Phase Attack
description: The Attack you make on this turn goes right through any armour or clothing your target is wearing, damaging them and sending them out of phase, unable to take any Action for three rounds. The Ability works for whatever kind of Attack you use (melee, ranged, energy, and so on).
tooltip: You Attack your target through their armour or clothing, damaging them and sending them out of phase for three rounds.

name: Enlightenment
description: Your power and beliefs give you Insight into the tapestry of reality. You can use your Action to ask the GM a question, which they must answer truthfully. Gaining knowledge of the future is impossible, and you can only ask once between Rests.
tooltip: You can ask the GM a question, which they must answer truthfully. You can only ask once between Rests.

name: Enraged
tooltip: While in a state of greater frenzy, you are silenced, but you add two dice to your dice pool on all physical Tasks.

name: Enraged Rebuttal
description: You. Are. So. Angry! After failing or receiving a mixed success on a roll, you can take an Action out of turn and immediately perform any Task, adding a die to your dice pool for whatever it is you want to do. You can perform this Feat even if you already acted this round.
tooltip: After failing or receiving a mixed success on a roll, you can take an Action out of turn, adding a die to your dice pool for any Task.

name: Enthralled
description: Add a die to your dice pool when attempting a Task directly related to your current obsession.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when attempting a Task directly related to your current obsession.

name: Entourage
description: Your entourage (five twenty-somethings) accompanies you wherever you go unless you purposefully disband it for a particular outing. You can ask them to deliver things for you, run messages, pick up your dry cleaning—pretty much whatever you want, within reason. They can also run interference if you're trying to avoid someone, help hide you from media attention, help you muscle through a crowd, and so on. On the other hand, if a situation becomes physically violent, they retreat to safety.
tooltip: You have an entourage that can perform various Tasks, but will flee at the first sign of combat.

name: Entrance
description: You catch the eye of a person, forcing them to only worry about you for one round. They can Attack, but only if you are the target.
tooltip: You catch the eye of a person, forcing them to only worry about you for one round. They can Attack, but only if you are the target.

name: Erase Memories
description: You reach into the mind of a target within immediate range and erase up to the last five minutes of its memory.
tooltip: You reach into the mind of a target within immediate range and erase up to the last five minutes of its memory.

name: Erase Memories
description: You reach into the mind of a being within immediate range and erase up to the last five minutes of its memory.
tooltip: You reach into the mind of a being within immediate range and erase up to the last five minutes of its memory.

name: Erelan
description: Erelen are native to Erelon, sharing a planet with the K'ohma and the Aeyen. The Erelan Empire has the prestige of being the longest surviving civilization, and it claims Erelon, its moons, and many of Truoth's satellites as part of its territory. The Erelan Empire is also one of the three major states belonging to the Coalition of Planets. Erelen tend to look out for more primitive beings, feeling a need to teach, protect and uplift them. Their desire to help others is genuine, though some may mistake their altruism as arrogance. Erelen live a naturalistic lifestyle, coaxing nature to fit their needs and adapting to their environment as much as possible.

name: Erratic Behaviour
description: You are prone to acting erratically or irrationally. When you are in the presence of major phenomena or subjected to great stress (such as a serious physical threat), the GM can use an Intrusion to direct your next Action without awarding XP. You can still pay 1 XP to refuse the Intrusion. The GM’s influence is the manifestation of your madness and thus is always something you would not likely do otherwise, but it is not directly, obviously harmful to you unless there are extenuating circumstances. For example, if a target suddenly leaps out of the darkness, you might spend the first round babbling incoherently or screaming the name of your pet rat—which is crazy, since you don't have a pet rat.
tooltip: The GM can use Intrusions to direct your next Action without awarding XP. You can still pay 1 XP to refuse the Intrusion.

name: Escape
description:
You escape, wriggle free from bindings, or squeeze through a tight spot. Alternatively, you can end an ongoing negative effect like poison or a curse.

You may only perform this Feat through your Flash of Genius or Brilliant Blaze talents.
tooltip: You escape, wriggle free from bindings, squeeze through a tight spot, or end an ongoing negative effect like poison or a curse.

name: Escape Plan
description: When you kill a target, you can attempt a stealth Action in addition to any other Action(s) you've taken that round to immediately hide from anyone around, assuming that a suitable hiding place is nearby. You can perform this Feat only if you've killed a target this round, but you can perform it even if you've already taken an Action.
tooltip: After killing a target, you attempt a stealth Action. Can perform even if you've already acted this round.

name: Establish Negotiations
description: You immediately pause combat, so long as all of the participants are sentient beings, allowing for five minutes of negotiation. Once active, beings are allowed to move as they wish, but fleeing the scene or Attacking another being may re-initiate combat.
tooltip: You immediately pause combat, so long as all of the participants are sentient beings, allowing for five minutes of negotiation.

name: Eternal Breath
description: A target you touch can breathe where air is thin or there's no atmosphere without the need for an envirosuit for ten minutes.
tooltip: A target you touch can breathe where air is thin or there's no atmosphere without the need for an envirosuit for 10 minutes.

name: Evanesce
description: You step into shadows or behind cover, and everyone who was observing you completely loses track of you. Although you're not invisible, you can't be seen until you reveal yourself again by moving out of the shadows or from behind cover (or by making an Attack).
tooltip: You step into shadows or behind cover, and everyone who was observing you completely loses track of you.

name: Everything Is a Weapon
description: You can take any small object—a coin, a pen, a bottle, a stone, and so on—and throw it with such force and precision that it inflicts damage.
tooltip: You can take any small object and throw it with such force and precision that it inflicts damage.

name: Exacerbation
description:
Select one of the following for each of your personalities; each option must be exclusive to one personality. If you only have two personalities, only select two of the three options:

  • Intelligent Conversation
  • Power Strike
  • Rapid Shot

name: Experimental Bomb
description:
You launch an experimental bomb at a target in long range, causing one of the following random effects in addition to dealing damage:

  1. Daze
  2. Fear
  3. Disarm
  4. Blind
  5. Silence
  6. Pacify
  7. Pin
  8. Poison
  9. Stasis
  10. Infect

Roll 1d10 if successful on your Attack roll to determine which effect will be applied to the target.
tooltip: You launch an experimental bomb at a target in long range, causing one of ten random effects in addition to dealing damage.

name: Expert
description: Instead of rolling, you can choose to automatically succeed on a Task you're trained in. The Task can't be an Attack roll, and you must Rest between each use.
tooltip: You automatically succeed on a Task you're trained in. The Task can't be an Attack roll, and you must Rest between each use.

name: Explorer
description:
You are a person of action and physical ability, fearlessly facing the unknown. You travel to strange, exotic, and dangerous places, and discover new things. This means you’re physical but also probably knowledgeable. You do not necessarily have any special Abilities except for a thirst for the new and the undiscovered.

However, not all Explorers are out traipsing through uninhabited worlds or poking about an old ruin. Sometimes, an explorer is a teacher, a scientist, a detective, or an investigative reporter. In any event, an Explorer bravely faces new challenges and gathers knowledge to share with others.

name: Extinguish Flames
description: You can extinguish a blazing fire over the course of a few rounds. If the fire is particularly large, you disperse only a portion of it a few miles in radius. If the fire is Magical, you suppress the effects of the fire within a protective bubble of harmless flames that surrounds you and everyone standing next to you for one hour.
tooltip: You extinguish a blazing fire over the course of a few rounds. If the fire is Magical, you suppress the effects of the fire instead.

name: Eye for Detail
description: When you spend time thoroughly exploring an area no larger than a typical room, you can ask the GM a question about the area of interest and they must answer truthfully. Can only use once between each Rest.
tooltip: You can ask the GM a question about a specific area if you spend the time exploring it.

name: Eye Gouge
description: You make an Attack against a target with an eye. If you hit, the target has trouble seeing for the next hour.
tooltip: You make an Attack against a target with an eye. If you hit, the target has trouble seeing for the next hour.

name: Faint
description: You fall unconscious for ten minutes, escaping the encounter unnoticed by your targets. This counts as an extra Short Rest in addition to your regular Short Rest, if you so desire. Can only use this once in between each Long Rest.
tooltip: You fall unconscious for ten minutes, escaping the encounter unnoticed by your targets.

name: Fake-out
description: You're not really hurt at all! Choose to regain full health, throw off a condition (including a curse, sleep, turned to stone, or other ongoing effect), or ignore an Intrusion (though you'd still fail the roll). Once you perform this Feat, it is not available again until after you make a Long Rest. You can perform this Feat even if you already acted this round.
tooltip: You regain full health, throw off a condition, or change a failed die result to a critical success.

name: False Faces
description:
They say that some people can read faces like one would read an open book. If that's true, then your book would be full of empty, blank pages. People you meet are never too sure what to make of you.

You do feel the negative effects of mixed successes on social interactions rolls; this means your mixed successes are effectively just regular successes.
tooltip: You do feel the negative effects of mixed successes on social interaction rolls.

name: Familiar Face
description:
You have been officially hired by locals to protect them and keep order. You have a title and some authority to go with it. You are widely recognized in that region.

As a result, add a die to your dice pool for all social interactions with those within your patrol area.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for all social interactions with those within your patrol area.

name: Familiar Pilot
description: So long as one of your fellow PCs is piloting the vessel you are on, add a die to your dice pool on Attacks using shipboard weapon systems.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool on Attacks using shipboard weapon systems so long as one of your fellow PCs is piloting the vessel you are on.

name: Far Sight
description: You experience a vision (both sight and sound) of the events surrounding a person, place, or object with which you are familiar. This vision lasts only for a moment, but you get the general location of the target through the vision. Only usable once between Rests.
tooltip: You experience a vision (both sight and sound) of the events surrounding a person, place, or object with which you are familiar.

name: Far Step
description: You disappear into thin air with an audible pop and reappear a short distance away. You can teleport up, down, or across to anywhere you choose within short range if you have a clear and unobstructed path to that location.
tooltip: You disappear into thin air with an audible pop and reappear a short distance away.

name: Far Step
description: You disappear into thin air with an audible pop and reappear a short distance away. You can teleport up, down, or across to anywhere you choose within short range if you have a clear and unobstructed path to that location.
tooltip: You disappear into thin air with an audible pop and reappear a short distance away.

name: Fast Feet
description: You can move a short distance and take an Action in the same round. Your Action can be a Feat, if you so wish.
