  • Mixed Success (2) - The enemy succeeds on their Attack, but they also take damage as retaliation
  • Success (3) - The enemy succeeds on their Attack; you do not succeed in defending against them
tooltip: Instead of Attacking this round in combat, you invite an enemy to perform an Attack roll on you, with stricter success criteria than normal.

name: Justified Action
description: You are an enthusiastic upholder of the law. When you are engaged in an activity that directly upholds the law, add a die to your dice pool for the related Task.
tooltip: When you are engaged in an activity that directly upholds the law, add a die to your dice pool for the related Task.

name: Justified Hatred
description: Add a die to your dice pool when fighting civilized aliens.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when fighting civilized aliens.

name: Justify the Means
description:
Sometimes, people must give up something to achieve success—whether they want to or not. When helping another character, you inflict pain to motivate them, adding two dice to your dice pool regardless of your Skill in that particular Task.

The target character can treat your hostile actions as an Attack, and may defend against it or just take the hit. If they defend against the Attack successfully, they do not receive any benefits from you.
tooltip: You inflict pain to a character you are Helping, adding a two dice to your dice pool regardless of your Skill in that particular Task.

name: K'ohma
description:
K'ohma are native to Erelon, sharing a planet with the Erelen and the Aeyen. The K'ohma live in disconnected tribes across Erelon, occasionally encroaching on Erelan lands in search of resources. The K'ohma have an innate sense of the natural order of things, and have a deep reverence for traditions and their ancestors.

The K'ohma live in a pre-industrial age, so they do not have the ability to venture out into space on their own; they must either get there by chance, or have been taken offworld by an outside force. Other civilized species do not normally respond well to the presence of K'ohma, and will either attack them or flee at the sight of them. The K’ohma are considered primitive savages in the eyes of most people.

name: Keep on Swimming
description: Add a die to your dice pool for escaping, perception, sneaking, and swimming Tasks, as well as for Tasks to identify aquatic creatures and geography while underwater.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for perception and movement Tasks, and for Tasks to identify aquatic creatures and geography while underwater.

name: Keeper
description:
Erelen have always had a deep, primordial connection to nature. They live inside massive, ancient trees, living in harmony with nature instead of destroying it. They have a keen sense of the natural world, feeling when the balance of nature has been upset. Keepers are those practiced in not only sensing subtle shifts in the balance of nature, but also in taking steps to ensure this balance does not tip too far in one direction. In return, nature responds to their call as plants and animals work with Keepers to build homes, provide food, heal allies and attack targets. Keepers spend most of their time in meditation, useless to Erelan society as they focus their energy solely on the development of life. You also have access to the specialization Focus:

  • Roams the Æther

name: Knock Out
description: You make a melee Attack that inflicts no damage. Instead, the Attack hits the target knocked unconscious for one minute.
tooltip: You make a melee Attack that inflicts no damage. Instead, the Attack hits the target knocked unconscious for one minute.

name: Knock-out Blow
description: These days, bounties are rarely “dead or alive”—to get your commission, you need to bring your target back alive. If you strike a living human target with a weapon you're trained in, the target is dazed or rendered unconscious (and can take no Actions) for one hour.
tooltip: You strike a living human target with a weapon you're trained in, dazing them or rendering them unconscious for one hour.

name: Know the Signs
description: You know when an individual ideologically opposed to your cause is nearby. Add a die to your dice pool for any Task related to finding someone opposed to your cause.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for any Task related to finding someone opposed to your cause.

name: Know Where to Look
description: Whenever you find valuables in ruins, you gain double the result you would otherwise obtain.
tooltip: You gain double the result you would otherwise obtain whenever you find valuables in ruins.

name: Know Where to Score
description: You know where to acquire new drug supplies; who to call, what palms to grease, and where dealers like to do business. Add a die to your dice pool when performing a Task to acquire your drug of choice.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when performing a Task to acquire your drug of choice.

name: Knowledge of the Body
description: You have an additional die in your dice pool when healing yourself.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when healing yourself.

name: Knows the Need
description: You learn the heart’s desire of a person you can see, without necessarily speaking to them first.
tooltip: You learn the heart’s desire of a person you can see, without necessarily speaking to them first.

name: Lab Analysis
description:
You analyze the scene of a crime, the site of a mysterious incident, or a series of unexplained phenomena, and maybe learn a surprising amount of information about the perpetrators, the participants, or force(s) responsible. To do so, you must collect samples from the scene. Samples are paint or wood scrapings, dirt, photographs of the area, hair, an entire corpse, and so on. With samples in hand, you can discover up to three pertinent pieces of information about the scene, possibly clearing up a lesser mystery and pointing the way to solving a greater one. The GM will decide what you learn.

Add a die to your dice pool for the Task, or two dice if you take the time to transport the samples to a permanent lab (if you have access to one), as opposed to conducting the analysis with your field science kit.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when making an analysis, or two dice if you take the time to transport samples to a permanent lab.

name: Large Distraction
description: All enemies within short distance become distracted by your activities, becoming dazed until the end of the next round.
tooltip: All enemies within short distance become distracted by your activities, becoming dazed until the end of the next round.

name: Laser Beam
description: You emit a thin beam of fire in the form of a laser from your hand. This inflicts fire damage to a single target in immediate range. The beam is even more effective against immobile, nonliving beings, slicing up to 1 foot (30 cm) of any material.
tooltip: You emit a thin beam of fire in the form of a laser from your hand that inflicts fire damage to a single target in immediate range.

name: Launch
description: While you come to a standstill in zero-gravity, you can launch a target in a chosen direction through space at a rate of a short distance per round.
tooltip: You launch a target in a chosen direction so that they move a short distance each round.

name: Launch Drone
description: A drone no larger than 1 foot (30 cm) launches from your armour for one hour, flying up to a long distance each round. The drone accompanies you and follows your instructions. It has manipulators, allowing it to attempt to accomplish physical Tasks, and some basic weapons to make Attacks. If the drone is destroyed, you must expend 2 XP to rebuild it.
tooltip: A drone launches from your armour for one hour, accompanying you and following your instructions.

name: Leap
description: Aura Magic infuses your body so that you can leap to a location within short range and make a melee Attack at any point along that path as part of the same Action.
tooltip: You can leap to a location within short range and make a melee Attack at any point along that path as part of the same Action.

name: Learning the Way
description:
Choose one type of weapon or Attack in which you are not already trained:

  • Blades
  • Blunt Weapons
  • Unarmed Attacks

You are trained in Attacks using that type of weapon or Attack.

name: Learning to Share
description: You willfully switch between personalities, adding a die to your dice pool for the roll. You can do this as often as you want, but it requires an Action each time.
tooltip: You willfully switch between personalities, adding a die to your dice pool for the roll.

name: Legerdemain
description: You can perform small but seemingly impossible tricks. For example, you can make a small object in your hands disappear and move into a desired spot within reach (like your pocket). You can make someone believe that they have something in their possession that they do not have (or vice versa). You can switch similar objects right in front of someone’s eyes.
tooltip: You perform a small but seemingly impossible tricks, like making objects disappear or switching similar objects while someone watches.

name: Legerdemain
description: You can perform small but seemingly impossible tricks. For example, you can make a small object in your hands disappear and move into a desired spot within reach (like your pocket). You can make someone believe that they have something in their possession that they do not have (or vice versa). You can switch similar objects right in front of someone’s eyes.
tooltip: You perform a small but seemingly impossible tricks, like making objects disappear or switching similar objects while someone watches.

name: Lesson in Trickery
description: Illusions and trickery are your specialty. Add a die to your dice pool if using trickery or illusions to befuddle someone.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool if using trickery or illusions to befuddle someone.

name: Lethargy
tooltip: Remove one die from all rolls for one hour.

name: Lethargy
tooltip: Remove one die from all rolls for one hour.

name: Levity
description: Through wit, charm, humor, and grace, you put friends and comrades at ease so much that they can take an immediate Short Rest, even if they have already used up their Short Rest. You can only use this once between each Long Rest.
tooltip: You put friends and comrades at ease so much that they can take an immediate Short Rest, even if they have already used up their Short Rest.

name: Lighting Strike
description: You Attack a target within short range with a bolt of lighting. You must be able to see your target.
tooltip: You Attack a target within short range with a bolt of lighting. You must be able to see your target.

name: Lightning Flash
description: You release a fork of electricity, which travels in a relatively straight line for a short distance, inflicting damage on all targets standing along that line. Objects along the line that conduct electricity may retain a residual charge.
tooltip: You release a fork of electricity, which travels a short distance, inflicting damage on all targets standing along that line.

name: Like the Back of Your Hand
description: Add a die to your dice pool for any Task related to a starship that you own or have a direct connection with. Tasks include repair, refueling, finding a breach in the hull, finding a stowaway, and so on. The same goes for any Attack rolls you make within the starship against enemy boarders, as well as any Attack rolls you make with the ship against enemy ships.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for any Task related to a starship that you own or have a direct connection with.

name: Live to Impress
description: You take the effects of an Intrusion for a party member.
tooltip: You take the effects of an Intrusion for a party member.

name: Living Wall
description: You specify a confined area—such as an open doorway, a hallway, or a space between two trees—where you stand. If anyone attempts to enter or pass through that area and you don't wish it, you make an automatic Attack against them. If you hit, you stop their movement.
tooltip: If anyone attempts to enter or pass through a confined area you're Guarding, you stop their movement.

name: Loner
description: You gain no benefit when you get Help with a Task from another character.
tooltip: You gain no benefit when you get Help with a Task from another character.

name: Long Charge
description: You can move a short distance and still make an Attack as part of the same Action, assuming you are running toward your target.
tooltip: You move a short distance and make an Attack as part of the same Action, assuming you are running toward your target.

name: Long Shot
description: Ranges for you increase by one step. You can fire a ranged weapon from one range step further than normal. Short becomes long, and long becomes 200 feet (61 m) or up to fifteen hexes ⬢ or squares ■ away.
tooltip: You fire a ranged weapon from one range step further than normal. Short becomes long, and long becomes 200 feet or up to fifteen hexes ⬢ or squares ■ away.

name: Long Strides
description: You can move a long distance each round if you used your previous Action and current Action only to move.
tooltip: You move a long distance each round if you used your previous Action and current Action only to move.

name: Long Suffering
description: You can go twice as long without food and water as other people.
tooltip: You can go twice as long without food and water as other people.

name: Loot
description: You loot a corpse, tomb, chest or other object that would feasibly contain Items, acquiring twice as many sellable goods than your normally would.
tooltip: You loot a corpse, tomb, chest or similar, acquiring twice as many sellable goods than your normally would.

name: Loot Creature
description: You receive twice the amount of food, animal skin and various animal components from the carcass of large animals.
tooltip: You receive twice the amount of food, animal skin and various animal components from the carcass of a large animal.

name: Lost in the Chaos
description: When two or more targets Attack you at once in melee, you can use them against each other, forcing one of them to Attack or somehow disadvantage its peers.
tooltip: You can use targets against each other, forcing one of them to Attack or somehow disadvantage its peers.

name: Low Essence
description: Traditional healing Skills, medicines, and abilities work only half as well for you. Damage you take can never be completely healed in these ways or recovered normally. Instead, you must use repair Abilities to recover from damage.
tooltip: You must supplement traditional healing methods with repair Abilities to help repair damaged Cyberware components.

name: Lower Morale
description: If you use your Action in a combat situation, you can make all targets within immediate distance become dazed for one round.
tooltip: You can make all targets within immediate distance become dazed on their next Action.

name: Lower Temperature
description: Every round, you can lower the temperature of an area, creature, character or object within immediate range by 50°F (~28°C). The size of the affected area is depending on the composition of the matter within. You may be able to lower the temperature of an entire room if it is empty, but only be able to affect the hand of a creature larger than yourself.
tooltip: You can lower the temperature of an area, character, creature or object within immediate range by 50°F.

name: Lucky
description: You have an additional 1d6 Luck die which you roll at the same time as your dice pool, but does not count towards you dice count. Instead, you can choose to substitute the number rolled on of your other dice with the one from your Luck die.
tooltip: You can substitute the result of one of your dice with the result from an extra 1d6 Luck die.

name: Lunge
description: This Ability allows you to extend yourself for a powerful stab or smash. Add a die to your dice pool to move a short distance and Attack a target with a melee weapon, all as part of the same Action.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool to move a short distance and Attack a target with a melee weapon.

name: Machinespeak
description: You can give basic commands from a planetary distance with a machine that you are linked to. This machine can be anything from a supercomputer, to an orbital satellite, to a starship. You can command the machine to do anything it would normally be able to do, though each “action” it performs requires an Action on your part. Linking to a machine is a process that requires twenty-four hours of work while jacked into the machine. You can only be linked to one machine at a time.
tooltip: You can give basic commands from a planetary distance with a machine that you are linked to.

name: Magic Fingers
description:
So long as one of your fellow PCs is piloting the vessel you are on, add two dice to your dice pool on Attacks using shipboard weapon systems.

Regardless of who is piloting the ship, add a die to your dice pool on Attacks using shipboard weapon systems.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool on Attacks using shipboard weapon systems, or two dice with a PC pilot.

name: Magical Ward
description: You are enveloped in a Magical ward, causing the next Magical Attack to consume the ward instead of damaging you. The ward is destroyed if you are Attacked by Magic, or whenever you next take a Rest. To protect against Magical Attacks, you must also be familiar with the hostile Magic; for example, if you have never experienced Spirit Magic, you can't protect against it.
tooltip: You are protected against the next Magical Attack by a Magical ward that is consumed once Attacked.

name: Magnetize
description: You change the magnetic properties of any target that you can touch so that it either attracts or repels other objects with magnetic properties (such as metals).
tooltip: You change the magnetic properties of a target that you can touch.

name: Magnificent Moment
description: If you succeed on an Attack roll, you can immediately take another non-combat Action in the same round. You can use this Action to move, or to perform any non-combat Feat or Task.
tooltip: If you succeed on an Attack roll, you can immediately take another non-combat Action in the same round.

name: Major Hallucination
description: You create a complex scene of images that appears in the minds of all targets within long range. Only those affected by the Ability experience the hallucination. The hallucination must be no larger than what can fit within a 100-foot (30 m) cube. Parts of the hallucination can move, but they can't leave the area defined by the cube. The hallucination includes sound and smell. It lasts for ten minutes and it changes as you direct (no concentration is needed). If targets move out of long range of you, they no longer experience the hallucination. Any target that moves within long range of you will begin experiencing the hallucination as long as it is active.
tooltip: You create a complex scene of images that appears in the minds of all targets within long range.

name: Make Invisible
description: You're easy to overlook and are used to hiding in plain sight. Add a die to your dice pool when trying to hide or disguise yourself.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when trying to hide or disguise yourself.

name: Makeshift Inhibitor
description:
Using materials at hand, you attach a makeshift Magical inhibitor to a Recondite, who cannot access any of the benefits of its powers for ten minutes. You must touch the target to attach the device. After ten minutes, the inhibitor ceases to function and may be removed by the target.

Does not require or use up a Magical inhibitor in your inventory, but does require the necessary components that would make up such a device.
tooltip: You attach a makeshift Magical inhibitor to a Recondite, who cannot access any of the benefits of its powers for ten minutes.

name: Manic Intuition
description: You know that you're right. If you spend your Action asking the GM a question, they must answer honestly. Can only be done once between Long Rests.
tooltip: You ask the GM a question so that they must answer honestly. Can only be done once between Long Rests.

name: Many Minds, One Body
description:
You suffer from an extreme case of Dissociative Identity Disorder, brought on by past trauma or an excessively aggression Intrusion into your mind. As a result, you now have two or three personalities that co-exist within your body. These personalities don't necessarily know of each other's existence, but inhabit the same mindspace nonetheless.

If you wish, each personality can have its own name, Descriptor and Ability selection, but they must all share the same type, Focus, stats, equipment and Species. You should set up a character sheet for each personality if they are significantly different.

You can randomly switch personalities once every Long Rest if you wish. The GM can switch your personality as a result of an Intrusion.
tooltip: You have two or three personalities that co-exist within your body, that don't necessarily know of each other's existence.

name: Mark of the Foretold
description:
Some distinguishing birthmark, tattoo, or talisman that always seems to find you again even if lost or stolen.
  • Talisman
  • Birthmark or tattoo

name: Mask
description:
You transform your body to become someone else. You can change any physical characteristics you wish, including coloration, height, weight, gender, and distinguishing markings. You can also change the appearance of whatever you are wearing or carrying. You remain in this form for up to twenty-four hours or until you use an Action to resume your normal appearance.

While transformed, add a die to your dice pool when trying to convince someone you are someone else than you actually are.
tooltip: You transform your body to become someone else, adding a die to your dice pool for impersonating a specific person.

name: Masked
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when trying to convince someone you are someone else than you actually are.

name: Mass Hallucination
description: You create a fantastically complex hallucination that fits within a 1 mile (2 km) cube that you and all intelligent beings within 1 mile (2 km) of your center experience together. Only those affected by the Ability experience the hallucination. Images in the hallucination can move in the cube and act in accordance with your desires. They can also act logically (such as reacting appropriately to fire or Attacks) when you aren't directly observing them. The hallucination includes sound and smell. For example, armies can clash in battle, with air support from machines or flying creatures, on and above terrain of your creation. The hallucination lasts for one hour (or longer, if you concentrate on it after that time). If targets move out of a 1 mile (2 km) range of you, they no longer experience the hallucination. Any target that moves within a 1 mile (2 km) range of you will begin experiencing the hallucination as long as it is active.
tooltip: You create a fantastically complex hallucination that you and all intelligent beings within 1 mile of your center experience together.

name: Master Berserker
description:
Anytime you take damage in combat, you must make a single die Logic roll; if you fail, you go berserk. If you succeed, you don't go berserk, even if you want to (you can't choose not to roll, or to use an exact roll as a failure).

While berserk, you have three dice total for every combat roll, and your mixed successes and successes are considered critical successes instead (you can still get Intrusions on failed rolls). You automatically fail on all positive social interaction Tasks. For the duration, you Attack every living being within short range, starting with the closest. If no living being is within short range, you move to seek out potential victims.

In addition, sometimes you spontaneously go berserk when angered, surprised, or scared. When this happens, the GM may allow you to attempt a Logic roll to avoid going berserk.

Once you are berserk, you remain so for up to ten minutes, until you choose to return to normal. When you return to your normal state of mind and body immediately after going berserk, you can't go berserk again until after you have taken a Long Rest.

Everything but a complete failure is now considered a critical success, meaning you only need to succeed on one die to get a critical success while berserk.
tooltip: Anytime you take damage, make a single die Logic roll. If you fail, you go berserk.

name: Master Machine
description: You can control the functions of any machine, intelligent or otherwise. If you spend an Action to concentrate on a machine, you are aware of what is going on around it (you see and hear as if you were standing next to it, no matter how far away you are). You must touch the machine to create the link, but afterward, there is no range limitation. This effect lasts for one week. You can master only one machine at a time.
tooltip: You can control the functions of any machine, intelligent or otherwise for one week.

name: Master of Magic
description: You roll at least two Magic dice anytime you roll for Magic in a Magic you are already trained in.
tooltip: You roll at least two Magic dice anytime you roll for Magic in a Magic you are already trained in.

name: Master of Seduction
description: You seduce a target whose sexual preferences would include your gender identity, and proceed to blow their mind. This person becomes a permanent Contact, willing to provide you with information on the off chance that you might have an encounter with them again.
tooltip: You seduce a target whose sexual preferences would include your gender identity. They become a permanent Contact.

name: Master Trader
description: You are able to quickly learn through context clues where to best buy or sell Items and Artifacts in any settlement.
tooltip: You are able to quickly learn through context clues where to best buy or sell Items and Artifacts in any settlement.

name: Masterful Attack
description: When using your chosen weapon, you can reroll any Attack roll you wish and take the better of the two results.
tooltip: You Attack with your chosen weapon, rolling twice and taking the better of the two results.

name: Mathematical Genius
description: You are specialized in mathematics. Add a die to your dice pool on mathematics Tasks.
tooltip: You are specialized in mathematics. Add a die to your dice pool on mathematics Tasks.

name: Matter Cloud
tooltip: You are surrounded by a swirling cloud of matter that moves with you. You can use an Action to damage everything within immediate range.

name: Melt Armour
description: You tear apart the defenses of a target within short range. Any energy-based defenses it has (such as a force field or a Ward Ability) are negated for 1d6+1 rounds. If the target has no energy defenses, it is instead dazed for 1d6+1 rounds as its armour or clothing is burned away.
tooltip: You tear apart the defenses of a target within short range, negating an energy-based defense or dazing them for 1d6+1 rounds.

name: Membership Benefits
description: You not only belong to the Archeology and Exploration Guild, but you have also purchased a founding membership. This provides several benefits, including a base of operations, somewhere to conduct research on a variety of geographical and historical topics, Contacts among other members of the AEG, and access to a variety of leads about sites of interest that no one else has yet explored. Sometimes the Archeology and Exploration Guild will mount expeditions, or fund your explorations if you make your case well enough. Also, you can always claim one Item from collections (where ancient jewelry, documents, and relics are kept), in return for an Artifact of equal value.
tooltip: You are a founding member of the AEG, which gives you a base of operations, Contacts among other AEG, and access to a variety of leads.

name: Memory Walk
description: You rifle through the memories of a target, either finding a specific memory you seek or randomly witnessing important memories.
tooltip: You rifle through the memories of a target, either finding a specific memory you seek or randomly witnessing important memories.

name: Mental Abilities
description:
You have the ability to touch the minds of others through innate Magical Skills. If you already use Magic, your Abilities from your Focus are channeled through your offensive Magic. Otherwise, you are using Psi Magic to use these Abilities.

Proficiency in the use of Psi Magic is dependent on the knowledge of the individual and is limited by their constitution. Individuals can only use Psi Magic for so long before succumbing to fatigue or worse.
tooltip: You can touch the minds of others with Magic. If you don't already use Magic, your Focus Abilities use Psi Magic.

name: Mental Walls
description: Your inherently guarded nature has made you wary of the intentions of others. You do not feel the negative effects of a mixed success for social Tasks.
tooltip: You do not feel the negative effects of a mixed success for social Tasks.

name: Mesmerize
description: You render a hostile person friendly or a friendly target obsessed with you until they next Rest. The target must be able to see you. Lasting Power may be used on the target after this point, with its usual effects.
tooltip: You render a hostile person friendly or a friendly target obsessed with you until they next Rest. The target must be able to see you.

name: Midas Presence
description: When you sell Items, they have a chance to sell at a higher price level than their current level. In practice, this means the GM will roll 1d2 to determine whether the items sell for a higher price level or not.
tooltip: When you sell Items, they have a chance to sell at a higher price level than their current level.

name: Mind Control
description: You control the Actions of a target you touch. This effect lasts for ten minutes. Once you have established control, you maintain mental contact with them and sense what they sense. You can allow it to act freely or override its control on a case-by case basis. When the effect ends, the target doesn't remember being controlled or anything it did while under your command.
tooltip: You control the Actions of a target you touch for ten minutes, maintaining mental contact with them until the effect ends.

name: Mind Games
description: You use lies and trickery, mockery, and perhaps even hateful, obscene language against a target that can understand you. If successful, the target is stunned for one round and cannot act, and it is dazed in the following round.
tooltip: You use lies and trickery and mockery to stun a target for one round and cannot act, and it is dazed in the following round.

name: Mind of a Leader
description: When you develop a plan that involves your Companions, and if you spend your Action asking the GM one very general question about what is likely to happen if you carry out the plan, and you will get a simple, brief answer, as if you rolled your exact number. This means you get a general idea of future events, something you would normally be unable to know. Only usable once per session.
tooltip: You ask the GM one very general question about what is likely to happen if you carry out a plan, and you will get a simple answer.

name: Mind Over Matter
description: Add two die to your dice pool on a physical Task.
tooltip: Add two die to your dice pool on a physical Task.

name: Mind Reading
description: You can read the surface thoughts of a target within short range, even if the target doesn't want you to. You must be able to see the target. Once you have established contact, you can read the target’s thoughts for up to one minute. If you or the target moves out of range, the connection is broken.
tooltip: You can read the surface thoughts of a target within short range, even if they don't want you to.

name: Mind Reading
description: You can read the surface thoughts of a target within short range, even if the target doesn't want you to. You must be able to see the target. Once you have established contact, you can read the target’s thoughts for up to one minute. If you or the target moves out of range, the connection is broken.
tooltip: You can read the surface thoughts of a target within short range, even if they don't want you to.

name: Mindfulness
description: Add two dice to your dice pool on your next Action in the following round, so long as you name that Action now.
tooltip: Add two dice to your dice pool on your next Action in the following round, so long as you name that Action now.

name: Minds Worth Altering
description:
Using Divine, Psi or Spirit Magic, you are able to manipulate the memories of others. Your Abilities only work on those with sentient minds with conscious memories, and within immediate distance from you.

If you don't use Divine, Psi or Spirit Magic, your Abilities from your Focus use Psi Magic. Proficiency in the use of Psi Magic is dependent on the knowledge of the individual and is limited by their constitution. Individuals can only use Psi Magic for so long before succumbing to fatigue or worse.
tooltip: You are able to manipulate the memories of beings with sentient minds and conscious memories within immediate range.

name: Miniaturize
description: The weapon is now smaller, being able to be held in one hand and easily concealed. Now that it’s small it can look like another object (a book, a briefcase, etc.) but reveals its true nature when fired.
tooltip: The weapon is now smaller, handheld and easily concealed. It can look like another object but reveals its true nature when fired.

name: Minor Hallucination
description: You create a single image of a being or object that appears in the minds of all targets within short range. Only those affected by the Ability experience the hallucination. The hallucination must be no larger than what can fit within a 10-foot (3m) cube. Parts of the hallucination can move (for example, you could make the illusion of a person walk or Attack), but it can't leave the area defined by the cube. The hallucination includes sound but not smell. It lasts for ten minutes, but if you want to change the original hallucination significantly—such as making a creature appear to be wounded—you must concentrate on it again (though doing so doesn't cost additional Intellect points). If targets move out of short range of you, they no longer experience the hallucination. Any target that moves within short range of you will begin experiencing the hallucination as long as it is active and you spend an Action once they are in range.
tooltip: You create a single image of a character, creature or object that appears in the minds of all targets within short range.

name: Miracle Drug
description: You inject a mysterious new drug into a target and restore it back to full health. Someone can only benefit from this Ability once each day.
tooltip: You inject a mysterious new drug into a target and restore it back to full health.

name: Mobile Fighter
description: As part of your Attack, you can leap onto or over obstacles, swing from ropes, run along narrow surfaces, or otherwise move around the battlefield at your normal speed as if such Tasks were routine. This Ability allows you to Attack and move a short distance in any direction, as long as the environment permits it.
tooltip: You move a short distance in any direction and Attack as a part of the same Action.

name: Modify Device
description: Add a die to your dice pool to jury-rig a piece of mechanical or electrical equipment to make it function more effectively than normal. To do so, you must use spare parts equal to an Expensive Item, have a field science kit or a permanent lab, and succeed on a Tech roll (can be modified by Skills or traits). When complete, add a die to your dice pool for all Tasks performed in conjunction with the device until it inevitably breaks. For example, you could improve the spacecraft thrusters to increase a spacecraft’s speed, modify the decryption module to more quickly decrypt a message, improve the sensitivity of a scientific instrument package, and so on. Action to initiate, one hour to complete.
tooltip: You jury-rig a piece of mechanical or electrical equipment to make it function more effectively than normal until it breaks.

name: Momentum
description: You can move a short distance and Attack as a part of the same Action, adding a die to your dice pool for the Task.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when moving a short distance and Attacking as a part of the same Action.

name: Money Is No Object
description: You can buy whatever Inexpensive Items you need wherever they are available (without actually spending your cash on hand for them).
tooltip: You can buy whatever Inexpensive Items you need wherever they are available (without actually spending your cash on hand for them).

name: Monster Bane
description: When you inflict damage to targets more than twice as large or massive as you, add an additional die to your Attack roll.
tooltip: Add an additional die to your Attack roll when you inflict damage to targets more than twice as large or massive as you.

name: Moonlight
description: A pillar of celestial light travels from you to a spot you choose within short range. When the pillar reaches that spot, it flares and casts bright light in a 200-foot (61 m) or up to fifteen hexes ⬢ or squares ■ radius, and darkness within 1000 feet (305 m) or up to fifty hexes ⬢ or squares ■ of the pillar becomes dim light. The light lasts for one hour or until you use an Action to dismiss it.
tooltip: You summon a pillar of bright light a short range away that illuminates the area around it for an hour.

name: More Contacts
description:
Choose a location. At that location you either have:
  • One Contact trained in two areas of your choosing.
  • Two Contacts trained in one Skill of your choosing each.
The Contact(s) will provide you with any information they are capable of supplying.

name: Mounted Laser Configuration
description: Your robot assistant can reconfigure itself and become an immobile laser weapon on a gimbal mount. In this configuration, the robot acts as an autonomous turret, being able to Attack targets on its own. However, if the laser is fired by you or someone else who has your permission, add one die to the dice pool for the Attack. Action to reconfigure; Action to return to normal robot configuration.
tooltip: Your robot assistant reconfigures itself to become an immobile laser weapon on a gimbal mount that can Attack targets on its own.

name: Mounted Laser Configuration
description: Your robot assistant can reconfigure itself and become an immobile laser weapon on a gimbal mount. In this configuration, the robot acts as an autonomous turret, being able to Attack targets on its own. However, if the laser is fired by you or someone else who has your permission, add one die to the dice pool for the Attack. Action to reconfigure; Action to return to normal robot configuration.
tooltip: Your robot assistant reconfigures itself to become an immobile laser weapon on a gimbal mount that can Attack targets on its own.

name: Move & Act
description: You can move a short distance and still take another Action. The other Action can be a Feat, if you so choose.
tooltip: You move a short distance and take another Action.

name: Move Earth
description: You can move incredible amounts of dirt, rock or sand over the course of a few rounds. If the mass you are trying to move is particularly large, you move only a portion of it a few dozen feet or up to five hexes ⬢ or squares &#9632 in radius. If you prefer, you can also simply move through solid ground, forming a protective bubble around you and any characters or creatures standing next to you for one hour as you move through the ground.
tooltip: You can move incredible amounts of dirt, rock or sand over the course of a few rounds, even when underground.

name: Move Mountains
description: You exert a tremendous amount of physical force within 250 feet (76 m) of you or up to eighteen hexes ⬢ or squares ■ away. You can push up to 10 tons (9 t) of material a short range. This force can collapse buildings, redirect small rivers, or perform other dramatic effects.
tooltip: You exert a tremendous amount of physical force, which can collapse buildings, redirect small rivers, or perform other dramatic effects.

name: Moving Like Water
description: You spin and move so that your defense and Attacks are aided by your fluid motion. Add a die to your Attack roll. If you get a mixed success, ignore the negative effects and treat the Attack as a regular success.
tooltip: Add a die to your Attack roll. If you get a mixed success, ignore the negative effects and treat the Attack as a regular success.

name: Nano Boost
description: You inject a stream of nanobots into a target within immediate range, accelerating them so that they gain an additional die in them dice pool on them next Task roll.
tooltip: You inject a stream of nanobots into a target within immediate range so that they add a die to them dice pool on them next Task roll.

name: Natural Complications
description: The GM can introduce an Intrusion on you without awarding you any XP. However, if this happens, there's an equal chance that it works to your advantage. In practice, this means the GM will roll 1d2 to determine whether it works in your favour or not. Rather than hurting you, it helps, or it hurts your enemies. For example, you might discover you're charging many more enemies than you realized, but they are intimidated by you and run. You and the GM should work together to determine the details. The GM can also use Intrusions based on your nature normally (awarding XP) if they desires.
tooltip: The GM can introduce an Intrusion on you without awarding you any XP, though sometimes it will work in your favour.

name: Nature Fights Back
description: Using your connection to the wilderness, you summon a large number of beasts, small creatures or plants that then convene on a spot you can see within 1000 feet (305 m) or up to fifty hexes ⬢ or squares ■. The area within 250 feet (76 m) or up to eighteen hexes ⬢ or squares ■ is overwhelmed by this veritable menagerie of life for five minutes, causing widespread damage to artificial structures and terrain in the area. Creatures overturn vehicles, vines strangle buildings and everything in the area is trampled under hoof and claw. Characters and creatures not from the wild caught in the stampede are likely to be poisoned, crushed or be afflicted by disease, stunning them for the duration of the Ability, and may need medical assistance, as the GM decides.
tooltip: You summon a large number of beasts and plants, that then Attack characters, objects, structures and creatures in a 250 foot radius.

name: Near Sight
description: You are able to view any object, location, or person within a long distance of you, as though you were right next to them. This could allow you to see around corners or under debris. Lasts as long as you spend your Action each round concentrating on the subject.
tooltip: You are able to view any object, location, or person within a long distance of you, as though you were right next to them.

name: Need an Adult
description: Adults look out for you. Add a die to your dice pool when appealing to the goodwill of an adult.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when appealing to the goodwill of an adult.

name: Network Tap
description: If you have access to a network, you can spend your Action to ask the GM one question and they must answer truthfully. Can only do once between Rests.
tooltip: With access to a network, you ask the GM one question and they must answer truthfully.

name: Never Fumble
description: You cannot get an Intrusion when Attacking with your chosen weapon, though you still fail the roll. You can never be disarmed of your chosen weapon, nor will you ever drop it accidentally. This does not prevent your weapon from breaking, seizing up, etc.
tooltip: You cannot get an Intrusion when Attacking with your chosen weapon, nor can you lose it or be disarmed of it.

name: Neverlost
description: You catch your bearings, immediately understanding your current location in relation to previous landmarks in the area without the need of a map. Add an additional die to your dice pool on navigation Tasks.
tooltip: You catch your bearings, immediately understanding your current location. Add an additional die to your dice pool on navigation Tasks.

name: New Quarry
description: Add a die to your dice pool when tracking a single legendary creature you've heard of or seen before. You cannot perform this Feat on more than one creature within a 24 hour time period from your last use, though you can perform it as many times as you want if tracking the same creature.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when tracking a single legendary creature you've heard of or seen before.

name: Night Holds No Terrors
description: You can see in complete darkness as if it were dim light. Add a die to your dice pool if Attacking or targeting in the dark.
tooltip: You can see in complete darkness as if it were dim light. Add a die to your dice pool if Attacking or targeting in the dark.

name: Nightmare
description:
You fashion a truly horrifying abomination of dripping shadow and launch it at your targets. Your abomination persists until you disperse it or it is destroyed. While present, the creature acts as you direct, but this requires no Action on your part. Without a command, the creature does nothing but stand around where you last left it. If you're in an area saturated with Divine light, the abomination won't stay for longer than a couple of rounds.

It has three Abilities, which you choose each time the nightmare Attacks:

  • Confusion
  • Curse of the Nox'zh'r
  • Horrify
tooltip: You fashion an abomination of shadow and launch it at your targets. It persists until you disperse it or it is destroyed.

name: Nightmare
description:
You fashion a truly horrifying abomination of dripping shadow and launch it at your targets. Your abomination persists each round while you spend your Action concentrating on it (or until you disperse it or it is destroyed). It has three Abilities, which you choose each time the nightmare Attacks:

  • Confusion
  • Curse of the Nox'zh'r
  • Horrify
tooltip: You fashion an abomination of shadow and launch it at your targets, persisting each round while you spend your Action concentrating on it.

name: No Fake News
description: If you can access the entirety of a written article, story or stream, you can instantly tell if a news story is real or fabricated in some way. Add a die to your dice pool for any insight Task related to piece of media.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for any insight Task related to piece of media.

name: No Weak Points
description: There are no cracks in your armour. You have considered every detail, explored every angle and prepared for most ways someone may try to hurt you. You ignore the negative effects of mixed successes for non-physical Tasks (except Magic).
tooltip: You ignore the negative effects of mixed successes for non-physical Tasks (except Magic).

name: No, You
description:
Instead of Attacking this round in combat, you invite an enemy through your method of choice (persuasion, intimidation, etc.) to Attack you directly. If you succeed, the enemy then rolls as a PC would, with the same results that an unmodified player character would get. The number of dice the enemy rolls depends on how much of a threat they are. Insignificant threats may just get an Intrusion without rolling.

  • Failure (0) - Intrusion against the enemy
  • Mixed Success (1) - Enemy hits you, but they also take damage as retaliation
  • Success (2) - The enemy succeeds on their Attack; you do not succeed in defending against them
  • Critical Success (3) - The enemy succeeds on their Attack, and gets some kind of secondary effect (similar to an Intrusion, but not as brutal)
tooltip: Instead of Attacking this round in combat, you invite an enemy to perform an Attack roll on you as if they were the PC instead of you.

name: Not Dead Yet
description:
You've survived more than one scrape that should've seen you dead. When you would normally die, you instead fall unconscious for one round and then awaken. If you die again before you've had a Long Rest, you are truly dead.

The round you spend unconscious counts as an extra Short Rest. You can perform this Feat even if you've already acted this round.
tooltip: When you would normally die, you instead fall unconscious for one round and then awaken. You must Long Rest before this can happen again.

name: Not Today
description: Sometimes—very rarely—the universe gives you a break. There's a small chance that one of your failed rolls will be treated as a mixed success instead. In practice, this means the GM will roll 1d2 to determine whether this occurs.
tooltip: There's a small chance that one of your failed rolls will be treated as a mixed success instead.

name: Nothing but Defend
description: If you do nothing on your turn but Guard, you negate all damage, incur no Intrusions, and cannot suffer any negative effects.
tooltip: If you do nothing on your turn but Guard, you negate all damage, incur no Intrusions, and cannot suffer any negative effects.

name: Objection!
description: Your vociferous, booming objection to a target’s intended Action prevents it from taking any Action (including Attacking or defending itself from an Attack) for one round.
tooltip: Your vociferous, booming objection prevents a target from taking any Action for one round.

name: Oblivion
description: You completely remove all of your target’s memories. They remain inaccessible until such a time as they hear a specific code word, chosen when you activate this power.
tooltip: You completely remove all of your target’s memories. They remain inaccessible until such a time as they hear a specific code word.

name: Obscure
description: For the next ten minutes, pitch black smoke fills an area within short range that is no bigger than an immediate distance in diameter. Light cannot penetrate the smoke, and beings that normally can see in the dark cannot see in the area. If you cast Obscure on an object, the effect moves with the object and could be temporarily suppressed if the object is enclosed in wrapping or a container.
tooltip: For the next ten minutes, pitch black smoke fills an area or surrounds an object within short range.

name: Omniscience
description: You experience a vision (both sight and sound) of the events surrounding a person, place, or object, even if you're not personally familiar with the target. This vision lasts only for a moment, but you get the general location of the target through the vision. Only usable once between each Long Rest.
tooltip: You experience a vision of the events surrounding a person, place, or object, even if you're not personally familiar with the target.

name: On Death's Door
description:
You experience your symptoms with increased intensity, as your body is now afflicted with ulcers, sores, malignant growths and various other open wounds. You have reduced visual acuity, the inability to speak coherently, experience incredible amounts of mental and bodily pain, have no appetite and more. You are essentially on death's door.

The infection is terminal. You will die within 4d6+3 days. There is no cure.

Whenever you wish, you can have a Shaman, Keeper, Cleric or Priestess cleanse you to remove the negative social effects (but not the effects on your physical health), though your infection will return in full force within 3 days. Cleansing does not delay your inevitable death.
tooltip: You have visible, malignant growths on your body that severely affect your physical and mental health. You will die in less than a month.

name: On the Defensive
tooltip: You are silenced, but you avoid physical Intrusions and mixed successes. Lasts until cancelled.

name: On Watch
tooltip: You use a ranged weapon to target a limited area and make an Attack against the next viable target to enter that area.

name: One Giant Leap
description: Your research leads to a breakthrough, and you imbue an object with a truly amazing property. To do so, you must use spare parts equal to an Expensive Item, have a field science kit or a permanent lab, and succeed on a Tech roll (can be modified by Skills or traits). When complete, you only need one die to succeed when using the device. You must still roll each time you use the device. If you fail the roll, the device breaks and won't function again until it is repaired. Any Abilities that change the outcome of Intrusions or mixed successes don't apply to this roll. Action to initiate, one hour to complete.
tooltip: You imbue an object with a truly amazing property, allowing you to succeed with only one die when using that device until it breaks.

name: One Step Ahead of Everyone
description: You use your Action to ask the GM a question so that they must answer truthfully. Gaining knowledge of the future is impossible. You can only do this once between Rests.
tooltip: You ask the GM a question so that they must answer truthfully. Gaining knowledge of the future is impossible.

name: Ooh, Shiny!
description: You're easily tempted by pretty much anything and everything. Whenever there's a desirable object or person within long range, you must roll twice on every roll and take the worst result. If you fail, your Intrusion involves your attempt to fulfill your need to acquire the object or person.
tooltip: Whenever there's a desirable object or person within long range, you must roll twice on every roll and take the worst result.

name: Open Mind
description: You open your mind to increase your awareness. Add a die to your dice pool for any Task involving perception.
tooltip: You open your mind to increase your awareness, adding a die to your dice pool for any Task involving perception.

name: Open Mind
description: You open your mind to increase your awareness. Use your Magic for any Task involving perception.
tooltip: You open your mind to increase your awareness. Use your Magic for any Task involving perception.

name: Opening Gambit
description: Your melee Attacks tear apart the defenses of a target. Any energy-based defenses it has (such as a force field or a Ward Ability) are negated for 1d6+1 rounds. If the target has no energy defenses, it is instead dazed for 1d6+1 rounds.
tooltip: You tear apart the defenses of a target with a melee Attack, negating an energy-based defense or dazing them for 1d6+1 rounds.

name: Opportunist Strike
description: You are always looking for openings, finding it easier to Attack targets that have already been Attacked at some point during the round. Add a die to your dice pool to your Attack roll if your target has already been Attacked this round.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool to your Attack roll if your target has already been Attacked this round.

name: Oratory
description: When speaking with a group of intelligent beings that can understand you and aren't hostile, add a die to your dice pool if you use your Action to try to convince them to take one reasonable action in the next round. A reasonable action must be agreed upon by the GM; it should not put the beings or their allies in obvious danger or be wildly out of character.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool as you try to convince a group of intelligent beings to take a reasonable Action the next time they act.

name: Out of Body Experience
tooltip: You project your spirit from your body for up to 24 hours, during which time your spirit can't deal or take physical damage.

name: Out of Phase
description: Through some kind of Vox engine accident or an incredible birth defect, you exist in and out of phase with the rest of the world. Your Magical Abilities from your Focus use Psi Magic. Proficiency in the use of Psi Magic is dependent on the knowledge of the individual and is limited by their constitution. Individuals can only use Psi Magic for so long before succumbing to fatigue or worse.
tooltip: Due to being in and out of phase with the rest of the world, you can use Magic and your Magical Abilities from your Focus use Psi Magic.

name: Out of Phase
description:
You start losing cohesion with reality. You are enveloped in a Magical ward, causing the next Magical Attack to consume the ward instead of damaging you. The ward is destroyed if you are Attacked by Magic, or whenever you next take a Rest.

You may only perform this Feat through your Flash of Genius or Brilliant Blaze talents.
tooltip: You are protected against the next Magical Attack by a Magical ward that is consumed once Attacked.

name: Outlaw
description: Every society has its share of outlaws. Whether they're criminals, mobsters, rogues, brigands, pirates, raiders or smugglers, there are always people who either choose to live outside the law, or were forced into a life of crime through circumstance. Using their quick wits, physical capabilities or luck, they do what they can to survive, even though the odds are stacked against them.

name: Overcome All Obstacles
description: Those who stand against you do so to their peril, and eventually shrink away in your presence. When you focus on a particular target within short range, the target suffers damage each round for one minute or until the target can throw off the effect. This Ability can only be active on one target at a time.
tooltip: You focus on a particular target within short range, so that they suffer damage each round for up to one minute.

name: Overcoming the Singularity
description: You begin the game with three Cyberware of your choice. You can install either weapons or utility upgrades. These cannot provide bonuses on their own, though they may allow you to do something you would normally not be able to do. Discuss with the GM to make sure you configure the Cyberware appropriately.

name: Overhaul
description: Over the course of 2d6 hours you repair all damage to a vessel and bring back all non-functional systems. Add a die to your dice pool for each additional 3 hours you spend repairing the ship, to a maximum of three additional dice. You must roll for to perform the Ability before you roll for the amount of time required to perform the repairs.
tooltip: You repair all damage to a vessel, adding a die to your dice pool for each additional 3 hours spent repairing the ship.

name: Overhead Crush
description: This is a powerful pummeling Attack with a bashing weapon, probably overhead. You must grip your weapon with two hands to crush. (If fighting unarmed, this Attack is made with both fists or both feet together.) Add a die to your dice pool when making this kind of Attack.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when making a two-handed, overhead Attack with a bashing weapon (or your fists).

name: Overload Machine
description: Through A.A.D.A, you infuse a powered device with more energy than it can handle. If affected, the device is destroyed or disabled for at least one minute, depending on its size and complexity. The GM may rule that the disabling effect lasts until the device is repaired.
tooltip: Through A.A.D.A, you infuse a powered device with more energy than it can handle, destroying it or disabling it for at least one minute.

name: Overreaching
description: Terrans have long overreached their limits with other civilizations in the past, leading to a lot of prejudice against them. You sometimes feel as though aliens look down on you or see you in contempt. Whenever you get a mixed success during social interactions with T'avs or Erelen, you fail the roll instead, and get an Intrusion.
tooltip: Whenever you get a mixed success during social interactions with T'avs or Erelen, you fail the roll instead, and get an Intrusion.

name: Overwatch
description: You use a ranged weapon to target a limited area (such as a doorway, hallway, or the eastern side of the clearing) and make an Attack against the next viable target to enter that area. This works like a wait Action, but you also negate any benefit the target would have from cover, position, surprise, range, illumination, or visibility. Further, add a die to your dice pool if you Attack a target who enters the area. You can remain on overwatch as long as you wish, within reason.
tooltip: You use a ranged weapon to target a limited area and make an Attack against the next viable target to enter that area.

name: Packing Heat
description: Your reputation precedes you. If you have a gun readied or equipped, add a die to your dice pool on any attempt to intimidate or scare someone.
tooltip: If you have a gun readied or equipped, add a die to your dice pool on any attempt to intimidate or scare someone.

name: Paralyzed in Fear
tooltip: You cannot act for one round.

name: Parkour
description: You can move through cityscapes or entangled canopies without ever touching the ground by running and jumping between roofs, fire escapes, branches and building ledges, but when you do so, you move only a short distance each round.
tooltip: You move through cityscapes or entangled canopies without ever touching the ground, moving a short range each round.

name: Peace of Mind
description: You have a well established sense of self that is not easily shaken. You do not feel the effects of mixed successes for non-physical Tasks (including Magic), and you are immune to fear, intimidation and panic.
tooltip: You do not feel the effects of mixed successes for non-physical Tasks (including Magic), and you are immune to fear, intimidation and panic.

name: People Person
description: When you are within immediate range of at least two allies, add a die to your dice pool for a non-combat Task. You can only do this once between Rests.
tooltip: When you are within immediate range of at least two allies, add a die to your dice pool for a non-combat Task.

name: Pep Talk
description: You inspire a character within short range who is able to understand you, giving them the boost they need to succeed, allowing them to roll Feelings on a Task—even if the situation would ask for Logic instead.
tooltip: You allow a character within short range to roll Feelings on their next Task, even when Logic would be more appropriate.

name: Perfect Form
description: When performing an athletic Task—including running, climbing, jumping and swimming—you ignore any negative effects from a mixed success, meaning you only need one die to succeed.
tooltip: You ignore any negative effects from a mixed success on an athletic Task, meaning you only need one die to succeed.

name: Perfect Lie
description: You compose a lie so convincing that the target just has to believe it. Add two dice to your dice pool on an attempt to lie to someone.
tooltip: Add two dice to your dice pool on an attempt to lie to someone.

name: Perfect Submission
description: You know exactly where to grab, prod, or apply pressure to a character or creature to keep its undivided attention. For as long as you take no physical Actions or movements except to hold the submission, the target can take no Actions, even over multiple rounds. If they are Attacked, the effect ends.
tooltip: For as long as you take no physical Actions except to hold a taget in submission, they can take no Actions.

name: Perks of Stardom
description: You are adept at claiming the rewards that fame can generate. When you are recognized, you can be seated at any restaurant, be let into any government building, be invited to any show or sports event (even if they're sold out), get a seat at a private function of any sort, or get into any club, no matter how exclusive. When dealing with someone who can't or won't immediately give in to your desire, add a die to your dice pool if that person recognizes you or is convinced that you're a celebrity even if they don't recognize you.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool on any attempt to persuade someone who recognizes you, but does not give into your desires.

name: Personal Cyclone
description: When you wish it, a cyclone of wind surrounds your body. While the cyclone is active, you feel no discomfort from the wind, you cannot be Attacked by ranged projectiles, and melee targets find it difficult to approach you. You can interact with other characters and creatures normally, but some may find your personal cyclone intimidating. Objects around you are swept up in the cyclone, with smaller objects being flung about as air swirls around you. Lasts until cancelled.
tooltip: You surround your body with a cyclone that blocks ranged projectiles makes it difficult for melee targets to approach you.

name: Personal Obsession
description: Choose one non-social non-combat Task to be trained in. You are somewhat obsessed with this Skill. Add an additional die to your dice pool when performing Tasks related to this Skill.
tooltip: Add an additional die to your dice pool when performing Tasks related to your obsession.

name: Phased Attack
description: The Attack you make on this turn goes right through any armor or clothing your target is wearing. The Ability works for whatever kind of Attack you use (melee, ranged, energy, and so on).
tooltip: The Attack you make on this turn goes right through any armor or clothing your target is wearing.

name: Physically Gifted
description: Any time you perform a physical Task that isn't an Attack, if you fail or get a mixed success, you reroll, always taking the second result (even if you still failed or got a mixed success).
tooltip: Perform a physical Task that isn't an Attack. You can reroll if you don't succeed, always taking the second result.

name: Pierce Metal Hides
description: Add a die to your dice pool when Attacking a robot.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when Attacking a robot.

name: Pinning Shot
description: You fire a special metallic arrow that stops a creature, character or vehicle in its tracks, stopping them from moving until they take an Action to dislodge the arrow.
tooltip: You fire a special metallic arrow that stops a target in its tracks, stopping them from moving until the arrow is removed.

name: Pinpoint Targeting
description: If you spend your Action targeting a specific ship system, you can disable that specific ship system. Ship systems must be in range, and include systems such as weapons, engines, or shields.
tooltip: You target a specific ship system, disabling it. Includes systems such as weapons, engines, or shields.

name: Pisonic Flare
description: You give it your all and radiate your psionic ability in a massive psionic flare that Attacks everything within at least long range, though it may extend beyond that as long as targets are within view. After performing this Feat, you fall unconscious for at least ten minutes. The psionic flare inflicts damage to everything in the area except you.
tooltip: You unleash a psionic flare that Attacks everything within view except you. This knocks you unconscious and gives you a headache.

name: Plasma Beam
description: You emit a thin beam of electric plasma. This inflicts damage to a single target in immediate range. The beam is even more effective against immobile, nonliving beings, slicing up to 1 foot (30 cm) of any material.
tooltip: You emit a thin beam of electric plasma that inflicts damage to a single target or immobile, nonliving beings within immediate range.

name: Plug
description: Using your status as a pro gamer, you convince a non-hostile person to give you at least the equivalent of an Inexpensive Item to sponsor your gaming career. The amount depends on how convincing you are, the means of the person and if they recognize you.
tooltip: You convince a non-hostile person to give you at least the equivalent of an Inexpensive Item to sponsor your gaming career.

name: Poke & Run
description: You Attack a target that has eyes, blinding them for one round, and you can move or attempt to hide as part of the same Action.
tooltip: You Attack a target that has eyes, blinding them for one round, and you can move or attempt to hide as part of the same Action.

name: Polyglot
description: You are so adept at languages that after hearing any language spoken for a few minutes, you can pick up a few words. It doesn't take long for you to be able to (crudely) make yourself understood, and to understand what’s being said around you.
tooltip: You are able to make yourself understood in a foreign language after only a few minutes being exposed to it.

name: Possess Idol
description: After identifying a spirit remnant, you can imbue it into an object of your choice. The spirit remnant has none of the intelligence, memories, or special abilities that it had in life, but the object it possesses will emit Magicval energy until the possession wears off. If the object is capable of movement, it will follow your verbal commands for one hour, after which it becomes an inert again. Once the possession wears off, the spirit remnant dissipates. You can have multiple idols at one time.
tooltip: You imbue a spirit remnant into an object of your choice, allowing you to command it if the object is capable of movement.

name: Power Nap
description: Whenever you use Power Nap, you immediately Rest. On your next turn, roll for Logic. If you fail or get a mixed success, you continue to Rest through to the next round. If you succeed in any way, you get up from your Rest, and can resume normal Actions next round. Using Power Nap only counts as one Rest.
tooltip: You immediately Rest, and then try to get up the next round using a Logic roll.

name: Power Overwhelming
description: You either dabbled too much in crystal dust in the past, or extended yourself beyond your limits when using Magic—or a combination of both. As a result, you have a debilitated appearance, with frizzled, greying hair and sunken features. You crave crystal dust on a regular basis, or you need to constantly seek out new sources of Magical energy to survive. If you do not satiate your hunger every 24 hours, you will not be able to roll Magic until you do. The effect goes away as soon as you absorb energy, and you have 24 hours to absorb energy again.
tooltip: You must satiate your hunger for Magic every 24 hours, or you will not be able to use Magic.

name: Power Shot
description: To be truly deadly with a bow, you must know where to aim. You fire a powerful shot with your bow. If you roll your exact number or get a critical success, you deal a killing blow, killing the target outright. Cannot kill PCs with this Ability.
tooltip: You fire a powerful with your bow. If you roll your exact number or get a critical success, you kill the target outright.

name: Power Strike
description: Add two dice to your dice pool on any melee Attack.
tooltip: Add two dice to your dice pool on any melee Attack.

name: Powerful Hit
description: If you successfully Attack a target, you knock it prone in addition to inflicting damage.
tooltip: You Attack a target, knocking it prone in addition to inflicting damage.

name: Powerful Regrowth
description: You touch a target to restore it back to full health. A target can benefit from this Ability only once each day.
tooltip: You touch a target to restore it back to full health. A target can benefit from this Ability only once each day.

name: Practiced Strike
description: Add a die to your dice pool when you deal damage with a bladed weapon, regardless of your target.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when you deal damage with a bladed weapon, regardless of your target.

name: Preach
description: While talking, you grab and keep a target’s attention, even if they can't understand you. For as long as you do nothing but speak (you can't even move), the target takes no Actions other than to defend itself, even over multiple rounds. If the target is Attacked, the effect ends.
tooltip: For as long as you do nothing but preach to a target, they take no Actions other than to defend themselves, even over multiple rounds.

name: Precision Strike
description: You strike a target with a melee Attack, silencing an enemy so they can't use Feats or speak (but can still move and make regular Attacks), or pinning them on the spot so they can't move (but can take other Actions as normal). If you chose a special effect, it lasts until the end of the target's turn.
tooltip: You strike a target with a melee Attack, silencing or pinning them.

name: Precision Throw
description: You make a precise throw at a target, disarming a target, or dazing them for one round if they were not holding a weapon.
tooltip: You make a precise throw at a target,disarming a target, or dazing them for one round if they were not holding a weapon.

name: Predict Outcomes
description: After spending a round calculating all possible outcomes, you can attempt to predict a target’s Actions. If you succeed, you effectively control the target’s Actions for one round. When the effect ends, the target may recall you predicting their movements, but thinks they took the Actions through their own volition.
tooltip: You attempt to predict a target’s Actions. If you succeed, you effectively control the target’s Actions for one round.

name: Predictive Model
description: If you've used an Ability to learn something on a character, creature, object, or location within the last few days (like Understand, Risk Factors or Premonition), you can learn one random fact about the subject that is pertinent to a topic you designate. Only usable once, unless you use a similar Ability on the target again.
tooltip: You can learn one random fact about the subject that is pertinent to a topic you designate if you already know something about it.

name: Premonition
description: You learn one random fact about a character, creature or location that is pertinent to a topic you designate. You can only do this once in between each Rest.
tooltip: You learn one random fact about a character, creature or location that is pertinent to a topic you designate.

name: Premonition
description: You learn one random fact about a character, creature or location that is pertinent to a topic you designate. You can only do this once in between each Rest.
tooltip: You learn one random fact about a character, creature or location that is pertinent to a topic you designate.

name: Premonition
description:
You learn one random fact about a character, creature or location that is pertinent to a topic you designate. You can only do this once in between each Rest if you don't get it randomly through Flash of Genius.

You may only perform this Feat through your Flash of Genius or Brilliant Blaze talents.
tooltip: You learn one random fact about a character, creature or location that is pertinent to a topic you designate.

name: Prepared
description: You're fully aware of the position you're in—of the horrors you'll have to face. You have spent a significant amount of time readying both your mind and your body against the inevitability of your destiny. You cannot get Intrusions that affect your sanity, and you do not feel the negative effects from mixed successes during physical Actions.
tooltip: You cannot get Intrusions that affect your sanity, and ignore negative effects from mixed successes during physical Actions.

name: Priestess of Ay'driel
description:
From the dawning of their civilization, Erelen have looked up at the night sky and have been empowered by the light of celestial bodies. Priestesses of Ay'driel harness this power, focusing it to inspire and guide those under their protection. These priestesses serve the Goddess Ay'driel, whom they believe radiates power through Afy'emel, Erelon's largest and brightest moon. While males are also allowed to become Priests of Ay'driel, the order is almost exclusively made up of Erelen women. The Priestesses of Ay'driel also represent the heart of the Erelan Empire, as the High Priestess of Ay'driel is also the Erelan Empress.

Whether you are an active member of the Priestesses of Ay'driel or an independent actor, your power comes from both Psi and Divine Magic, though true believers only refer to their powers as being celestial in origin. In practice, you use Divine Magic to heal and support your allies, and Psi Magic to Attack foes. You also have access to the specialization Foci:

  • Masters Clairvoyance
  • Masters Telekinesis

name: Primal Connection
description:
Your connection to the natural world extends to a degree that some would call supernatural. Through your respect for nature and your time in the wild, you have developed a very rudimentary understanding of Primal Magic.

Whenever you use Magical Abilities from your Focus, you are tapping into the underlying power of life itself, from the strongest bear to the smallest seed. It is very rare for someone to develop the necessary Skill set to learn Primal Magic, as it relies heavily on the individual being able to connect with nature on a fundamental level, resulting in a symbiotic relationship that benefits the individual as well as the flora and fauna they interact with.

If you already have Abilities that use Primal Magic, this trait has no effect.
tooltip: You are able to use Magic, and whenever you use Magical Abilities from your Focus, you are using Primal Magic.

name: Primal Magic
description: Whenever you use Magical Abilities, you are tapping into the underlying power of life itself, from the strongest bear to the smallest seed. It is very rare for someone to develop the necessary Skill set to learn Primal Magic, as it relies heavily on the individual being able to connect with nature on a fundamental level, resulting in a symbiotic relationship that benefits the individual as well as the flora and fauna they interact with.
tooltip: You are able to use Magic, and your Magical Abilities use Primal Magic. This applies to both offensive and support Abilities.

name: Primal Presence
description: With your large frame and savage countenance, you're a terrifying sight to most aliens. If trying to intimidate a member of a different species, add a die to your dice pool.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool if trying to intimidate a member of a different species.

name: Prismatic Shot
description: You can now modify your weapon on the fly to shoot out any Magic with which you are familiar, causing different effects depending on what type of Magic you've chosen. For example, Divine Magic can heal an ally or stun a cyborg, while Psi Magic may cause objects to float and be flung about. You should discuss what effect you want with the GM before firing the weapon. You can perform this Action in place of your normal weapon roll.
tooltip: Your weapon shoots out any Magic with which you are familiar, causing different effects depending on the type of Magic selected.

name: Privileged Person
description: You are adept at claiming the rewards that being in a position of power can generate. When recognized, you can be seated at any eating establishment, be let into any court or other structure where laws are decided or nobility rules, be invited to any gala, and get a seat at a private function of any sort. When dealing with someone who can't or won't immediately give in to your desire, add a die to your dice pool for all Tasks related to persuasion if that person recognizes you (or is convinced that you're an important person even if they don't recognize you).
