In doing so, there's a chance that your actions will not be your own, but there will be no negative social effects (but the effects on your physical health remain) until you decide to resist the infection. Most of your Intrusions will be geared around you losing control of your faculties.
tooltip: The infection has caused painful growths to manifest inside your body. You have a general feeling of malaise and paranoia.

name: Stand Guard
description: When you stand guard as your Action, you can Take the Attack for characters you choose that are adjacent to you. Lasts until your next turn.
tooltip: You stand guard, Taking the Attack for characters you choose that are adjacent to you.

name: Stasis
description: You surround a target with Psi energy, keeping it from moving or acting for one minute, as if frozen solid. You must be able to see the target, and it must be within short range. While in stasis, the target is impervious to harm, cannot be moved, and is immune to all effects.
tooltip: You surround a target with Psi energy, keeping it from moving or acting for one minute, as if frozen solid.

name: State Change
description: You may alter the state of matter of an object touched, turning it into a gas, liquid, or plasma for up to ten minutes before it becomes solid again in whatever shape it had become. In the case of gas, this likely means utterly obliterating the object.
tooltip: You may alter the state of matter of an object touched, turning it into a gas, liquid, or plasma for up to ten minutes.

name: State Change
description: You may alter the state of matter of an object in short range, turning it into a gas, liquid, or plasma for up to ten minutes before it becomes solid again in whatever shape it had become. In the case of gas, this likely means utterly obliterating the object.
tooltip: You may alter the state of matter of an object in short range, turning it into a gas, liquid, or plasma for up to ten minutes.

name: Static Field
description: Faint lines in a colour you choose form a tracery over your entire body and emit faint light. Anyone or anything that touches is shocked by static electricity, and may gain or lose a magnetic charge in the process.
tooltip: Anyone or anything that touches is shocked by static electricity, and may gain or lose a magnetic charge in the process.

name: Static Field
description: Faint lines in a colour you choose form a tracery over your entire body and emit faint light. Anyone or anything that touches is shocked by static electricity, and may gain or lose a magnetic charge in the process.
tooltip: Anyone or anything that touches is shocked by static electricity, and may gain or lose a magnetic charge in the process.

name: Steadfast
description: Your faith gives you the foundation to deal with stress. When something would cause you to fail a roll—or you fail a roll through random chance—you succeed instead. You can only do this once between Long Rests.
tooltip: You transform a roll in which you would fail or have failed into a success. Requires a Long Rest between uses.

name: Stealth Skills
description:
You are trained in your choice of the following Skills:

  • Deception
  • Disguise
  • Insight
  • Lockpicking
  • Pickpocketing
  • Sleight of Hand
  • Stealth

name: Stealth Skills
description:
You are trained in your choice of the following Skills:

  • Deception
  • Disguise
  • Insight
  • Lockpicking
  • Pickpocketing
  • Sleight of Hand
  • Stealth

name: Steely Gaze
description: As you stare at them, targets within immediate range of you lose their resolve as they are dazed for one round.
tooltip: As you stare at them, targets within immediate range of you lose their resolve as they are dazed for one round.

name: Step Into the Shadows With Me
description: While hiding in the shadows, you help an ally standing next to you who is attempting to hide to blend in the shadows with you, or take cover. If you help an ally on a stealth Task, they automatically succeed on the Task. You only need to get a mixed success or higher to succeed on your help roll.
tooltip: If you help an ally in immediate range on a stealth Task, they automatically succeed on the Task if you succeed on your help roll.

name: Sticky Bomb
description: Everyone within the immediate affected area becomes unable to move until they succeed at freeing themselves.
tooltip: You throw a sticky bomb that causes everyone in the immediate area to become unable to move until they succeed at freeing themselves.

name: Sticky Bomb
description: Everyone within the immediate affected area becomes unable to move until they succeed at freeing themselves.
tooltip: You throw a sticky bomb that causes everyone in the immediate area to become unable to move until they succeed at freeing themselves.

name: Still as a Statue
description: You freeze in place, drawing your essence deep into your stone core. During this time, you lose all mobility as well as the ability to take physical Actions. You cannot sense what’s happening around you, and no time seems to pass for you. While Still as a Statue, you are immune to all damage, and regain all health. Under normal circumstances, you automatically rouse to normal wakefulness and mobility a day later. If an ally you trust shakes you hard enough, you rouse earlier. This counts as a Long Rest.
tooltip: You freeze in place for a full day, becoming immune to damage, regaining all health, but being unable to move, see or act for the duration.

name: Stimulate
description: Your words encourage a target you touch who can understand you. The next Action they take automatically succeeds.
tooltip: Your words encourage a target you touch who can understand you. The next Action they take automatically succeeds.

name: Stoke the Fires
description: You have the ability to add a die to your dice pool when performing a Task, as long as doing so can be justified by your passion.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when performing a Task, as long as doing so can be justified by your passion.

name: Stone Grip
description: You Attack with your stone fists, grabbing the target and preventing it from moving on its next turn. The target is dazed as long as it remains in your grasp. If the target attempts to break free instead of Attacking, you must roll to maintain your grip. If the target fails to break free, you can continue to hold it each round as your subsequent Actions, automatically inflicting damage each round by squeezing.
tooltip: You Attack with your stone fists, grabbing the target and preventing it from moving and dazing it every turn.

name: Stoneskin
description: You do not need to eat, drink, or breathe (though you do need rest and sleep). However, you move more stiffly than a creature of flesh, so you can never benefit from anything that increases your speed or movement capabilities.
tooltip: You do not need to eat, drink, or breathe, but you can never benefit from anything that increases your speed or movement capabilities.

name: Store Inventory
description: A list of inventory for goods you have authority to sell, a reasonable amount of inventory you can carry with you, or a physical shop for your goods—either in a static location or on a starship.

name: Storm Blast
description: You Attack a target within short range using a blast of strong wind. You must be able to see your target.
tooltip: You Attack a target within short range using a blast of strong wind.

name: Storm Magic
description: Whenever you use Magic, you are unleashing the liberating power of the Storm. All sentient beings have an affinity to the elements, whether they are aware of it or not. You are particularly attuned to the element of Air—the source of Storm Magic—though you still have a connection to the other elements to a certain extent. Those attuned to air live free from earthly ties, moving with the flow of the universe and reacting with lightning speed to the currents of life.
tooltip: Whenever you use Magic, you are unleashing the liberating power of the Storm.

name: Stranger in a Strange Land
description: Much like the bleakness of space with which you are so familiar, you have become cold and distant to those around you. You do not feel the negative effects of mixed successes in social interactions.
tooltip: You have become cold and distant to those around you. You do not feel the negative effects of mixed successes in social interactions.

name: Strength of the Earth
description: Because of your rocky countenance, add a die to your dice pool when performing any Task requiring strength or that can be resolved using brute force, such as lifting heavy objects, Attacking with your fists or smashing something to pieces.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when performing any Task requiring strength or that can be resolved using brute force.

name: Strength Through Unity
description: You are part of an underground movement to reach a new state of being through the unification of all life. You hear whispers in your head that urge you on; you feel driven to converge toward others who share your need for unity. If you spend your Action focusing on another person, you can listen for telltale signs that they share your thirst for unity. If they do, you will begin hearing whispers divulging their true nature to you. Similarly, they will recognize you for what you really are.
tooltip: You focus on another person, listening for signs that they share your thirst for unity. They will recognize you for what you really are.

name: Strong Charge
description: You can move a long distance and still make an Attack as part of the same Action, assuming you are running toward your target. If you get a mixed success on this roll, you ignore the negative effects, succeeding on the roll instead.
tooltip: You move a long distance and make an Attack as part of the same Action. If you get a mixed success, you succeed instead.

name: Stumble
description: Whenever you suffer negative effects from a mixed success in combat, make a Feelings roll. If you succeed on at least one die, you retaliate against your Attacker as if you got a regular success. If you fail, nothing additional happens (though you may fall flat on your face). You can only perform this Feat when you get a mixed success, though you can perform it even if you've already acted in any given round.
tooltip: Make a Feelings roll when you get a mixed success to retaliate against your target.

name: Stumble & Bumble
description: Whenever you get an Intrusion or suffer negative effects from a mixed success in combat, make a Feelings roll. If you succeed on at least one die, you retaliate against your Attacker as if you got a regular success. If you fail, nothing additional happens, though you may move away from your target if you wish. You can only perform this Feat when you get a mixed success or an Intrusion as a result of a roll, though you can perform it even if you've already acted in any given round.
tooltip: Make a Feelings roll when you get an Intrusion or mixed success to retaliate against your target.

name: Stunning Attack
description: You hit your target in just the right spot, dealing damage and stunning them so that they lose their next Action.
tooltip: You hit your target in just the right spot, dealing damage and stunning them so that they lose their next Action.

name: Subconscious Defense
description: Your subconscious constantly runs predictive models for avoiding danger. You do not suffer the negative effects of mixed successes on physical and knowledge Tasks.
tooltip: You do not suffer the negative effects of mixed successes on physical and knowledge Tasks.

name: Subterfuge
description: When you move no more than a short distance, you can move without making a sound, regardless of the surface you move across.
tooltip: You move a short distance without making a sound, regardless of the surface you move across.

name: Subtle Activity
description: If you have Magical Abilities, they make almost no sound, and whatever visual displays they produce are dark and shadowy. These alterations change nothing other than the appearance of the effects.
tooltip: If you have Magical Abilities, they make almost no sound, and whatever visual displays they produce are dark and shadowy.

name: Sudden Outburst
description: In a sudden burst of intense emotions, you launch all of the objects that were moving around you, knocking down everyone around you in short range. Knocked down creatures and characters must use their movement to get up.
tooltip: You launch all of the objects that were moving around you, knocking down everyone around you in short range.

name: Sudden Visions
description: You are struck by a vision, stunning you for 1d6 rounds. At the end of this vision you remove all Harm. This counts as an additional Short Rest. You can only perform this Feat once between each Long Rest.
tooltip: You are struck by a vision, stunning you for 1d6 rounds. At the end of this vision you replenish all of your lost health.

name: Suddenly Social
description:
The haze of your mind seems to part temporarily. Add a die to any social interaction Task.

You may only perform this Feat through your Flash of Genius or Brilliant Blaze talents.
tooltip: The haze of your mind seems to part temporarily. Add a die to any social interaction Task.

name: Suggestion
description:
You suggest what another character within immediate range should do as their next Action. If they agree, they add two dice to their dice pool on that Action. You can only suggest Actions that character can do, and you must know the name of the Ability you're suggesting.

If suggesting an Action to an NPC, there is no benefit to them, but they will listen to you if the roll is successful.
tooltip: You suggest what another character within immediate range should do next. They add two dice to their dice pool on that Action.

name: Summon Abomination
description:
You summon a single abomination of pure Shadow to temporarily help you. This abomination does your bidding for one minute, but you must use your Action every round to direct them. If you're in an area of saturated with Divine light, the abomination won't stay for longer than a couple of rounds.

You may only perform this Feat through your Flash of Genius or Brilliant Blaze talents.
tooltip: You summon an abomination of pure Shadow to help you for up to one minute, but you must use your Action every round to direct them.

name: Summon Abomination
description: You summon a single abomination of pure Shadow to temporarily help you. This abomination does your bidding for one minute, but you must use your Action every round to direct them. If you're in an area of saturated with Divine light, the abomination won't stay for longer than a couple of rounds.
tooltip: You summon an abomination of pure Shadow to help you for up to one minute, but you must use your Action every round to direct them.

name: Summon Ethereal Entity
description: You produce and enthrall an otherworldly entity from a portal. If you have chosen a specialization Focus, they will take on those same elemental qualities as that Focus. Otherwise, they are considered a Psi creature. The creature remains for one minute and then disintegrates. While present, the creature acts as you direct, but this requires no Action on your part.
tooltip: You produce and enthrall an otherworldly entity from a portal that remains for one minute and then disintegrates.

name: Summoned Elemental Scout
tooltip: You have an immobile, inconspicuous elemental scout that you can see, hear, and smell through.

name: Supercharge
description: You are charged with electricity and experiences a higher level of mental and physical reaction time. Until the end of the next round, you do not feel the negative effects of mixed successes, and gain an additional die in your dice pool on all dice rolls.
tooltip: You ignore the negative effects of mixed successes and add a die to your dice pool on all rolls for one round.

name: Surprise Attack
description: Add a die to your dice pool when you Attack a target you have surprised.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when you Attack a target you have surprised.

name: Survey
description: While in a natural setting, you can extend your senses up to a mile in any direction and ask the GM a very simple, general question about that area, such as “Where is the orc camp?” or “Is my friend Deithan still alive?” If the answer you seek is not in the area, you receive no information.
tooltip: While in a natural setting, you can ask the GM a very simple, general question about the area in a one mile radius

name: Survive Nature's Wrath
description: When low rations, disease, and bad morale threaten to wreck an expedition, you always double down and try harder. You can roll twice for Logic or Feelings on any Task, and take the better of the two results.
tooltip: You roll twice on any Task, and take the better of the two results.

name: Survivor's Advantage
description: Scavenging is dangerous business, especially when you've got to compete with other scavengers. When your target is knocked down, weakened, dazed, stunned, or disadvantaged in some other way, add a die to your dice pool for the Attack.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool if Attacking a target who is knocked down, weakened, dazed, stunned, or disadvantaged in some other way.

name: Swap Places
description: You remove someone within a short distance from a precarious or dangerous situation, getting them to safety but dying in the process.
tooltip: You remove someone within a short distance from a precarious or dangerous situation, getting them to safety but dying in the process.

name: Swim
description: You can swim like a fish through water or a similar liquid. You swim about 10 miles (16 km) per hour, and you are not affected by currents in the water.
tooltip: You swim about 10 miles (16 km) per hour, and you are not affected by currents in the water.

name: Swinging With Style
description:
You can flick your whip so that the far end automatically wraps securely around an anchor point (railing, hook, peg, branch, and so on) within 20 feet (6 m) or up to two hexes ⬢ or squares ■. The whip tip remains securely tied until untied by another character or creature, or until you flick the whip just so. Add a die to your dice pool for movement related to swinging across abysses, climbing cliffs, walking along a tightrope, and other movement-related Tasks using your whip.

Others may use your whip as well, but do not benefit from the additional die in their dice pool.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for movement related to swinging across abysses and other movement-related Tasks using your whip.

name: Swipe
description: This is a quick, agile melee Attack. Your Attack inflicts no damage, but you daze your target for one round.
tooltip: You daze your target with a quick, agile melee Attack instead of dealing damage.

name: Switch Personalities
description: You willfully switch between personalities. You can do this as often as you want, but it requires an Action each time.
tooltip: You willfully switch between personalities. You can do this as often as you want, but it requires an Action each time.

name: T'av
description: T'av are native to Azod, sharing a planet with a multitude of other pre-industrial civilizations. Of all the civilizations on Azod, the T'av are the only ones that have developed the ability for space travel, so they effectively claim Azod in the interstellar arena as their territory. The T'av are nomads, living in disconnected tribes that traverse the globe, moving with the seasons and following traditions passed down for millenia. The T'av don't really venture too much into space, though they have a strong presence in orbit around Azod and its moons. They are one of the three major forces that belong to the Coalition of Planets, along with the Terran Republic and the Erelan Empire. They are motivated by preservation, always striving to keep whatever they deem important safe.

name: Take Advantage
description: If your target is weakened, dazed, stunned, or disadvantaged in some other way, add a die to your dice pool when Attacking them.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when Attacking a target that is weakened, dazed, stunned or disadvantaged in some way.

name: Take Command
description: You issue a specific command to another friendly character. If your command is to perform an Attack and the target chooses to listen, they get an additional die on their Attack rolls. If your command is to perform a Task other than an Attack, they add two dice to their pool for the Task.
tooltip: You issue a command to another being giving them an additional die on their Attack roll or two dice on any other Task.

name: Take Drug
description:
When you take your drug, you can spend an Action to automatically succeed on the next Task you attempt. Immediately after though, you start going downhill, removing one die from your dice pool for every subsequent Task for one hour.

Though you can use your drug again at any time, you don't gain the advantages described above until after you've had a Long Rest. In addition,until you've had a Long Rest, Intrusions appropriate for you include becoming confused and Attacking an ally for a couple of rounds, falling unconscious unexpectedly, and getting lost as you travel. You do not earn XP for such Intrusions.

Taking your drug consumes the Item in your inventory. It is possible for you to not have the drugs on hand.
tooltip: You take your drug, causing you to automatically succeed on the next Task you attempt, but causing you to crash right afterwards.

name: Talk it Through
description: An ally who can hear you counts as trained in a Skill you possess. This temporary training lasts for as long as you speak to them, using your Action each round to relay instructions. You only need to roll to help during the first round.
tooltip: An ally who can hear you counts as trained in a Skill you possess for as long as you speak to them each round to relay instructions.

name: Talk to Fish
description: You can convey a basic concept or ask a simple question to a creature that lives underwater and cannot speak or understand speech, and the creature can provide you with a basic answer.
tooltip: You can convey a basic concept or ask a simple question to a creature that lives underwater and cannot speak or understand speech.

name: Tapestry of Fate
description: If you've previously used Weave Their Fate on a target, you can attempt to control the target’s Actions if it is within a short range and can hear and understand you. If you succeed, you control the target’s Actions for two rounds by verbal command. When the effect ends, the target recalls being under your control, but thinks they took the Actions themselves, even if they don't know why.
tooltip: Using your understanding on a target's destiny, you control two rounds of their Actions through verbal commands.

name: Targeting Eye
description: With augmented, cybernetic eyesight, you add a die to your dice pool for any ranged Attack.
tooltip: With augmented, cybernetic eyesight, you add a die to your dice pool for a ranged Attack.

name: Tech Expert
description: Technology is the great equalizer of the modern age. With it, any individual can rise from a trash heap to the top of the world. And you know exactly how to exploit it. Using your skills with computers, electronics, starships or machines, you seize control of your destiny. Any individual can become a Tech Expert; technology has no birthright, no preference for its user. All you need to do is to learn how to make technology work for you.

name: Tech Skill
description:
You are skilled with machines and robotics. Select one of the following Skills:

  • Computers
  • Crafting Skill (specific Items of your choice)
  • Engineering
  • Land Vehicle Piloting
  • Repair Skill (specific objects of your choice)
  • Starship Piloting

name: Telekinetic Surge
description: You exert a tremendous amount of physical force within 250 feet (76 m) of you or up to eighteen hexes ⬢ or squares ■ away. You can push up to 10 tons (9 t) of material up to 50 feet (15 m). This force can collapse buildings, redirect small rivers, or perform other dramatic effects.
tooltip: You exert a tremendous amount of physical force, which can collapse buildings, redirect small rivers, or perform other dramatic effects.

name: Telepathic Link
description: You open a pathway to another being’s mind via a light touch, which allows you to transmit thoughts and images to each other. The mental link remains regardless of distance and lasts for one hour.
tooltip: Create a telepathic pathway between yourself and another being for one hour.

name: Telepathic Link
description: You open a pathway to another being’s mind via a light touch, which allows you to transmit thoughts and images to each other. The mental link remains regardless of distance and lasts for one hour.
tooltip: Create a telepathic pathway between yourself and another being for one hour.

name: Telepathic Network
description: When you wish it, you can contact up to ten beings known to you, no matter where they are. All targets must be willing and able to communicate. All beings in the network are linked and can communicate telepathically with one another. They can also “overhear” anything said in the network, if they wish. The network lasts until you choose to end it.
tooltip: When you wish it, you can Contact up to ten beings known to you, no matter where they are.

name: Teleportation
description: You instantaneously transmit yourself or a target you touch to any location that you have seen or been to, no matter the distance, as long as it is on the same world as you.
tooltip: You instantaneously transmit yourself or a target you touch to any location you're familiar with, as long as it is on the same world as you.

name: Tell Me the Truth
description: They've got the goods—you just need to ring it out of them. Add a die to your dice pool for any Task where you are attempting to deceive, persuade or intimidate a target.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for any Task where you are attempting to deceive, persuade or intimidate a target.

name: Terran
description: Terrans colonized Plumeth over seven hundred years ago, and quickly established themselves as a presence in the star cluster by colonizing all of the Xaia system, forming the Coalition of Planets, introducing formal trade currency and colonizing most of the Huk'Va system. As a result, their numbers far outnumber that of any native species in the cluster. It also means they are incredibly diverse, shaped by their environment, beliefs and interactions with other living beings. Terrans tend to put their own self-interest above all. This has lead to a rising poverty line, distinct ethnic groups and a growing criminal presence as more and more Terrans struggle to find a place for themselves.

name: Terrifying Image
description: You use a bit of subtle telepathy to learn which images would appear terrifying to targets that you choose within short range. Those images appear in the minds of the beings and menace them. Success means the target flees in terror for one minute, pursued by its nightmares. Failure means the target ignores the images, which do not hamper it in any way.
tooltip: You make terrifying images appear in the minds of targets in short range, causing them to run in terror for one minute.

name: Terrifying Presence
description: You terrify one intelligent being, appearing as its worst nightmare with the help of a spirit remnant that you allow to temporarily possess you. The target must be within short range and be able to understand you. For as long as you do nothing but speak (you can't even move), the target is paralyzed with fear, runs away, or takes some other Action appropriate to the circumstances.
tooltip: You terrify an intelligent being within short range, causing them to be paralyzed with fear or to run away from you.

name: The Most Contacts
description:
Choose a location. At that location you either have:
  • One Contact trained in two areas of your choosing.
  • Two Contacts trained in one Skill of your choosing each.
The Contact(s) will provide you with any information they are capable of supplying.

name: The Wild Is on Your Side
description: While you're in the wilderness, targets within short range are tripped by rocks, tangled in vines, bitten by insects, and distracted or confused by small animals. Those targets are dazed for at least one round, or until the effect ends naturally.
tooltip: You cause a target within short range to become confused and distracted by nature, dazing them for at least one round.

name: There's Your Problem
description: When faced with a problem with multiple solutions, the GM will provide a hint as to which is the best option (like the best way to pack a truck, calm an enraged customer, give a cat a shot of insulin, or find a route through the city for maximum speed). This can only be done once per problem you are trying to solve. When dealing with multiple problems in succession, the GM decides how many hints to provide.
tooltip: When faced with a problem with multiple solutions, the GM will provide a hint as to which is the best option.

name: Thick Skin
description: You take the hits no one else can, and then some. You ignore the negative effects from mixed successes in combat.
tooltip: You take the hits no one else can, and then some. You ignore the negative effects from mixed successes in combat.

name: Thickheaded
description: A mixture of stubbornness and past abuse has left you callous to the world around you and the plight of others. Ignore the negative effects of mixed successes for social interactions, making it as though you got a regular success on the roll instead.
tooltip: You ignore the negative effects of mixed successes for social interactions.

name: Third Eye
description: You visualize a place within short range and cast your mind to that place, creating an immobile, invisible sensor for one minute or until you choose to end this Ability. While using your third eye, you see through your sensor instead of your eyes using your normal visual abilities. You may perceive the area around your body using your other senses as normal.
tooltip: You visualize a place within short range, creating an immobile, invisible sensor you can see through for up to one minute.

name: This Will Hurt a Bit
description:
You know when you said it will hurt you more than it hurts them? You lied. You heal a modest amount of health to a target (equivalent to a Tier 3 Ability), but you have inflict a small amount of pain to the recipient before healing them—such as cauterizing the wound or snapping a joint back into its socket.

The target can treat your hostile actions as an Attack, and may defend against it or just take the hit. If they defend against the Attack successfully, they do not receive any benefits from you.
tooltip: You heal a modest amount of health to a target, but you have inflict a small amount of pain to the recipient before healing them.

name: Thrill Seeker
description: Add a die to your dice pool when tackling athletic Tasks that involve taking significant risks.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when tackling athletic Tasks that involve taking significant risks.

name: Throw
description: When you deal damage to a target with an unarmed Attack, you can choose to throw them up to 1d20 feet away from you, or up to 1d20 hexes ⬢ or squares ■ away, divided by ten and rounded up. The target lands prone.
tooltip: You perform an unarmed Attack on a target and throw it up to 1d20 feet away, or up to 1d20 hexes ⬢ or squares ■ away, divided by ten and rounded up.

name: Throw Off Affliction
description: If you are affected by an unwanted condition or affliction (such as disease, paralysis, mind control, broken limb, and so on, but not damage), you can attempt to throw it off through sheer force of will. Some afflictions and diseases may be impossible to remove.
tooltip: You attempt to throw off an unwanted condition or affliction. Some may not be possible to remove.

name: Throwing Arm
description: You can now throw your bombs at long range.
tooltip: You can now throw your bombs at long range.

name: Thrust
description: This is a powerful melee stab. You make an Attack and add a die to your dice pool if your weapon has a sharp edge or point.
tooltip: You make an Attack and add a die to your dice pool if your weapon has a sharp edge or point.

name: Thunderstorm
description: You summon a terrible thunderstorm centered on a spot you can see within 1000 feet (305 m) or up to fifty hexes ⬢ or squares ■. The area within 250 feet (76 m) or up to eighteen hexes ⬢ or squares ■ is assailed by a thunderstorm for five minutes, causing widespread damage to structures and terrain in the area. Lightning strikes often as a deluge of heavy rain comes down, starting fires and causing minor explosions to occur. Creatures and characters struck by lightning are subject to storm damage and are rooted in place until the storm dissipates.
tooltip: You summon a terrible thunderstorm for five minutes, causing widespread damage to characters, creatures, structures and terrain in the area.

name: Time Alone
description: To recharge from being in a large group of people for too long, you take an hour long Rest. This counts as your Short Rest, and you must be alone for the entirety of the hour to no longer be Drained.
tooltip: You take an hour-long Rest to recover from social interactions. You are no longer Drained once the Rest is over.

name: Tinker
description: Add a die to your dice pool to make a device do something different from its original purpose. For example, a blaster becomes a bomb. A scanner becomes a signal booster for a radio transmitter. A music player becomes a battery for another device. The device is rendered unusable until repaired (after you've used it to do something other than its intended purpose).
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool to make a device do something different from its original purpose.

name: Tireless Travel
description: You can walk, swim, or otherwise travel in half the time as regular people. Does not count the time it takes to travel by starship.
tooltip: You can walk, swim, or otherwise travel in half the time as regular people. Does not count the time it takes to travel by starship.

name: To Those Who Wait
description: Taking your time, you watch from the sidelines, waiting for the right time to jump in. As such, you usually have a better understanding of the situation and how to exploit it to your advantage. If you are the last to act in any given interaction, add a die to your dice pool for the Task.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for the Task if you are the last to act in any given interaction.

name: Tool Master
description: If you are trained in using a specific tool or set of tools, an associated Task takes half the amount of time to complete.
tooltip: If you are trained in using a specific tool or set of tools, an associated Task takes half the amount of time to complete.

name: Tooth & Nail
description: If, during a melee combat, you are willing to literally bite and claw at a target in addition to Attacking with your normal weapon, add one die to your dice pool. Some targets (such as automatons or incorporeal creatures) might not be subject to this, and attempting to bite some targets might be dangerous.
tooltip: You literally bite and claw at a target in addition to Attacking with your normal weapon, adding one die to your dice pool.

name: Totally Chill
description: You immediately take a Short Rest. This is in addition to your normal Short Rest. Can only do once between Long Rests.
tooltip: You immediately take a Short Rest. This is in addition to your normal Short Rest. Can only do once between Long Rests.

name: Touch of the Goddess
description: You touch a target to restore it back to full health. A target can benefit from this Ability only once each day.
tooltip: You touch a target to restore it back to full health.

name: Tough as Nails
description: Whenever you're about to die, you can make a 2d Feelings roll to avoid dying. Each time you attempt to save yourself with this Ability before your next Long Rest, remove a die from your dice pool for this Action. You can perform this Feat even if you already acted this round.
tooltip: You make a 2d Feelings roll to avoid dying. Remove a die from your dice pool each time you perform this Feat before Long Resting.

name: Tough as They Come
description: Lying bleeding in the dirt isn't an option for a survivor. You can take an additional Short Rest in between your Long Rests.
tooltip: You immediately take a Short Rest. This is in addition to your regular Short Rest.

name: Traders & Commerce Guild Trade Routes
description: You have the latest trade routes used by the Traders and Commerce Guild.

name: Transcend the Script
description: Whether they are lines you wrote, acted, reported on, or otherwise incorporated into your talent, you compose an oratory on the fly that is so wonderful that even you believe it. You and every ally who hears this speech adds two dice to their dice pool on their next Action.
tooltip: You and every ally who hears this speech adds two dice to their dice pool on their next Action.

name: Transformative Gaze
description: You may now use any your powers that affect objects within your Focus without the need for touch, at up to short range. Does not apply to Abilities that target characters or creatures.
tooltip: You may now use any your powers that affect objects within your Focus without the need for touch, at up to short range.

name: Transhumanist Ideal
description:
Magic is no longer effective on you—unless it's Divine or Spirit Magic. If you use or get Attacked by Divine or Spirit Magic, you automatically get an Intrusion. Additionally, you are harmed whenever someone tries to use Divine or Spirit Magic to support you.

However, you no longer get Intrusions (though you still fail the roll), and you ignore the negative effects of mixed successes when dealing with any other type of Magic (Psi, Fire, etc.)
tooltip: You automatically get an Intrusion for Divine or Spirit Magic. You don't get Intrusions and ignore mixed successes for all other Magic.

name: Transmit Wonder to Others
description: You can affect others with your sense of wonder and peculiar way of looking at the world. When you do, you speak with such wonder and sincerity that you and allies who hear add a die to their dice pool for any Task. If the Task is related to the subject of your wondrous description, they add two dice instead.
tooltip: You speak with such wonder and sincerity that you and allies who hear add a die to their dice pool for any Task.

name: Transmith
description: If given a week and the right tools, chemicals, and parts, you can tinker with one of your Items, transforming it into another Item that you had in the past. The GM and player should collaborate to ensure that the transformation is logical—for example, you probably can't transform a pill into a helmet.
tooltip: Given a week and the right tools, chemicals, and parts, you transform an Item into another Item that you had in the past.

name: Transportation
description: You have access to a land vehicle, shuttle or short range starship of your choice.

name: Trap
description: Add a die to your dice pool when setting a trap. Once the trap is sprung it deals damage and immobilizes the target until it spends a round breaking loose.
tooltip: You set a trap. Once the trap is sprung it deals damage and immobilizes the target until it spends a round breaking loose.

name: Trauma
description: Every time you get an Intrusion (whether it affects you or not), there is a chance you will freeze up and be unable to act for the following round. In practice, this means the GM will roll 1d2 to determine whether it works in your favour or not.
tooltip: Every time you get an Intrusion, there is a chance you will freeze up and be unable to act for the following round.

name: Travel Skill
description:
You are skilled at navigating and finding your way. Select one of the following Skills:

  • Land Vehicle Piloting
  • Pathfinding
  • Riding
  • Starship Piloting
  • Urban Navigation

name: Travel Skill
description:
Your are skilled at navigating and finding your way. Select one of the following Skills:

  • Land Vehicle Piloting
  • Pathfinding
  • Riding
  • Starship Piloting
  • Urban Navigation

name: Traverse Worlds
description: You instantaneously transmit yourself or a target you touch to another planet, dimension, plane, or level of reality. You must know that the destination exists; the GM will decide if you have enough information to confirm its existence.
tooltip: You instantaneously transmit yourself or a target you touch to another planet, dimension, plane, or level of reality that you know exists.

name: Trick Shot
description: You fire your gun at a target you can't actually see, angling your gun around corners or from behind cover. This allows you to circumvent cover and other penalties for your shot.
tooltip: You fire your gun at a target you can't actually see, angling your gun around corners or from behind cover.

name: Triumph of Strength
description: You pick up and throw an incredibly heavy object at a target within short range (as one Action), dealing crushing damage in the process.
tooltip: You pick up and throw an incredibly heavy object at a target within short range (as one Action), dealing crushing damage in the process.

name: Trivia
description: You look through your books to find the answer. If you use your Action to ask the GM a question, they must answer truthfully. Gaining knowledge of the future is impossible. Only usable once between Rests.
tooltip: You look through your books to find the answer. You ask the GM a question, they must answer truthfully.

name: True Defender
description: You are more capable when finding, healing, interacting with, and protecting your wards. You can have only three wards at a time.
tooltip: You are more capable when finding, healing, interacting with, and protecting your wards. You can have only three wards at a time.

name: True Radical
description: You are devoted to your cause, and you only get stronger in your conviction as you accomplish significant milestones towards your goal. You gain twice the amount of XP from completing each part in your Character Arc, including steps, climax and resolution.
tooltip: You gain twice the amount of XP from completing each part in your Character Arc, including steps, climax and resolution.

name: True Telepathy
description: You can speak telepathically with others who are within short range. Communication is two-way, but the other party must be willing and able to communicate. You don't have to see the target, but you must know that it’s within range. You can have more than one active contact at once, but you must establish contact with each target individually. Each contact lasts up to ten minutes.
tooltip: You can speak telepathically with others who are within short range for up to ten minutes.

name: Trust Fund
description: Because of your incredible wealth, you automatically benefit from the Wealthy Descriptor.
tooltip: Because of your incredible wealth, you automatically benefit from the Wealthy Descriptor.

name: Try Something, Anything!
description: You attempt to speak random magical sounding words or press random buttons on a device in an attempt to activate a scientific or magical Item or location. Flip a coin. If you get heads, you get a critical success. If you get tails, you fail and get an Intrusion.
tooltip: You attempt something random. Flip a coin. If you get heads, you get a critical success. If you get tails, you fail and get an Intrusion.

name: Try Anything Once
description: Anytime you attempt something you've never done before and that you aren't trained in, add a die to your dice pool for the Task.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for the Task when you attempt something you've never done before and that you aren't trained in.

name: Twisting the Knife
description: Whenever you Attack a target with a melee weapon, roll twice and take the more favourable result.
tooltip: You Attack a target with a melee weapon, roll twice and take the more favourable result.

name: Two Things at Once
description: The ultimate test: you divide your attention and take two separate Actions this round. Only one of these can be a Feat.
tooltip: You divide your attention and take two separate Actions this round. Only one of these can be a Feat.

name: Ultimate Union
description:
When you and your friend are within short distance, you share all your Abilities, and either can use them. You share all your Abilities from any source and either can activate and use them.

Additionally, you share health pools, meaning it is less likely that one of you will die with the other staying alive (though this may still happen).
tooltip: You and your friend share all your Abilities from any source, and either can activate and use them. You also share a health pool.

name: Unarmoured Fighter
description: If not wearing armour or clothing (undergarments are okay) while berserk, you negate all combat Intrusions (though you can still fail rolls).
tooltip: If not wearing armour or clothing (undergarments are okay) while berserk, you negate al combat Intrusions.

name: Uncanny Luck
description: When you roll for a non-combat Task and succeed, roll again. If you roll the same number again, treat the result as if you got a critical success or exact number instead (your choice). Otherwise, you simply succeed on the roll.
tooltip: Roll for a non-combat Task. On success, roll again. If you roll the same number, treat it as if you got critical success or exact number.

name: Underdeveloped
description: Whenever you get a mixed success on a physical Task, you fail the roll instead and get an Intrusion.
tooltip: Whenever you get a mixed success on a physical Task, you fail the roll instead and get an Intrusion.

name: Understand
description: You observe or study a character, creature, object, or location for at least one round. The next time you interact with it (possibly in the following round), add a die to your dice pool for a related Task (such as persuading the character, Attacking it, or defending from its Attack).
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when you next interact with something if you spent a round studying it.

name: Unending Violence
description: Every time you succeed at an Attack roll with a weapon, you can follow up with another Attack in the same round as a part of the same Action. You can Attack with a different weapon each time, as long as the next weapon is close at hand. In any case, remove a die from your dice pool for each successive Attack make with a weapon you already used to Attack with this round.
tooltip: Every time you succeed at an Attack roll with a weapon, you can follow up with another Attack in the same round.

name: Unexpected Betrayal
description: Within a round or two of successfully convincing a target you mean no harm, add two dice to your dice pool on your first Attack on the target. If you do Attack a target under these conditions, remove a die from your dice pool when using your Abilities or attempting simple persuasion on that target from that point on.
tooltip: Add two dice to your dice pool when you Attack a target you previously convinced you meant no harm, though they won't trust you again.

name: Unexpected Exit
description:
A surface is not as solid as it first appeared, and you make an opening through a solid wall or floor. You can use the opening to access the basement, the attic, or go through a wall up to an immediate range. Alternatively, a target within short range drops through said opening to whatever lies beneath (which might just be a ten-foot deep pit).

You may only perform this Feat through your Flash of Genius or Brilliant Blaze talents.
tooltip: You make an opening through a solid wall or floor up to an immediate range.

name: Unflinching
description: Nothing can stop you. You power through any and all who would stand in your way. You do not know fear. You are immune to fear and intimidation.
tooltip: Nothing can stop you. You power through any and all who would stand in your way. You are immune to fear and intimidation.

name: Uniform & Badge
description:
You're a member of the Dragoon Corps of Plumeth. The position comes with some benefits—even when you're off duty or on sabbatical. Your badge and your air of authority together inspire confidence in law-abiding citizens of the Coalition of Planets, but could bring resentment from outlaws. If wearing your uniform, you may not need to show your badge.

When speaking with an intelligent being who can understand you and isn't hostile, add a die to your dice pool if you use your Action to try to convince them to take a reasonable action the next time they act. A reasonable action must be agreed upon by the GM; it should not put the target or its allies in obvious danger or be wildly out of character.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool if you use your Action to convince an intelligent being to take a reasonable action the next time they act.

name: Unintended Consequences
description:
At one time, you had access to strong Psi Magic. But through your own actions or through circumstance, you are now mentally disabled, negatively affecting your mood, thinking and behaviour. Maybe you overdosed on crystal dust, or experienced intense side effects from Vox flight, or maybe you were just born this way. Whatever the case may be, what powers you may have once had are now erratic and uncontrollable. Proficiency in the use of Psi Magic is usually dependent on the knowledge of the individual and is limited by their constitution. Individuals can only use Psi Magic for so long before succumbing to fatigue or worse.

When using your Magical Abilities, use at least two Magic die instead of one. However, if you get a mixed success when using these Abilities, you get an Intrusion as if you failed the roll completely.
tooltip: You can use Magic, and use at least two Magic die instead of one. If you get a mixed success on a Magic roll, you get an Intrusion.

name: Unmovable
description: You avoid being knocked down, pushed back, or moved against your will as long as you are upright and able to take Actions.
tooltip: You avoid being knocked down, pushed back, or moved against your will as long as you are upright and able to take Actions.

name: Unstable Construction
description:
You have a 1d6 which is specific to your weapon. Instead of rolling for Tech, Magic, Logic or Feelings, you roll this 1d6 when using this weapon. It takes priority over all over dice in your dice pool, and so will always be the last one you remove if you're asked to remove a die from your pool (if you are using your weapon when such modifications come into play). You must choose a number between 2 and 6 every time you fire the weapon. If you roll below your number, you fail the roll and get an Intrusion. If you roll above your number, you succeed on the roll. If you roll your number exactly, you deal damage and inflict the equivalent effect. The higher your number, the stronger the effect will be. The lower your number, the less impact your weapon will have when you succeed.

Should you lose your weapon, you'll likely find or construct a new one within a day or so. Possible results of your roll include:

  1. Automatic Intrusion
  2. Taunt
  3. Distract
  4. Fear
  5. Daze
  6. Confuse
tooltip: Select a number between 2 and 6, and roll 1d6 whenever you use your experimental weapon. This die has priority over all others.

name: Unstoppable
description: When you get hurt, you shake it off. Where most would normally be hindered by being near death, you are not. You can still—however—still die from severe injuries or sickness. Do not remove a die from your dice pool when Unstable.
tooltip: You do not remove a die from your dice pool when Unstable.

name: Unstoppable Force
description: Until the end of the next round, you can move through solid objects such as doors and walls. Only 2 feet (60 cm) of wood, 1 foot (30 cm) of stone, or 6 inches (15 cm) of metal can stop your movement.
tooltip: Until the end of the next round, you can move through solid objects such as doors and walls.

name: Untouchable
description: You can change your phase so that you can’t affect or be affected by normal matter or energy, avoiding an Intrusion having to do with physical elements in the process. Only mental Attacks and psionic Magic, devices, or Abilities can affect you, but likewise you can't Attack, touch, or otherwise affect anything for one round afterwards. You can perform this Feat even if you've already acted this round, as long as you use it to avoid an Intrusion.
tooltip: You can change your phase, avoiding an Intrusion having to do with physical elements in the process.

name: Unwavering
description: Your bond is iron. Your will unbreakable. Who will stand against you? You no longer get an Intrusion when you fail a roll.
tooltip: Your bond is iron. Your will unbreakable. Who will stand against you? You no longer get an Intrusion when you fail a roll.

name: Up to Speed
description: If you do nothing but move for three Actions in a row, you accelerate greatly and can move up to 15 mph (about 1000 feet each round or up to fifty hexes ⬢ or squares ■) for up to ten minutes (about 2 miles or up to five hundred hexes ⬢ or squares ■ away), after which you must stop and take a Rest. (Move up to 25 kph [about 300 m each round] for up to ten minutes [about 3 km].) If you've used your Short Rest, you must take a Long Rest.
tooltip: You do nothing but move for three rounds, accelerating up to 15 mph for 10 minutes. Must Rest after.

name: Upgrades
description: You get an additional Cyberware of your choice. Add a die to your dice pool whenever you use this Cyberware with a related Task (including Attacks, if installing a weapon). Discuss with the GM to make sure you configure the Cyberware appropriately.
itemeffect: Add a die to your dice pool on a related Task when using this cyberware.

name: Uphold
description:
You grab and hold a heavy object, stopping it from falling and crushing someone, or just keeping it off the ground. You can hold the object for as long as you want once you're successful (within reason), as long as you spend your Action each turn concentrating on holding up the object.

Add a die to your dice pool for the initial attempt, and add a die to your Task roll if you decide to throw the object once you're done holding it. Otherwise, you simply let go of the object and it falls noisily to the ground.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool to hold a heavy object, spending an Action each turn to hold it up. Can throw once done holding.

name: Uphold Vow
description: You have taken a vow of service to defend and provide for the weak. You regain a small amount of health any time you take an Action that prevents someone physically weaker than you from taking damage, or willingly sacrifice something of your own to someone in need.
tooltip: You regain a small amount of health any time you help or protect someone weaker than you.

name: Use Senses of Others
description: You can see, hear, smell, touch, and taste through the senses of a target through telepathic contact. You can attempt to perform this Feat on a willing or unwilling target within long range; an unwilling target can try to resist. You don't need to see the target, but you must know that it’s within range. Your shared senses last ten minutes.
tooltip: You can see, hear, smell, touch, and taste through the senses of a target through telepathic contact for ten minutes.

name: Using What's Available
description: If you have the time and the freedom to scrounge for everyday materials in your environment, you can fashion a temporary asset that will aid you to accomplish a specific Task. For example, if you need to climb a wall, you could create some sort of climbing assistance device; if you need to break out of a cell, you can find something to use as a lockpick; if you need to create a small distraction, you could put together something to make a loud bang and flash; and so on. The asset lasts for a maximum of one minute, or until used for the intended purpose. One minute to assemble materials; Action to create asset.
tooltip: You fashion a temporary asset that will aid you to accomplish a specific Task.

name: Vacuum Skills
description:
You are trained in one of the following Skills:

  • Astronomy
  • Starship Engineering
  • Starship Piloting
  • Starship Sensors
  • Starship Weapon Systems

name: Valid Concerns
description: You're prepared for the worst, and so you aren't surprised when you start hearing strange voices in your head. You cannot suffer Intrusions where your mind is compromised or Attacked by outside forces.
tooltip: You're prepared for the worst. You cannot suffer Intrusions where your mind is compromised or Attacked by outside forces.

name: Visions of Death
description: A target you choose within short range withers, suffering Magic damage.
tooltip: A target you choose within short range withers, suffering Magic damage.

name: Vow of Righteousness
description:
You have taken a vow of service to defend and provide for the weak. You regain a significant amount of health any time you take an Action that prevents someone other than you from taking damage, or willingly sacrifice something of your own to someone in need.

The person you help or protect no longer needs to be weaker than you.
tooltip: You regain a significant amount of health any time you help or protect someone else.

name: Walk Through Walls
description: You can slowly pass through physical barriers at a rate of 1 foot (30 cm) per round (minimum of one round to pass through any barrier). You can't act (other than moving) or perceive anything until you pass entirely through the barrier. You can’t pass through energy barriers.
tooltip: You can slowly pass through physical barriers at a rate of 1 foot per round.

name: Wall With Teeth
description: You specify a confined area—such as an open doorway, a hallway, or a space between two trees—where you stand. If anyone attempts to enter or pass through that area and you don't wish it, you make an automatic Attack against them. If you hit, not only do you inflict damage, but they must also stop their movement.
tooltip: If anyone attempts to enter or pass through a confined area you're Guarding, you make an automatic Attack against them.

name: Watch Their Back
description: Whenever you spend your whole Action Guarding someone physically weaker than you, you allow them to take another Action on their turn. You cannot perform this Feat with any other Ability.
tooltip: You spend your whole Action Guarding someone physically weaker than you, allowing them to take another Action on their turn.

name: Weave Their Fate
description: You see the lines of destiny stretching out from a target within short range of you. The next time you interact with it (possibly in the following round), add a die to your dice pool for any Task.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when you next interact with a target if you spent a round studying its lines of destiny.

name: Weight Manipulation
description: You alter the heaviness of an object you touch, making it up to twice or half as heavy. This effect lasts for one hour.
tooltip: You alter the heaviness of an object you touch, making it up to twice or half as heavy. This effect lasts for one hour.

name: Weight Manipulation
description: You alter the heaviness of an object within short range, making it up to twice or half as heavy. This effect lasts for one hour.
tooltip: You alter the heaviness of an object within short range, making it up to twice or half as heavy. This effect lasts for one hour.

name: Weightless Shot
description:
You have a sixth sense when it comes to lining up trajectories and moving in low and zero gravity environments, which also translates to making ranged Attacks. When you hit a target with a ranged Attack in microgravity conditions, you can choose to hit the target in a precise spot to get a secondary effect in addition to dealing damage. Some of the possible effects include (but are not limited to) the following:

  • You punch a hole in the target’s suit, so it begins to leak air into the vacuum slowly, or all at once (your choice).
  • You hit the target’s power source, which means the target can no longer change their trajectory, or they go spinning off in a random direction (your choice).
  • You can shoot a spacecraft, and degrade one ship system by one step (systems include engines, weapons, and atmosphere).
tooltip: You hit a target with a ranged Attack in zero-gravity, dealing damage and getting a secondary effect of your choice.

name: Weird Science Breakthrough
description: Your research leads to a breakthrough, and you imbue an object with a truly amazing property. To do so, you must use spare parts equal to an Expensive Item, have a field science kit or a permanent lab, and succeed on a Tech roll (can be modified by Skills or traits). When complete, you only need one die to succeed when using the device. You must still roll each time you use the device. If you fail the roll, the device breaks and won't function again until it is repaired. Any Abilities that change the outcome of Intrusions or mixed successes don't apply to this roll. Action to initiate, one hour to complete.
tooltip: You imbue an object with a truly amazing property, allowing you to succeed with only one die when using that device until it breaks.

name: Well-being of the Other
description:
When you and your friend are within immediate distance of each other, you can share damage. This can be used so that the effects of the Intrusion aimed at you are transferred to your friend, or your friend can re-roll one of your mixed success rolls.

Taking either an Intrusion or re-rolling a mixed result counts as the friend's Action, and they must take the result of their roll.
tooltip: You take the effects of the Intrusion aimed at your friend, or re-roll their mixed success roll.

name: Were There Always Five of You?
description: You create four duplicates of yourself within short range that appear in the minds of all targets within long range of you. Only those affected by the Ability experience the hallucination. The duplicates last for one minute. You mentally direct their Actions, and the duplicates aren't mirror images—each one can do different things. If struck violently, the target realizes the duplicates are not real and so they disappear permanently. If targets move out of long range of you, they no longer experience the hallucination. Any target that moves within long range of you will begin experiencing the hallucination as long as it is active.
tooltip: You create four duplicates of yourself within short range that appear in the minds of all targets within long range of you.

name: What Goes Around
description: Once per session you can help a fellow party member to re-roll a failed roll without spending an XP to do so.
tooltip: Once per session you can help a fellow party member to re-roll a failed roll without spending an XP to do so.

name: What's This in My Pocket?
description:
You're sure it wasn't there before, but it is now. You pull an Item from your pocket. The GM determines what kind.

You may only perform this Feat through your Flash of Genius or Brilliant Blaze talents.
tooltip: You're sure it wasn't there before, but it is now. You pull an Item from your pocket. The GM determines what kind.

name: Whip Crack
description: You hit your target in just the right spot with your whip, stunning them so that they lose their next Action in addition to dealing damage. Alternatively, you can attempt to stun everyone within short range by creating the sound of a cracking whip so loud that they are similarly stunned, but take no damage.
tooltip: You stun and damage a target with your whip, or stun all beings within short range, but dealing no damage.

name: Whip Disarm
description: Using your whip, you make an Attack against a target wielding a weapon, disarming them so that their weapon is now an immediate range away on the ground, or in your hands—your choice.
tooltip: You disarm a target holding a weapon so that their weapon is now an immediate range away on the ground, or in your hands.

name: Whirling Dervish
description: When you wield two weapons, you can Attack up to six times in one round as a single Action.
tooltip: You can Attack up to six times in one round as a single Action.

name: Wild Flight
description: Trees and other plants wrap around you and move you up to short distance to a location of your choice, even high in the air. This Ability only works in an area with sufficient plants to grow and move you about.
tooltip: Trees and other plants wrap around you and move you up to short distance to a location of your choice, even high in the air.

name: Wild Vitality
description: You attune with the life force of a natural creature within short range that you can see. The creature is not harmed, but through resonance with its wild vitality, add two dice to your dice pool on all physical Tasks.
tooltip: You attune with the life force of a natural creature, adding two dice to your dice pool on a physical Task.

name: Wild Walk
description: You leave no trace when passing through natural terrain. It is impossible to track you in nature. Use your Magic die for your movement or stealth roll if in a natural setting.
tooltip: Use your Magic die for your movement or stealth roll if in a natural setting.

name: Will of Legend
description: You are immune to Attacks that would captivate, mesmerize, charm, erase, daze, stun, or otherwise influence your mind.
tooltip: You are immune to Attacks that would captivate, mesmerize, charm, erase, daze, stun, or otherwise influence your mind.

name: Willing Sacrifice
description: When you Take the Attack for another being, you negate some of the damage as if you were Guarding against an Attack.
tooltip: You Take the Attack for another being, negating some of the damage as if you were Guarding against an Attack.

name: Wind Armour
tooltip: A cyclone of wind surrounds your body that blocks ranged projectiles makes it difficult for melee targets to approach you.

name: Winds to Your Back
description: You call on the winds of the planet you are currently on so that you and up to ten other beings within immediate distance travel overland at ten times the normal rate for up to eight hours. At this speed, most dangerous encounters or regions of rough terrain are ignored, though the GM may declare exceptions. Outright barriers still present a problem.
tooltip: You and up to ten other beings travel overland at ten times the normal rate for up to eight hours.

name: Winter Winds
description: You Attack a target within short range using a blast of cold wind that assails their physical form with frost damage. You must be able to see your target.
tooltip: You Attack a target within short range using a blast of cold wind that assails their physical form with frost damage.

name: Wireless Link
description:
You have technology ensures that you can always communicate with your allies, no matter where they are located. The GM may determine that certain locations block the signal (such as within sealed bunkers designed to prevent just such sorts of communication).

Select one of the following:

  • Communicator (Item)
  • Wireless Communications Node (Cyberware)
  • Access to a communications array, or some kind of subsystem in your ship or envirosuit.

name: Work Hazard
description: You take the brunt of an Attack made against your ship or vehicle, getting hit by an exploding console or shocked by a grizzly energy surge. You die, but your ship or vehicle is unharmed.
tooltip: You take the brunt of an Attack made against your ship or vehicle, dying in the process, but leaving your ship or vehicle unharmed.

name: Work Smarter, Not Harder
description: You see where objects are most likely to break. Add a die to your dice pool on any Task that would normally depend on brute force (but which you accomplish with an apparently light touch). Examples include opening a barred door or a locked container with a deft touch instead of smashing it, shifting a heavy object without lifting it, opening a hole in a solid wall by finding a keystone, and so on.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool on a Task that would normally depend on brute force (but which you accomplish with an apparently light touch).

name: Work the Friendship
description: You know just what to say to draw a little extra effort from an ally. This grants one target of your choice within short range an additional, immediate Action, which it can take out of turn. The target uses the Action you give it however it wishes.
tooltip: You grant one target of your choice within short range an additional, immediate Action, which it can take out of turn.

name: Wormhole
description: You create a doorway through time and space. The shortcut manifests as a hole in reality large enough to accommodate you, and any beings you choose. One side of the doorway appears anywhere within immediate range, and the other side opens at a spot you choose anywhere within long range. Any being or object moving into one side exits from the other. The door remains open for one minute or until you use an Action to close it.
tooltip: You create a doorway through time and space, allowing beings or objects to move from it to an exit at long range for up to a minute.

name: You Can't Touch This
description:
Instead of Attacking this round in combat, you invite an enemy through your method of choice (persuasion, intimidation, etc.) to Attack you directly. If you succeed, the enemy then rolls as a PC would, with much stricter success criteria than an unmodified player character would get. The number of dice the enemy rolls depends on how much of a threat they are. Insignificant threats may just get an Intrusion without rolling.

  • Failure (0) - Intrusion against the enemy
  • Failure (1) - Intrusion against the enemy
  • Minor Failure (2) - The enemy fails on their Attack, and you retaliate in response
  • Mixed Success (3) - The enemy succeeds on their Attack, but they also take damage as retaliation
tooltip: Instead of Attacking this round in combat, you invite an enemy to perform an Attack on you, with much stricter success criteria than normal.

name: You've Got a Friend in Me
description: Through wit, charm, humor, and grace, add a die to your dice pool in all social interactions other than those involving coercion or intimidation.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool in all social interactions other than those involving coercion or intimidation.

name: Your Obsession
description: At the beginning of each session, choose one topic or ideal on which you will concentrate. For the rest of that session, you're obsessed with that choice. This doesn't mean you ignore anything not related to your obsession—it just means you are at your best when performing Tasks related to it. Remove a die from your dice pool when attempting a Task unrelated to your current obsession.
tooltip: Remove a die from your dice pool when attempting a Task unrelated to your current obsession.

name: Sentry Mode
tooltip: The robot acts as an autonomous turret, Attacking targets on its own. If fired by a character, add a die to the dice pool for the Attack.

name: Robotic Flight
description: Your robot assistant can fly a long distance each round. It can carry you, but only for up to an hour between each of your Long Rests.
tooltip: Your robot assistant can fly a long distance each round. It can carry you, but only for up to an hour between each of your Long Rests.

name: Mounted Laser Configuration
description: Your robot assistant can reconfigure itself and become an immobile laser weapon on a gimbal mount. In this configuration, the robot acts as an autonomous turret, being able to Attack targets on its own. However, if the laser is fired by you or someone else who has your permission, add one die to the dice pool for the Attack. Action to reconfigure; Action to return to normal robot configuration.
tooltip: Your robot assistant reconfigures itself to become an immobile laser weapon on a gimbal mount that can Attack targets on its own.

name: Force Shield
description: Your robot assistant can erect a translucent Psi force field around itself and anyone within immediate range of it for one minute (or until it is destroyed). It cannot do so again until after you Rest.
tooltip: Your robot assistant can erect a translucent Psi force field around itself and anyone within immediate range of it for up to one minute.

name: Credit Chip
description: You begin the game with a credit chip equal in value to a Moderately Priced Item.

name: Loosey Goosey
description: You can re-roll any dice roll once without paying 1 XP. You must take result of this re-roll.
tooltip: You can re-roll any dice roll once without paying 1 XP. You must take the result of this re-roll.

name: Match Day Fervor
description: Add a die to your roll for any physical task as long as your team is playing today, and you are aware of it or you can view a stream of the match sometime during the day. Your team likely plays in a match every three to five days. Discuss the schedule with the GM.
tooltip: Add a die to your roll for any physical task as long as your team is playing today, and you are aware of it.

name: Rally
description: You inspire your comrades with a fervent maneuver! You automatically succeed at Helping an ally within short range with an Attack.
tooltip: Automatically succeed at Helping an ally within short range with an attack.

name: Studied
description: You've studied at a university or other place of learning and still have access to its reservoirs of knowledge, where appropriate.

name: Academic Ally
description: You gain a Contact long-term benefit representing a mentor in academic circles. They are trained in the Knowledge Skill of your choice.

name: Unique Perspective
description: You may use a Knowledge Skill of your choice in lieu of the Healing Skill to add dice to your dice pool when using this ability.
tooltip: You Heal using a Knowledge Skill of your choice in lieu of the Healing Skill, adding dice to your dice pool accordingly.

name: First Impression
description: You make a good first impression on a target that can understand you, adding two dice to your dice pool on your first positive social interaction with them.
tooltip: Add two dice to your dice pool on your first positive social interaction with a target than can understand you.

name: Find the Faithful
description: Add a die to your dice pool for all social interactions related to recruitment and conversion to your faith.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for all social interactions related to recruitment and conversion to your faith.

name: Of the Cloth
description: You are a recognized member of your religious order. You are entitled to food and shelter at places of worship for your order.
tooltip: You are a recognized member of your religious order. You are entitled to food and shelter at places of worship for your order.

name: Solace
description: You pray to the Divine while Resting, healing Harm equal to your Tier plus one. This ability counts as your Short Rest.
tooltip: You pray to the Divine while Resting, healing Harm equal to your Tier plus one. This ability counts as your Short Rest.

name: On Holy Ground
description: When you are in a location sanctified or sacred to your faith, roll at least two Magic dice instead of one when performing a Divine Magic action.
tooltip: Roll at least two Magic dice instead of one when performing a Divine Magic action while in a location sanctified or sacred to your faith.

name: Divine Symbol
description: You draw a Divine symbol on a nearby surface or in the air in front of you that extends out in all direction in a Short radius. Allies standing within the symbol's radius automatically receive an additional die to their dice pool on a single task. Allies can only benefit from the symbol's power once. Enemies or those opposed to the Divine standing within the symbol's radius take Harm as long as they stand within it.
tooltip: You draw a Divine symbol near you, damaging enemies and giving allies an additional die to their dice pool on a single task.

name: Divine Judgement
description: You bathe a target in short range with Divine energy, causing Harm. Getting a critical success kills the target ouright.
tooltip: You bathe a target in short range with Divine energy, causing Harm. Getting a critical success kills the target ouright.

name: Crusade
description: Your faith is unwavering, and your devotion to the Divine protects you. You do not get an Intrusion when you fail a roll related to the Divine. Discuss with the GM whether a task is sufficiently relevant to the Divine for this ability to activate.
tooltip: You do not get an Intrusion when you fail a roll related to the Divine.

name: Solicit
description: All things considered, the universe isn't a bad place at all. You have a knack for asking for food, water or shelter. Add a die to your dice pool for any positive social interaction where you are trying to get supplies or ask for shelter from someone.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for any positive social interaction where you are trying to get supplies or ask for shelter from someone.

name: Local Help
description: You ask someone native to the area to provide you with one random fact that will assist you in your current task or quest. Can only do once per Long Rest.
tooltip: You ask someone native to the area to provide you with one random fact that will assist you in your current task or quest.

name: Recall Lore
description: You recall lore specific to the planet your are on or to the civilized species you're interacting with. Only usable once between each Rest.
tooltip: You recall lore specific to the planet your are on or to the civilized species you're interacting with.

name: Wingman
description: You possess a follower serving as your bodyguard or party companion. They are skilled in one social Skill of your choice. If you lose your wingman for any reason, you can gain a new one within 2 weeks.
itemeffect: A follower serving as your bodyguard or party companion.

name: Traveler's Luck
description: Sometimes, luck isn't enough. You can re-roll once without paying any XP between Rests.
tooltip: You can re-roll once without paying any XP between each Rest.

name: Fashionably Late
description: You seamlessly jump into a scene of your choice currently going on, such as a nearby combat or negotiation, adding two dice to your dice roll so long as you’re a bit late (a few rounds or minutes).
tooltip: Add two dice to your dice roll if you arrive a few rounds or minutes late to an encounter.

name: Life of the Party
description: You cause a major distraction, drawing all attention in the area to you or whatever it is you’ve done. Affected targets are Distracted as long as you spend your action each round to Distract them.
tooltip: You cause a major distraction, drawing all attention in the area to you or whatever it is you’ve done.

name: No Intervention Needed
description: If you so choose, you no longer feel the short-term negative effects from over-indulging in alcohol, drugs or other vices, such as drunkeness, drowsiness or loss of focus.
