description: Your outward, chilly facade hides a much warmer interior, though you do your best to hide it. You ignore the negative effects of mixed successes during social interactions, meaning you only need one die to succeed.
tooltip: You ignore the negative effects of mixed successes during social interactions, meaning you only need one die to succeed.

name: Skill With Attacks
description:
Choose one type of weapon or Attack in which you are not already trained:

  • Automatic Weapons
  • Blades
  • Blunt Weapons
  • Bows
  • Crossbows
  • Pistols
  • Polearms
  • Rifles
  • Shotguns
  • Throwing Weapons
  • Unarmed Attacks
  • Whips

You are trained in Attacks using that type of weapon or Attack.

name: I Can Do Better
description: You have to be the best—because you are the best! If you perform the same Action another character performed immediately after they did, add two dice to your dice pool for the Task. However, you won't accept anything less than absolute victory. If you get a mixed success, you fail the roll instead and get an Intrusion.
tooltip: You perform the same Action another character performed immediately after they did, adding two dice to your dice pool for the Task. On a mixed success, fail the roll and get an Intrusion.

name: Everything's Fine
description: It's fine, everything is fine. You don't need to do anything—things will work out on their own. Instead of a normal Action this round, you do nothing. If you succeed in doing nothing, you receive 1 XP. If you fail or get a mixed success, the Task resolves as normal. You cannot take any other Actions in the same round as you use this Feat, even if another Ability allows you to.
tooltip: You do nothing. If you succeed, receive 1 XP. If you fail or get a mixed success, the Task resolves as normal.

name: Escalate
description: You feel like nothing's getting resolved here. You convince a target who can understand you to allow you to deal with a matter with their superior or manager, adding a die to your dice pool for the roll. If successful, you begin speaking to another character instead.
tooltip: You convince a target who can understand you to allow you to deal with a matter with their superior or manager.

name: Take Action
description: You're tired of complaining and seeing nothing done about it. Time to take things into your own hands. Add two die to your dice pool if you tackle a Task directly related to something you previously complained about in a previous round.
tooltip: Add two die to your dice pool if you tackle a Task directly related to something you previously complained about in a previous round.

name: Compulsion
description: If you use your Action to acquire a desirable object or person, you no longer have disadvantage on the roll, adding a die to your dice pool instead for the related Task.
tooltip: You attempt to acquire a desirable object or person. You do not have disadvantage for this Feat.

name: Indulge
description: You indulge in a vice of your choice, restoring a small amount of health to yourself in the process. Usable once between each Rest.
tooltip: You indulge in a vice of your choice, restoring a small amount of health to yourself in the process.

name: Reisist Urges
description: Once between each Long Rest, you can attempt to gain some Self-control. If successful, you do not have disadvantage on your Task rolls if something you want is within long range until your next Long Rest. If you fail, you must wait until your next Rest to try again.
tooltip: You attempt to gain some Self-control. If successful, you do not have disadvantage on your Task rolls.

name: Self-control
tooltip: You do not have disadvantage on your Task rolls if something you want is within long range until your next Long Rest.

name: Enabler
description:
Sometimes, you just need a dteady flow of distractions to keep you going. You now have a companion who follows you everywhere who's primary purpose is either to provide what you desire, or can acquire it for you easily. Some time must pass between each request for something desirable from your companion, manifesting itself as either time needed to acquire more goods, or the time needed to go out and get something. The companion can either be a person or perhaps a robot, but it must be able to follow complex orders.

The companion will not assist you in any encounters, including combat. They will hide away instead until danger has passed. If you lose your Enabler, you can recruit a new one within 1d6+3 days.
itemeffect: A companion who's primary purpose is to acquire or provide objects or people for you.

name: Self-assured
description: You're confident in your skills. If you're trained in a Skill, add an additional die to your dice pool for the associated Task roll. In other words, instead of adding one die for a Skill you're trained in, you add two.
tooltip: If you're trained in a Skill, add an additional die to your dice pool for the associated Task roll.

name: Ego Hit
description: And you were so sure of yourself. Whenever you fail a roll and get an Intrusion, you are also stunned for the following round.
tooltip: Whenever you fail a roll and get an Intrusion, you are also stunned for the following round.

name: Exploit Loophole
description: You use a loophole in local laws or the rules of a game to get yourself or someone you know out of trouble. Add a die to your dice pool on social interactions with authority figures.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool on social interactions with authority figures.

name: Wait, What?
description: Sorry, you weren't paying attention. You ask someone who can understand you and who was previously talking to you to repeat themselves, distracting them for one round as they repeat the last thing they said.
tooltip: You ask someone who can understand you and who was previously talking to you to repeat themselves.

name: What's This in My Pocket?
description: You're sure it wasn't there before, but it is now. You pull an Item from your pocket. The GM determines what kind.
tooltip: You're sure it wasn't there before, but it is now. You pull an Item from your pocket. The GM determines what kind.

name: Help Me Understand
description: You told them—you just don't get it. Maybe if you explain why you don't get it, they'll understand why you don't understand. If you spend your Action explaining something you don't quite get to someone who can understand you, they become confused for 1d4 rounds while they try to work it out.
tooltip: You confuse a target for 1d4 rounds by trying to explain you don't understand something.

name: What Was I Doing Again?
description: You no longer have to pay XP when re-rolling as long as you perform a significantly different Action each time you re-roll. So for example, if you fail at jumping over a gap, you could use this Ability to try to creep along a ledge next to the gap without needing to pay XP to do so.
tooltip: You no longer have to pay XP when re-rolling as long as you perform a significantly different Action each time you re-roll.

name: Overtime
description:
When you dedicate yourself to something, you're commited. You can spend as many rounds as you want working towards completing a specific Task. The more rounds you work on it, the more dice you add to your dice pool for the Task roll. For example, if you spend three rounds trying to convince someone to let you into a government building, you would add three dice to your dice pool for the associated Task.

You can spend as many rounds as you want every time you use this Feat, up to a maximum of five rounds. Any Task that would require more than five rounds would only add five dice to your dice pool. You do not roll until the last round of your performing your intended Action. If for whatever reason something would happen that would make it so you would be unable to complete your intended Action anytime between when you set off to do the Action and when you would complete it, you can choose to roll a number of dice equal to the amount of rounds that have passed since activating this Feat to perform your intended Action. Otherwise, you are not able to do your intended Action, but do not suffer any negative consequences.
tooltip: You spend a number of rounds toward completing a specific Task, adding a die to your dice pool for each round spent.

name: Ask for Help
description: You know you can't always do things alone. Add a die to your dice pool when trying to convince a character to Help you. If using this Feat on a willing player character, add a die to your dice pool on the Task they are helping you with in addition to any Help bonus you receive.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool to convince a character to Help you, or for a Task in which a willing player character is Helping you.

name: Coffee Break
description: Sometimes, what you need is just a nice little breather. You have an additional Short Rest in addition to your standard Short Rest. Usable once between each Long Rest.
tooltip: You have an additional Short Rest in addition to your standard Short Rest. Usable once between each Long Rest.

name: Exceed Limits
description: Knowing your limits also means knowing when to go beyond. You can take two separate Actions this round. Only one of the Actions can be a Feat.
tooltip: You take two separate Actions this round. Only one of the Actions can be a Feat.

name: Simply Adequate
description: Sometimes, just good enough is good enough. Remove a die from your dice pool. In exchange, you need one less die for each step of success when resolving the roll. This means you only need one die to succeed, two dice to get a critical success and you are unable to fail the roll.
tooltip: Remove a die from your dice pool. In exchange, you need one less die for each step of success when resolving the roll.

name: As Is Tradition
description: You recall an age old tradition or perceived social norm that directly relates to your current goal. You gain a piece of Insight without paying the required XP. Only usable once between each Rest.
tooltip: You recall an age old tradition or perceived social norm that directly relates to your current goal.

name: Metathesiophobia
description: Change isn't always good. In fact, most of the time, it's pretty bad. Whenever you get an Intrusion, the GM may take away XP from you as part of the Intrusion, as a representation of your fear of change.
tooltip: Whenever you get an Intrusion, the GM may take away XP from you as part of the Intrusion, as a representation of your fear of change.

name: If It Ain't Broke
description: For every round that you take the same Action as the previous round, add a die to your dice pool for the associated Task.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for every round that you take the same Action as the previous round.

name: Never Learn
description: There's a saying: those who don't learn from history are doomed to repeat it. Well, the saying is unfortunately true and is localised entirely around you. You do not get XP from Intrusions received from failed rolls.
tooltip: You do not get XP from Intrusions received from failed rolls.

name: Wolf Among Sheep
description: Add a die to your dice pool for any Task when it goes against what the majority of other characters are doing in any given encounter.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for any Task when it goes against what the majority of other characters are doing in any given encounter.

name: Shades
description: You have a stylish pair of sunglasses.

name: <hide>
itemname: Crafting Skill (specific Items of your choice)

name: Clever Tactics
description:
You are trained in your choice of the following Skills:

  • Deception
  • Disguise
  • Identify
  • Performance
  • Stealth
  • Storytelling
  • Survival

name: Clever Tactics
description:
You are trained in your choice of the following Skills:

  • Deception
  • Disguise
  • Identify
  • Performance
  • Stealth
  • Storytelling
  • Survival

name: Constructive Criticism
description: After someone that can understand you has taken an Action related to a Skill you're trained in, you can provide pointers for the next time they take a similar Action using the same Skill. They automatically succeed on the related Task. Only works for the next Action they take that directly relates to the pointers you provided. This Feat can only be used if the target already took the relevant Action.
tooltip: You Help someone who just took an Action related to a Skill you're trained in so that they succeed the next time they take a related Action.

name: Culture Skills
description:
You are trained in your choice of the following Skills:

  • Civil Norms (of another civilization)
  • Language Skill (of your choice)
  • Lore (of another civilization)

name: Culture Skills
description:
You are trained in your choice of the following Skills:

  • Civil Norms (of another civilization)
  • Language Skill (of your choice)
  • Lore (of another civilization)

name: Culture Skills
description:
You are trained in your choice of the following Skills:

  • Civil Norms (of another civilization)
  • Language Skill (of your choice)
  • Lore (of another civilization)

name: Bridge the Gap
description: You know just what to say and who to say it to, no matter who you find yourself with. You automatically succeed on a social interaction with a member of a civilized alien species. Only usable once between Rests.
tooltip: You automatically succeed on a social interaction with a member of a civilized alien species. Only usable once between Rests.

name: Ghosts of Cats Past
description: There's no limit when it comes to satiating your curiousity. When you get a mixed success on a Task related to curiosity, such as Insight, research or conduction tests, you fail and get an Intrusion instead.
tooltip: When you get a mixed success on a Task related to curiosity, you fail and get an Intrusion instead.

name: Creepy
description: Something about your countenance just screams "Danger" and "Keep Away". Remove a die from your dice pool on all positive social interactions.
tooltip: Remove a die from your dice pool on all positive social interactions.

name: You're On!
description: You're always down for a challenge. Whenever someone Helps you verbally with a Task, add an additional die to your dice pool. This is in addition to any bonus they provide if they succeed on their Help roll.
tooltip: When someone Helps you verbally with a Task, add an additional die to your dice pool. This is in addition to any other bonus they provide.

name: <hide>
tooltip: A dark secret which only you know, as discussed with the GM. Make extensive notes of your secret here.

name: No One Must Know
description:
This shouldn't be. There's no way you, of all people, should know what you know. Either through happenstance, some careless digging on your part, or through cosmic radiation, you have in your posession the knowledge of a secret so dark, so overwhelming that its mere utterance would cause society as you know it to collapse. And as far as you know, only you know about this secret.

At the start of the game, you and the GM need to discuss the nature of this secret. The secret should be directly related to the campaign, and should have major ramifications if revealed to the other players. Most if not all of your Intrusions are related to your secret. Your Abilities from your focus directly relate to keeping your secret safe from others, while trying to determine the best time and place to divulge it. Make a note of your secret once decided upon by the GM in your Notes.
tooltip: You have in your posession a secret so dark, so overwhelming that its mere utterance would cause society as you know it to collapse.

name: There Is Another
description: You didn't think it was possible, but here they are: someone who shares the burden of your dark secret. Someone to confide in and plan accordingly. They are trained in one Skill of your choice.
itemeffect: A person who knowns your dark secret, whom you can confide in

name: Darker Secrets
description: Somehow, it gets worst. Once between each rest, you can ask the GM one question related to your dark secret, which they must answer truthfully. You do not pay XP for this Insight.
tooltip: You ask the GM one question related to your dark secret, which they must answer truthfully. You do not pay XP for this Insight.

name: Pure Uncut Crystal
description: You start the game with a pure, uncut crystal Artifact. This Artifact is what inspired you to pursue the study of Magic, even though you have no idea what it does.
itemeffect: Artifact that inspired you to pursue the study of Magic, even though you have no idea what it does

name: Mundane
description: Even though you've spent most of your life in awe of Magic, you have had no or very little magical talent of your own. Your goal in life is to study and investigate the mysteries behind Magic, to best understand it and, secretly, one day be able to harness its power.
tooltip: You have no or very little magical talent.

name: Trigger Magic
description:
Through your research, you have been able to unlock some of the magical abilities of your crystal Artifact. Select one of the following Magic Abilities to emulate:

  • Magical Ward
  • The Divine's Hand
  • Wild Flight

name: Magical Ward
description: You are enveloped in a Magical ward, causing the next Magical Attack to consume the ward instead of damaging you. The ward is destroyed if you are Attacked by Magic, or whenever you next take a Rest. To protect against Magical Attacks, you must also be familiar with the hostile Magic; for example, if you have never experienced Spirit Magic, you can't protect against it.
tooltip: You are protected against the next Magical Attack by a Magical ward that is consumed once Attacked.

name: The Divine's Hand
description: Using your connection to the Divine, you imbue your weapon with the Divine's light. For as long as you hold the weapon, add your Magic die to any attack you make in addition to other modifiers. The weapon remains enchanted until your next Rest, or until it leaves your hands.
tooltip: You imbue your weapon with the Divine's light, activating the Divine Weapon status.

name: Divine Weapon
tooltip: Your weapon is imbued with Divine light, adding your Magic die to any attack you make in addition to other modifiers.

name: Wild Flight
description: Trees and other plants wrap around you and move you up to short distance to a location of your choice, even high in the air. This Ability only works in an area with sufficient plants to grow and move you about.
tooltip: Trees and other plants wrap around you and move you up to short distance to a location of your choice, even high in the air.

name: Trigger Magic
description:
Through your research, you have been able to unlock some of the magical abilities of your crystal Artifact. Select one of the following Magic Abilities to emulate:

  • Death Gaze
  • Redirect Attacks
  • Winds to Your Back

name: Winds to Your Back
description: You call on the winds of the planet you are currently on so that you and up to ten other beings within immediate distance travel overland at ten times the normal rate for up to eight hours. At this speed, most dangerous encounters or regions of rough terrain are ignored, though the GM may declare exceptions. Outright barriers still present a problem.
tooltip: You and up to ten other beings travel overland at ten times the normal rate for up to eight hours.

name: Death Gaze
description: You project a chilling gaze at all living beings within short range who can see you. Success means that the target is frozen in fear, not moving or taking Actions for one minute or until it is Attacked. Some beings without minds (such as robots) might be immune to Death Gaze.
tooltip: You project a chilling gaze at all living beings within short range who can see you.

name: Redirect Attacks
description: When you are the target of an Attack, you can attempt to redirect it using a defense roll. If you succeed, you can direct the Attack to another target in immediate range. You can perform this Feat as many times as you are Attacked in any given round, even if you already acted this round.
tooltip: You attempt to redirect an Attack against you towards a target in immediate range.

name: Magic Blast
description: Channeling your crystal Artifact and your newfound magical power, you send a blast of magical power for a Magic you control at a target at short range.
tooltip: You send a blast of magical power for a Magic you control at a target at short range.

name: Potential Achieved
description:
Finally, after all this time—you've done it. You've tapped into the power of Magic. Select one of the following Magics to control:

  • Aura Magic
  • Divine Magic
  • Elemental Magic
  • Primal Magic
  • Psi Magic
  • Spirit Magic

name: Aura Magic
description: Whenever you use your Magical Abilities from your Focus, you are using your body's innate energy through Aura Magic. Aura Magic focuses on self-discovery, the strength of self and the ability to materialize inner strength for external use. Aura Magic is most often used to increase an individual's physical capabilities beyond their natural limits. Aura can also be manifested as an external force to push or pull in a given direction. All sentient beings have an aura, ch'i or spirit which can be sensed by those adept in Aura Magic. An individual's aura contains their essence and can be read, manipulated or destroyed.
tooltip: You can use Magic, and your Magical Abilities from your Focus use Aura Magic.

name: Divine Magic
description: Whenever you use your Magical Abilities from your Focus, you are calling on the power of the Divine. Divine Magic is driven by virtues strongly tied to spiritual beliefs, so practitioners of Divine Magic normally have a strong sense of conviction to drive them forward. It promotes the growth of organic life while repulsing artificial constructs and spiritual remnants.
tooltip: You can use Magic, and your Magical Abilities from your Focus use Divine Magic.

name: Elemental Magic
description: Whenever you use your Magical Abilities from your Focus, you are unleashing the innate power of the elements. Different Magical Abilities use different elements. These include: Storm, Frost, Earth and Fire. All sentient beings have an affinity to the elements, whether they are aware of it or not.
tooltip: You can use Magic, and your Magical Abilities from your Focus use Storm, Frost, Earth or Fire Magic.

name: Primal Magic
description: Whenever you use Magical Abilities from your Focus, you are tapping into the underlying power of life itself, from the strongest bear to the smallest seed. It is very rare for someone to develop the necessary Skill set to learn Primal Magic, as it relies heavily on the individual being able to connect with nature on a fundamental level, resulting in a symbiotic relationship that benefits the individual as well as the flora and fauna they interact with.
tooltip: You can use Magic, and your Magical Abilities from your Focus use Primal Magic.

name: Psi Magic
description: Whenever you use Magic Abilities from your Focus, you are tapping into the unbound power of Psi. Proficiency in the use of Psi Magic is dependent on the knowledge of the individual and is limited by their constitution. Individuals can only use Psi Magic for so long before succumbing to fatigue or worse.
tooltip: You can use Magic, and your Magical Abilities from your Focus use Primal Magic.

name: Spirit Magic
description: Whenever you use Magic Abilities from your Focus, you are actually connecting with the spirits of the deceased, drawing on their remnant life force to give you otherworldly powers. The primary purpose of Spirit Magic is communication of the dead, but intermediate users of Spirit Magic can imbue spirit remnants into objects or living beings, allowing the deceased person to walk among the living once more.
tooltip: You can use Magic, and your Magical Abilities from your Focus use Spirit Magic.

name: Do It Now!
description: You take an immediate, out of turn Action, even if you're already acted this round. Only usable once between Rests.
tooltip: You take an immediate, out of turn Action, even if you're already acted this round. Only usable once between Rests.

name: Loyal & True
description: If someone asks you for Help and you agree to Help, you automatically succeed on your Help roll, adding a die to their dice pool for the Task.
tooltip: If someone asks you for Help and you agree to Help, you automatically succeed on your Help roll.

name: Bow & Curtsy
description: You know just how to defer to authority figures in most cultures, bending and twisting your body in the proper manner to add a die to your dice pool on all positive social interactions.
tooltip: You bend and twist your body in the proper manner to add a die to your dice pool on all positive social interactions.

name: P.A.G.E.
description: Through your dealings with nobles, authority figures and the wealthy, you come into possession of an android assistant named P.A.G.E. (Personal Assisant for Gentle Etiquette). It cannot take independent Actions, but it can be sent on errands to retreive things or delivery messages. Additionally, if within short range of you, the P.A.G.E. adds a die to all positive social interactions. If you lose your P.A.G.E. for whatever reason, you can claim your warranty and get a new one within 1d6+3 days.
itemeffect: Cannot take independent Actions, but it can be sent on errands to retreive things or delivery messages. Additionally, if within short range of you, adds a die to all positive social interactions.

name: Defy Fate
description: Whenever you receive an Intrusion, you can roll 1d2. If successful, you get a mixed success instead. If you fail, your Intrusion is doubly as gruesome or detrimental. Can be used even if you've already acted this round.
tooltip: Roll 1d2 after receiving an Intrusion. If successful, get a mixed success. If you fail, your Intrusion is doubly as gruesome or detrimental.

name: Dreams Become Real
description:
Through no will of your own, your dreams become a reality through innate Psionic Magical Skills. If you already have Magical Abilities, they don't necessarily use Psi Magic.

Proficiency in the use of Psi Magic is dependent on the knowledge of the individual and is limited by their constitution. Individuals can only use Psi Magic for so long before succumbing to fatigue or worse.
tooltip: Your imaginings become a reality through innate Psionic Magical Skills. If you don't already use Magic, your Focus Abilities use Psi Magic.

name: Manifest Phantasm
description:
The dam in your mind bursts, letting forth one of the many figments of your imagination and manifesting it into the real world.

When rolling for Magic for this Feat, do not follow the standard rules for success and failure. Instead, manifest a creature or character based on the result, using the following list as reference:

  1. Abomination – Causes all friendly and hostile targets within short range to run in fear
  2. Random Abstract Concept – Distracts friendly and hostile targets for one round the first time they come within short range of it
  3. Random Small Creature – Moves randomly within a short range radius
  4. Construct – A random robot, ship or vehicle that moves randomly within a long range radius
  5. Random Large Creature – Moves randomly within a short range radius, intimidating hostile targets within short range
  6. Random Character – Acts and reacts naturally to their surroundings
  7. Doppleganger – A copy of a random character that mimics all movements of the original, but cannot speak
  8. Divine Being – Avatar of a random diety that heals a small amount of Harm on all friendly targets within short range

The GM decides what is manifested, based on your past and general personality, and they control the manifestation while active. The manifested creature or character cannot Attack or be physically Attacked, and physical objects pass right through it. The manifestation lasts for 1d6 rounds, or when they go out of view of the caster or they're disrupted by some other means.
tooltip: You let forth a figment of your imagination, manifesting it into the real world. Roll for Magic to determine what is manifested.

name: Open the Way
description: You create a simple opening in a barrier of wood, stone, metal, or other solid substance. The opening is no more than an immediate distance across, and it extends up to a short distance through the material.
tooltip: You create a simple opening in a barrier of wood, stone, metal, or other solid substance that extends up to a short distance.

name: Manifest Phantasm
description:
The dam in your mind bursts, letting forth one of the many figments of your imagination and manifesting it into the real world.

When rolling for Magic for this Feat, do not follow the standard rules for success and failure. Instead, manifest a creature or character based on the result, using the following list as reference:

  1. Abomination – Causes all friendly and hostile targets within short range to run in fear, and Attacks with Shadow Magic
  2. Random Abstract Concept – Distracts friendly and hostile targets for one round the first time they come within short range of it, and Attacks with Psi Magic
  3. Random Small Creature – Moves randomly within a short range radius, and makes unarmed Attacks
  4. Construct – A random robot, ship or vehicles that moves randomly within a long range radius, and attacks with Tech
  5. Random Large Creature – Moves randomly within a short range radius, intimidating hostile targets within short range, and makes unarmed Attacks
  6. Random Character – Acts and reacts naturally to their surroundings, and makes Attacks with a random weapon or Magic
  7. Doppleganger – A copy of a random character that mimics all movements of the original, including Attacks, but cannot speak
  8. Divine Being – Avatar of a random diety that heals a small amount of Harm on all friendly targets within short range, and Attacks with a random Magic

The GM decides what is manifested, based on your past and general personality, and they control the manifestation while active. The manifestation lasts for 1d6 rounds, or when they go out of view of the caster or they're disrupted by some other means.

The manifestation is now fully corporeal and can Attack, be Attacked and can interact with physical objects.
tooltip: You let forth a figment of your imagination, manifesting it into the real world. Roll for Magic to determine what is manifested.

name: Substitute Reality
description: With a touch, you transform a target into something or someone else entirely. The GM decides the result, based on your past and general personality.
tooltip: With a touch, you transform a target into something or someone else entirely.

name: Control Phantasm
description: You attempt to take control of your phantasm's Actions for its remaining duration. If successful, you control all of your manifestation's Actions and make rolls for it.
tooltip: You take control of your phantasm's Actions for its remaining duration, making rolls for it if successful.

name: Manifest Phantasm
description:
The dam in your mind bursts, letting forth one of the many figments of your imagination and manifesting it into the real world.

You can manifest any of the following characters or creatures at will:

  • Abomination – Causes all friendly and hostile targets within short range to run in fear, and Attacks with Shadow Magic
  • Random Abstract Concept – Distracts friendly and hostile targets for one round the first time they come within short range of it, and Attacks with Psi Magic
  • Random Small Creature – Moves randomly within a short range radius, and makes unarmed Attacks
  • Construct – A random robot, ship or vehicles that moves randomly within a long range radius, and attacks with Tech
  • Random Large Creature – Moves randomly within a short range radius, intimidating hostile targets within short range, and makes unarmed Attacks
  • Random Character – Acts and reacts naturally to their surroundings, and makes Attacks with a random weapon or Magic
  • Doppleganger – A copy of a random character that mimics all movements of the original, including Attacks, but cannot speak
  • Divine Being – Avatar of a random diety that heals a small amount of Harm on all friendly targets within short range, and Attacks with a random Magic

The GM decides what is manifested, based on your past and general personality, and they control the manifestation while active. The manifestation lasts for 1d6 rounds, or when they go out of view of the caster or they're disrupted by some other means. The manifestation fully corporeal and can Attack, be Attacked and can interact with physical objects.

You can now decide which phantasm to manifest, but you must roll for Magic as normal to do so, with the standard success and failure rules in effect.
tooltip: You let forth a figment of your imagination, manifesting it into the real world.

name: Always There
description: You'll always be there to pick your friends up when they're down. If you are within short range of another character, you can use your Action to allow them to re-roll once for free.
tooltip: You use your Action to allow a character within short range to re-roll once for free.

name: Amateur Hobbyist
description: You're just someone who does it for fun. You're not in it for the fame or the money. You just want to be the best at what you do. Choose one Skill to be trained in that reflects your chosen hobby.

name: Fulfillment
description: Whenever you perform an Action directly related to your hobby that you're doing just for the pure enjoyment of it, gain 1 XP or heal a small amount of Harm on yourself. This Ability will not trigger if the Action would eventually reward you fame or money.
tooltip: When you perform an Action directly related to your hobby that you're doing just for fun, gain 1 XP or heal a small amount of Harm.

name: Experienced Hand
description: Add a die to your dice pool whenever you perform an Action related to your chosen hobby.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool whenever you perform an Action related to your chosen hobby.

name: Adrift
description: Without purpose, what is life?  You do not start the game with a Character Arc, nor can you acquire new ones through your journey. That means you do not get XP from Character Arcs. If you have any Abilities that grant additional XP for Character Arcs, you get double XP from Intrusions instead.
tooltip: You do not have Character Arcs, and so you do not get XP from Character Arcs.

name: Outside of Fate's Designs
description: You don't fit into fate's great tapestry. Because of this, you can refuse Intrusions without needing to pay XP. Usable even if you already acted this round.
tooltip: You can refuse Intrusions without needing to pay XP. Usable even if you already acted this round.

name: Time to Reflect
description: Whenever you Short or Long Rest, gain 1 XP.
tooltip: Whenever you Short or Long Rest, gain 1 XP.

name: Healthy Layer of Dirt
description: Your personal hygiene invokes visible disgust in those around you. Remove one die from your dice pool whenever you have a positive social interaction with other characters.
tooltip: Remove one die from your dice pool whenever you have a positive social interaction with other characters.

name: Personal Space
description: A cloud of dust and soot hangs around you, creating a shielf of sorts against Attacks. Melee attackers will often ignore you in favour of being near other targets, and ranged attackers will find it difficult to hit your weak spots. Has no effect Magic that affects the mind.
tooltip: Melee Attackers will often ignore you, and ranged Attackers will find it difficult to hit your weak spots.

name: Clearly Defined Goals
description: You start the game with two additional free Character Arcs, for a total of three Character Arcs at the beginning of the game.

name: Survive Hardships
description: You cannot receive Harm—physical, emotional, mental or magical—from mixed successes or Intrusions, though you can be affected in other ways.
tooltip: You cannot receive Harm—physical, emotional, mental or magical—from mixed successes or Intrusions, though you can be affected in other ways.

name: Zoinks!
description:
You live your entire life fearing the worst will happen. Maybe it's specific things that really frighten you, but it's enough that you're always on edge. You are unable to resist attempts to scare or intimidate you. If the negative consequence of a mixed success or failed roll is fear or intimidation, you cannot re-roll or refuse the Intrusion. The same applies if the GM incurs an Intrusion on you during a session.

If you have another ability that makes you immune to fear or intimidation, discuss with the GM how to best represent this conflict. Maybe you are only immune to certain kinds of fear, or maybe you treat fear and intimidation as normal, without immunity or the special effects of this Trait.
tooltip: You cannot re-roll mixed successes or Intrusions, or refuse Intrusions, if the negative consequence is fear or intimidation.

name: Fetal Position
description: You roll into a ball on the floor, covering your head with your arms. You are immune to fear while Guarding in this state, and take no Harm from emotional or Magical Attacks.
tooltip: You roll into a ball on the floor, becoming immune to fear and taking no Harm from emotional or Magical Attacks.

name: Help Me!
description: Add a die to your dice pool to try to convince a target within short range to Help you on your next Task. The target does not need to understand you, nor does it need to be friendly.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool to try to convince a target within short range to Help you on your next Task.

name: Frantic Assault
description: You close your eyes, hold your weapon or hands out and flail around, hoping to whatever diety that you hit something. Using whatever weapon or kind of Attack you want, you Attack all targets within range, including any friendly targets nearby.
tooltip: You Attack all targets within range of your chosen weapon or Attack type, including any friendly targets nearby.

name: Rummage
description: You know it's here somewhere. Whenever you want to use a stashed item or Artifact, you must first roll to rummage through your inventory to see if you succeed to retreive it.
tooltip: You attempt to retreive a stashed item from your inventory. You must perform this Feat to use stashed items.

name: Backhanded
description: You deliver an Attack or say something to a target who can understand you that is so underhanded and dirty that they become stunned for one round in addition to receiving damage, if applicable.
tooltip: You deliver an Attack or say something to a target who can understand you that stuns them for one round in addition to dealing damage.

name: Skill With Ranged Attacks
description:
Choose one type of weapon or Attack in which you are not already trained:

  • Automatic Weapons
  • Bows
  • Crossbows
  • Pistols
  • Polearms
  • Rifles
  • Shotguns
  • Throwing Weapons
  • Whips

You are trained in Attacks using that type of weapon or Attack.

name: Good Out Here
description: Add a die to your dice pool on any Task, including Attacks, as long as you are at least a short range away from whatever it is you're interacting with.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool on any Task, including Attacks, as long as you are at least a short range away.

name: Push Away
description: With an Attack, you force a target to move up one range step away from you. So a target in immediate range will move to short range, a target in short range will move to long range and a target in long range will move up to 200 feet (61 m) or up to fifteen hexes ⬢ or squares ■ away.
tooltip: With an Attack, you force a target to move up one range step away from you.

name: Stay Back!
description: Shouting as loud as you can, you intimidate a target for 1d6 rounds, so that all they can do is defend themselves against Attacks, but are otherwise rooted on the spot.
tooltip: Shouting as loud as you can, you intimidate a target for 1d6 rounds.

name: Further Than Ever Before
description: You may now treat all range steps as one step higher for all ranged Attacks and Abilities, including those made with strictly ranged weapons like bows and guns, as well as with Magic, if you have access to Magic. This means that you can now Attack and use Abilities that were previously limited at short range at long range instead, while Abilities and Attacks at long range can now be used up to 200 feet (61 m) or up to fifteen hexes ⬢ or squares ■ away. This does not apply to any Actions that require you to physical connect with a target.
tooltip: You may now treat all range steps as one step higher for all ranged Attacks and Abilities.

name: Found Wanting
description: Whenever you catch another character in a lie or performing some kind of deception, you gain 1 XP.
tooltip: Whenever you catch another character in a lie or performing some kind of deception, you gain 1 XP.

name: Narcoleptic
description: You are forever tired, weary, exhausted and drowsy. Remove a die from all Task rolls.
tooltip: You are forever tired, weary, exhausted and drowsy. Remove a die from all Task rolls.

name: Anytime, Anywhere
description: You're just so...tired. You can now perform a Short Rest whenever you wish, for as long as you wish. Every round you Short Rest heals you. This Ability replaces your normal Short Rest, and does not have a cooldown period like your normal Short Rest.
tooltip: You Short Rest whenever you wish, for as long as you wish, healing you each round you keep Resting.

name: Blackout
description: You collapse to the floor (or the equivalent thereof) and passout, stunned and prone, for one round, avoiding an Intrusion without paying XP. Usable even if you already acted this round. This does not count as a Short Rest.
tooltip: You collapse to the floor and passout, stunned and prone, for one round, avoiding an Intrusion without paying XP.

name: Waking Attack
description: You wake suddenly from your slumber, attacking a target within range using whatever weapon or Magic at your disposal—even your fists. Add three dice to your dice pool for the attack. Only usable if you are Resting when the round begins. This Ability is not exempt from the Narcoleptic modifier.
tooltip: You wake suddenly from your slumber, Attacking a target within range. Add three dice to your dice pool for the attack.

name: Narcoleptic
description:
You are forever tired, weary, exhausted and drowsy. Remove a die from all Task rolls.

You have gained a small amount of control of your condition. Whenever you Long Rest, you ignore the effect of this Ability for one hour after waking up. You can extend this time by Short Resting in 30 minute increments through the Anywhere, Anytime Feat, at a one-to-one ratio. So if you Short Rest for 30 minutes, you add 30 minutes of time to your Well Rested status. If you Short Rest for one hour, you add one hour to the time.
tooltip: You are forever tired, weary, exhausted and drowsy. Remove a die from all Task rolls, unless you are Well Rested.

name: Well Rested
tooltip: Do not remove a die from your dice pool for one hour after Long Resting. Extend the time by Short Resting in 30 minute intervals.

name: Necessary Action
description: If you won't, who will? Add two die to your dice pool when performing an Action that the majority of the group is unwilling to do, but is necessary to progress.
tooltip: Add two die to your dice pool when performing an Action that the majority of the group is unwilling to do, but is necessary to progress.

name: Take Aside
description: Add a die to your dice pool on all social interactions in which you need to tell someone who can understand you something uncomfortable.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool on all social interactions in which you need to tell someone who can understand you something uncomfortable.

name: Mercy Killing
description: If a target is near death, you automatically succeed at landing a killing blow to put it out of its misery. The GM will let you know if a target is near death.
tooltip: You automatically succeed at landing a killing blow to put it out of its misery, if a target is near death.

name: Guiding Principles
description:
You have access to or have knowledge of a set of guiding principles which are the basis of your world view. Select one of the following to contain those principles:

  • Datapad
  • Markings
  • Written Mandates

Make note of at least three of your guiding principles in your Notes.

name: <hide>
description: Make note of at least three of your guiding principles.

name: Markings
description: You have physical markings on your body, such as tattoos or scars, that represent your guiding principles, either in the form of literal text or as symbols that you can interpret.
tooltip: You have physical markings on your body that represent your guiding principles.

name: Written Mandates
description: You have a collection of written works related to your guiding principles, bound together for you to carry around with you.

name: Uphold Convictions
description: Add a die to your dice pool when performing an Action that directly supports your guiding principles.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when performing an Action that directly supports your guiding principles.

name: Rebuke
description: You strongly rebuke a target who can understand you, dazing them for one round.
tooltip: You strongly rebuke a target who can understand you, dazing them for one round.

name: Centre of Attention
description: The others, they just don't understand. Everyone needs to pay attention to you and you alone. If not actively trying to grab someone's attention, add a die to your dice pool on all Task rolls for every character that is paying attention to you, and remove a die from your dice pool for every character not paying direct attention to you.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool on all Task rolls for every character paying attention to you, and remove a die from your dice pool for every character not paying direct attention to you.

name: On Me
description: You distract a target for one round, but they remain fixated on you until something else significant grabs their attention.
tooltip: You distract a target for one round, but they remain fixated on you until something else significant grabs their attention.

name: Warming Up
description: One of the benifits of brewing your own supply is easy access to your favourite brews. You start the game with three small containers full of the alcohol of your choice, as well as access to a distillery to make more. Discuss the details of your distillery with the GM.
itemname: Small container of alcohol (of your choice)

name: <hide>
itemname: Small container of alcohol (of your choice)

name: <hide>
itemname: Small container of alcohol (of your choice)

name: <hide>
description: You have access to a small distillery for your own special brew. Make note of the details of this brewery here as well as what type of alcohol you brew.

name: Bob & Weave
description: Are you really fighting drunk? Maybe. Only you really know. The point is your opponent doesn't. You stumble and slip around, barely able to keep your balance as you deliver powerful strike after strike to your opponent. Add a die to your dice pool on any melee Attack. You do not feel the negative effects of a mixed success when using this Ability.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool on any melee Attack, ignoring the negative effects of a mixed success.

name: Microbrew
description: You've learned to ferment alcohol on the go now, and don't always need access to your distillery. As long as you have the necessary ingredients on hand and an empty container, you gain a small container of alcohol each time you Long Rest.
tooltip: As long as you have the necessary ingredients on hand and an empty container, you gain a small container of alcohol each time you Long Rest.

name: High Tolerance
description: If you so wish, you can ignore any negative effects from consuming alcohol. Additionally, add one die to your dice pool on any Task if you are tipsy or drunk.
tooltip: You can ignore any negative effects from consuming alcohol. Add a die to your dice pool on any Task if you are tipsy or drunk.

name: Dragon's Breath
description: You fill your mouth with some of your brew, bring a source of flame in front, and then spit, unleashing a cone of fire in front of you that hits all targets within short range. Requires a source of fire to function.
tooltip: You unleash a cone of fire breath fueled by alcohol in front of you that hits all targets within short range.

name: Liquid Courage
description: You pass a small container of alcohol to an ally in immediate range, adding a die to their pool for any physical or social task.
tooltip: You pass a small container of alcohol to an ally in immediate range, adding a die to their pool for any physical or social task.

name: Drab
description: You are so dull and boring that most just seem to forget you exist. You are never targeted for Attacks by hostile targets. The only time you can be Harmed in combat is through the negative effects of mixed successes, or from Intrusions.
tooltip: You are never targeted for Attacks by hostile targets.

name: In Plain Sight
description: You kind of just blend in with the background. Add a die to your dice pool to perform a stealth Task.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool to perform a stealth Task.

name: Without Hesitation
description: Add a die to your dice pool when performing a Task in service of your chosen person or institution.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when performing a Task in service of your chosen person or institution.

name: Until Death
description: You are fiercely loyal to a specific person or institution. Make note of who or what it is that you are loyal to.

name: Don't Even Like, Worry About It
description: Just let it go, man. Once between each Rest, you can refuse an Intrusion on an ally or yourself without needing to pay XP.
tooltip: You refuse an Intrusion on an ally or yourself without needing to pay XP.

name: Bubbly
description: Add a die to your dice pool for positive social interactions.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for positive social interactions.

name: Ego Boost
description: You just knew you were right. Whenever you get a critical success, you heal a small amount of Harm on yourself in addition to the bonus effect you get from getting a critical success.
tooltip: Whenever you get a critical success, heal a small amount of Harm on yourself in addition to the bonus effect you get.

name: Unsolicited Advice
description: If they'd just listen to you, they'd get it done. And if they still can't do it, well, that's not your fault, is it? When you Help another character with a Task, you do not share in any negative consequences if they fail with your assistance.
tooltip: You Help another character with a Task, ignoring any negative consequences if they fail with your assistance.

name: Endurance Skills
description:
You are trained in your choice of the following Skills:

  • Climbing
  • Healing
  • Running
  • Stealth
  • Survival

name: Endurance Skills
description:
You are trained in your choice of the following Skills:

  • Climbing
  • Healing
  • Running
  • Stealth
  • Survival

name: No Rest for the Wicked
description:
Even death can't stop you. If you die, your spirit remains, forcibly separated from your body but still able to take independant Actions. For 24 hours following the death of your body, you stay around as a spirit remnant, unable to interact with the physical world, but still being able to speak and use Magic, if you have access to Magic. You're also visible to everyone around you and you can go through solid materials with ease.

At anytime, you can attempt to re-attach your spirit to your body and ressurect yourself. If you are still in your spirit remnant form after 24 hours, it dissipates and you die for good.
tooltip: For 24 hours following the death of your body, you stay around as a spirit remnant.

name: Sticking Around
tooltip: Your spirit is forcibly separated from your body. Your are still able to take Actions, but you can't interact with the physical world.

name: Come Back
description: Through sheer force of will, your spirit remnant enters your body, re-animating it and bringing you back to life. You have a minimal amount of health when you awake.
tooltip: Your spirit remnant enters your body, re-animating it and bringing you back to life. You have a minimal amount of health when you awake.

name: Agility Skills
description:
You are trained in your choice of the following Skills:

  • Balance
  • Climbing
  • Escape
  • Jumping
  • Rolling
  • Running

name: Agility Skills
description:
You are trained in your choice of the following Skills:

  • Balance
  • Climbing
  • Escape
  • Jumping
  • Rolling
  • Running

name: Agility Skills
description:
You are trained in your choice of the following Skills:

  • Balance
  • Climbing
  • Escape
  • Jumping
  • Rolling
  • Running

name: One After Another
description: If you have throwing weapons at the ready, you can make four consecutive Attacks on the same target as a part of the same Action.
tooltip: You make four consecutive Attacks on the same target as a part of the same Action using throwing weapons.

name: Manual Override
description: If one of the systems of your vehicle is malfunctioning (propulsion, weapons, etc.), you can perform a manual override to get it working again. However, another one of your vehicle's systems will be damaged in the process.
tooltip: You get a malfunctioning system working again, but another one of your vehicle's systems is damaged in the process.

name: Silent Killer
description: Add a die to your dice pool to apply poison to a weapon, slip it into a drink or simply force it down someone's throat without being detected.
tooltip: You apply poison to a weapon, slip it into a drink or simply force it down someone's throat without being detected.

name: Stare Down
description: Add a die to your dice pool on all intimidation Tasks.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool on all intimidation Tasks.

name: Get 'er Done
description: Aw shucks, someone's gotta do it, and might as well be you. Remove a die from your dice pool on any Task roll. If you get anything above a mixed success on the roll, gain 1 XP or heal a small amount of Harm—your choice.
tooltip: Remove a die from your dice pool on any Task roll. If you get anything above a mixed success, gain 1 XP or heal a small amount of Harm.

name: This Is It
description: You've worked hard and long for this. All your dreams are about to come true. You have a business idea or a self-starter company that you own. Make a note of what you business is, as well as what you're selling. You also start the game with two additional inexpensive items that represent the products or services you're selling to the world.

name: Fellow Entrepeneur
description:
You can't go at it alone. You have someone who works with you, either as an equal partner, or just someone giving you a little help from the sidelines when you need it. You start the game with a contact of your choice, trained in one skill of your choosing.

This contact can be a companion, but does not have to be; if you choose for them to accompany you everywhere, they will not participate in combat, opting to hide for cover whenever combat starts. You can also alternate between having them join you on your adventures or leaving them somewhere safe.
itemeffect: An equal partner, or just someone giving you a little help from the sidelines. Can join you on your adventures as a companion, but will not engage in combat.

name: It Should Be Mine
description: Whenever another character has a physical object you want, you can add a die to your dice pool to take it from them by force.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool to take a physical object you want from another character by force.

name: Spite
description: If you can't have it, then no one can! Whenever another character has a something you want that they can't readily give over to you, you can add a die to your dice pool to cause them Harm in whichever way you choose. For example, if the character you're targeting is ridiculously happy, or can speak another language, or has achieved success from their hard work, they would be unable to give you what you want if you wanted the same for yourself.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool to cause a character Harm if they are unable to readily give you what you want.

name: A Nasty Colour
description: Whenever you get a mixed success while trying to get something from someone else, you fail and get an Intrusion instead as you become overcome by frustration and a sense of injustice.
tooltip: Whenever you get a mixed success while trying to get something from someone else, you fail and get an Intrusion instead.

name: Indecisive Action
description:
Name the Action you want to take in the next round. You can then ask the GM whether the Action you're about to do is ethical or not given all of the consequences of said Action. Once the GM answers you, roll for Logic. One of the following will happen when using this Feat:

  • If you succeed on your roll, and the Action is deemed ethical, you automatically get a critical success in the next round for the Action you named previously.
  • If you succeed on your roll, but the Action is deemed unethical, you can choose to retract your intent to perform the Action you named previously, but become stunned in the next round.
  • If you fail on your roll, you do not get an Intrusion, but you must choose to perform the Action you named previously, but become stunned in the next round.
tooltip: Name the Action you want to take in the next round. You can then ask the GM whether the Action you're about to do is ethical or not.

name: Oh Boy!
description: Whenever you encounter something new or particularily stimulating, you become Stimulated, adding one die to your dice pool on your next Task, or until your next Long Rest, whichever comes first.
tooltip: Whenever you encounter something new or particularily stimulating, you become Stimulated.

name: Stimulated
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool on the next Task you take on. You have until your next Long Rest to use this bonus.

name: Position of Authority
description: You work in a position of some authority, granting you the ability to weigh on important decisions. Examples include judge, doctor, law enforcement, politician, teacher, and so on. Most people are able to recognize your authority on the subjects you're specialized within a few minutes of speaking to you, if not immediately.
tooltip: Most people are able to recognize your authority within a few minutes of speaking to you, if not immediately.

name: Appeal to Authority
description: Whenever another character asks for your assistance with a knowledge or social Task, add a die your dice pool on your Help roll. This is in addition to any dice you add to your dice pool if you're trained in a related Skill.
tooltip: Add an additional die your dice pool when Helping another character with a knowledge or social Task.

name: Bodyguard
description: Your line of work now necessitates some extra protection. You have a bodyguard companion trained in a combat Skill of your choice that follows you around, but acts independently of you. They are primarily there to protect you from danger, and so will assist you in combat by Attacking targets hostile to you or taking attacks meant for you. Outside of combat, they remain silent and standing still, and will only take Actions in order to protect you from physical harm. If you lose your bodyguard, you can regain a new one within 1d6+3 days.

name: Eternality
description: Immortality. In principle, an attractive process. Thanks to experimental treatments using Magic and technology before the collapse of your civilization, you have survived for over forty five thousand years as your body, emaciated by these same experiments, exists in perpetual stasis, ageless and undying. You are far ahead of any other individuals from modern civilizations. You begin the game at Tier 3 instead of Tier 1.
tooltip: With over forty five thousand years of experience, you are far ahead of any other individuals from modern civilizations. Begin the game at Tier 3.

name: Ewoche
description:
At their height, Ewoche population numbered in the trillions. Scattered across multiple worlds across the quadrant, they lead one of the largest empires in the history of the galaxy. This all changed when their civilization was targeted by the Vassu and their civilization was wiped out. A few hundred still live today, kept alive by an experimental life-extension procedure made possible through technology and Magic. Those few Ewoche that remain have ever-lasting life and are ageless, though the process also emaciated them and made them infertile.

Modern Ewoche live in small communes or roam the galaxy alone, secluded from other civilized species, remaining hidden thanks to advanced technology and Magic. The Ewoche were once paragons of progress, both in the realms of Magic and technology. Their affinity to crystals allowed them to innovate beyond anything the galaxy had seen before or since. However, due to their long lives, almost all living Ewoche are cynical, withdrawn and bitter. They spend most of their time on selfish pursuits or finding ways to drestroy the Vassu threat.

name: Megor
description:
The Megor are native to Mega, which was destroyed with the rest of the Zran system thanks to the Megor. They shared their planet with the Zao, whom they had almost universally enslaved. Various Megor clans are now scattered around the star cluster, though the majority call Ulta their home. The Megor are creatures out of their element, not yet evolved enough to handle star-faring society, but ferocious and tenacious enough to try. They are a passionate people, ruled by emotions more than logic, and driven by ego and a sense of pride.

Other civilized species do not normally respond well to the presence of Megor, and will either attack them or flee at the sight of them, due to their abrasive nature and their history of violence.

name: Barbaric
description: The reputation of the Megor precedes them. They are seen as violent, viscious brutes by most people. Whenever you get a mixed success during social interactions with aliens, you fail the roll instead and get an Intrusion.
tooltip: Whenever you get a mixed success during social interactions with aliens, you fail the roll instead and get an Intrusion.

name: Bloodlust
description: As part of Intrusions in combat, the GM may force you into a state of bloodlust. While Seeing Red, you can't use non-physical Abilities, but you add a die to your dice pool on all physical Tasks. This effects last as long as there are targets within range, or until you spend an Action to calm yourself.
tooltip: As part of Intrusions in combat, you may enter into a state of bloodlust, activating Seeing Red.

name: Seeing Red
tooltip: You can't use non-physical Abilities, but you add a die to your dice pool on all physical Tasks.

name: War Cry
description: You let loose a terrifying war cry, either stricking fear into all hostile targets in short range, or adding a die to the dice pool of all friendly targets within short range for one combat-related roll.
tooltip: You let loose a terrifying war cry, either stricking fear into all hostile targets in short range, or adding a die to the dice pool of all friendly targets within short range for one combat-related roll.

name: Feats of Yore
description:
Whenever you wish, you can name a Feat you've seen or done before, either used by another character or from your travels before the start of the campaign. If you name the Feat and its effects properly, you can use that Feat, though you must remove a die from your dice pool for any associated rolls in addition to any modifier that Feat normally provides. If the Feat does not required a roll, roll 1d2 to decide whether you succeed or not in using it.

This Ability can be used to copy the Abilities of other Descriptors, Species, Types or Foci which you did not select for your character. You need to know the name of the Ability as well as its effects, either from your current session or from previous sessions. If an Ability requires access to Magic or technology which you don't have access to, you cannot use the Ability. However, you can also use this Ability to create entirely new Abilities. Discuss with the GM if there's something specific you want to do to ensure the Ability fits within the context of the story being told before using it in an encounter.
tooltip: You perform a Feat you've experienced before, removing a die from your dice pool in addition to any of the Feat's modifiers, or rolling 1d2 if a roll is not required.

name: Uisi
description: The Uisi are native to Qule'jia, but those that are left make their home on the Nizubin'jia fleet. The fleet is separated into four immense generation ships, each with its own distinct sub-culture and sharing a home with other civilized alien refugees. The Uisi fleet has travelled for hundreds of years through the galaxy, visiting worlds and people unheard of. In recent times, the Uisi have begun to avoid contact with alien species as the Vassu threat they are running from draws near. Individual Uisi are driven by their need for self-fulfillment, which is achieved through a balanced outlook on life that is neither too self-serving, nor too selfless.

name: Recentre Self
description: Balance is the key. Whenever you get an Intrusion related to a strong emotion—such as anger, fear or sadness—you may refuse the Intrusion without needing to pay XP, though you still fail the roll. Usable once between each Rest.
tooltip: You refuse an Intrusion related to a strong emotion, though you still fail the roll.

name: Zao
description: The Zao are native to Mega, which was destroyed with the rest of the Zran system thanks to the Megor. The Zao shared their planet with the Megor, to whom they were almost universally enslaved. Nearly half of all surviving Zao are still enslaved by the Megor. The rest are free, independent people organized into various cartels, which make their home on space stations made from old starships. Zao—whether slave or separatist—are motivated by survival and personal success. Generations of hardships have changed the naturally ingenious and intelligent people, so that it's not enough for them just to survive—they must thrive and flourish in this new era.

name: Lamarckism
description: Generations of enslavement has left your people hardy, but physical weak. Remove a die from your dice pool on any Task that requires physical strength, such as lifting, breaking things or pushing heavy objects.
tooltip: Remove a die from your dice pool on any Task that requires physical strength, such as lifting, breaking things or pushing heavy objects.

name: Beta Testing
description: You figure out how a device works and how to operate it within only a few seconds of manipulating it. Add a die to your dice pool for the Task.
tooltip: You figure out how a device works and how to operate it within only a few seconds of manipulating it.

name: Prowess
description: Add a die to your dice pool for any Task that you're trained in.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for any Task that you're trained in.

name: Calming Presence
description: You attempt to remove a harmful mental effect in a target you can touch, such as fear, intimidation or confusion.
tooltip: You attempt to remove a harmful mental effect in a target you can touch, such as fear, intimidation or confusion.

name: Take Down
description: Add a die to your dice pool for any Task in which you're bringing someone or something down to be on a level equal to everyone else.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for any Task in which you're bringing someone or something down to be on a level equal to everyone else.

name: Lift Up
description: Add a die to your dice pool, even if you're not trained in the Skill required for the Task, as long as you are Helping someone get up on the same level as everyone else.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool, even if you're not trained in the Task, when Helping someone get on the same level as everyone else.

name: Systemic Consequences
description: Whenever you get a mixed success on a Task in which you would significantly disadvantage someone, or would cause someone to have significant advantage over others, you fail the roll instead and get an Intrusion.
tooltip: When you get a mixed success that would change the power balance of an individual, you fail the roll instead and get an Intrusion.

name: One for All
description: Whenever you gain XP from Intrusions, you can give 1 XP to all friendly player characters within the area around you, as long as you can explain how they helped you learn from your mistakes.
tooltip: Whenever you gain XP from Intrusions, you can give 1 XP to all friendly player characters within the area around you.

name: Unbiased
description: Add two dice to your dice pool for any social interaction with characters who would normally face prejudice based on their species or cultural background.
tooltip: Add two dice to your dice pool for any social interaction with characters who would normally be discriminated against.

name: Step into the Æther
description:
Through her connection with Ay'driel, the being known as Ethamil allows Keepers to enter the Æther, which she holds dominion over. The Æther is a plane of existence tightly interwoven with reality, as it is the source of life and dreams. Each point in the Æther has a corresponding point in reality, and vice versa. Each planet has its own Æther realm, though its strength changes in relation to the amount of life there. As a Keeper, you are able to enter the Æther whenever you wish, though you have a particular affinity for it and even have some influence within.

Those that enter the Æther do so in spirit only, leaving their physical bodies behind, and you are no different. To enter the Æther, you must enter a deep slumber, at which point your physical body goes to sleep. While in the Æther, you can interact with the processes that oversee life and the dreams of sentient people for the planet you're currently on. You can use Magic and take normal Actions as a spirit, but your Actions don't necessarily affect the physical world. If your body is injured or killed while you are asleep, you become stuck in the Æther. Because you are awake in spirit, this does not count as a Rest. Action to sleep and enter the Æther; Action to wake up and leave.
tooltip: You enter a deep slumber as your spirit enters the Æther. You can use Magic and take normal Actions.

name: Flourish
description: While in the Æther, you cause a tremendous amount of plant growth at a point you choose at short range, extending up to an immediate range. Or you cause a natural creature to grow up to twice its normal size or up to your approximate size, whichever is larger. You can use this Feat outside of the Æther, though the effect will not be as drastic.
tooltip: While in the Æther, you cause a tremendous amount of plant growth at a point you choose at short range. Or you cause a natural creature to grow up to twice its normal size or up to your approximate size.

name: Induce Slumber
description: With a touch, you guide a target into the Æther. The target's body falls asleep while their spirit enters the Æther. Like you, they can use Magic and take normal Actions, but their Actions don't affect the physical world. They must get your help in exiting the Æther, or succeed on a roll to leave on their own. Since their spirit is awake, this does not count as a Rest.
tooltip: With a touch, you guide a target's spirit into the Æther as their body falls asleep. They can use Magic and take normal Actions.

name: Summon Æther Creature
description: You slip momentarily into the Æther in order to bring forth one of the many creatures there into the physical world. You choose the form the creature takes; it can be an animal or other creature up to your size and lasts for 1d4+4 rounds. While present, the creature acts as you direct, but this requires no Action on your part. It uses Primal Magic to Attack enemies, cannot speak and cannot be Attacked physically. Once its job is done, it slips back into the Æther.
tooltip: You bring forth a creature from the Æther in the form your choose for 1d4+4 rounds that acts as you direct.

name: Architecture of Reality
description: You peer into the underlying contruction of the Æther, receiving Insight into the fabric of reality. You may ask the GM one question in relation to something you experience within the Æther, and they must answer truthfully. Only usable once between Rests.
tooltip: You ask the GM one question in relation to something you experience within the Æther, and they must answer truthfully.

name: Create Life
description: Your understanding of the Æther has grown far beyond what anyone could have imagined. While in the Æther, you fashion a new lifeform using the elements you choose, and then bring that very same lifeform into existence in the physical world. Creating the lifeform takes at least a week, and bringing it into reality takes two rounds; one round to move the lifeform from the Æther to the physical world and another to stabilize it in the physical world.
tooltip: You fashion a new lifeform in the Æther over the course of a week, and then bring it into existence in the physical world.

name: Yeah, Okay!
description: If a character asks you to do something for them, add a die to your dice pool on a related Task. Does not apply to Help rolls.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool on a related Task if a character asks you to do something for them. Does not apply to Help rolls.

name: Family Curse
description:
You didn't want to believe it at first. Just ramblings of an old coot, the imaginations of an older generation looking for a scapegoat for their life problems. But now you know better. Time has not been kind to you or your family, and you know for a fact that your family is cursed. Select the nature of your curse below:

  • Death – you are doomed to lose everyone you care for
  • Flesh – your body will be consumed by a creeping infection
  • Misfortune – things never seem to go your way
  • Shadow – a mysterious entity follows you wherever you go

You have made it your life goal to find the source of the curse on your family and break it, freeing yourself, your family and all those that would come after you.

name: Curse of Misfortune
description:
Luck may not be a universal concept but, at least for you, bad luck certainly is. One of your ancestors made the mistake of cheating someone at a game of chance, and so their family and themselves were cursed for all eternity, or so the story goes.

Whenever you succeed or critically succeed on a roll, roll again and take the worst result.
tooltip: Whenever you succeed or critically succeed on a roll, roll again and take the worst result.

name: Curse of Shadow
description:
A silhouette in the night. A figure, perched over the bed. An omen, shrouded in darkness over the horizon. A specter haunts your family, choosing one person each generation to follow around. Unfortunately for you, it has now chosen you. No one quite knows what the specter is what it wants; all your family knows is the specter causes nightmares if nearby, or can kill you through fear alone. So, you must always be on the move in hopes of escaping your shadow.

You must always be on the move. As long as the specter is within short range of you, you cannot Rest and the GM may inflict fear-based Intrusions on you whenever they feel fit. You can refuse these Intrusions, but they will increase in frequency the longer you remain in proximity of the specter. Generally speaking, you only need to move a few miles to get a day's respite away from the specter.
tooltip: A shadowy specter haunts you so you cannot Rest and allowing the GM may inflict fear-based Intrusions on you whenever they feel fit.

name: Curse of Death
description:
You are doomed to die, as all are. But more to the point, you are doomed to die alone. Your loved ones are destined to either die in your arms, or to leave you, never to be seen again. All you know of the curse is a saying, passed down through generations: Nether hath no fury like a lover scorned.

As long as other characters stay within short range of you, their Intrusions tend to be more harmful, gruesome and deadly. Additionally, your Intrusions tend to cause Harm to other characters or put distance between yourself and other characters.
tooltip: Characters within short range of you have more harmful, gruesome and deadly Intrusions, and your Intrusions tend to cause Harm to others.

name: Curse of Flesh
description:
It starts as a odd, innocent-looking birthmark. But as you age, it begins to creep along your skin, very soon covering a significant portion of your body. Neither science nor Magic can hope to explain it, much less cure the condition. All you know is that as the infection grows, you will lose more and more control over your own body until it covers your entire body, and you cease to exist. In fact, most of your family doesn't live past middle-age.

You have a creeping skin condition in the form of scaling, excessive scarring or burns, crystalization, flesh turning to stone or wood, or something similar, your choice. At the beginning of the game, you start with at least one small, non-critical part of your body covered in the infection, making it difficult to do certain things. As time goes on, the infection spreads exponentially faster across your body, aggravated by intense stress. Remove a die from your dice pool for any Tasks related to a part of your body affected by the infection.
tooltip: You have a skin condition. A small, non-critical part of your body is affected, removing a die from your dice pool for associated Tasks.

name: Turn the Tables
description: After so much time living with your family's curse, you've come to know its many quirks, as well as some ways to use it to your advantage. Add a die to your dice pool to use an aspect of your curse to your advantage, negating any other modifiers the curse may impose on you. You can use this Feat to refuse an Intrusion caused by the curse or as a normal Action, but you can only use it once between each Rest.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool to use an aspect of your curse to your advantage, negating any other modifiers the curse may impose on you.

name: Final Piece of the Puzzle
description: If you haven't solved and broken the curse yet, you get a significant piece of evidence that puts you onto the path to doing so. Discuss the details of the final clue with the GM. You cannot ascend to Tier 6 until the curse is broken.

name: Lady Luck's Favour
description: Whenever you get a mixed success or fail a roll, roll again and choose the better result.
tooltip: Whenever you get a mixed success or fail a roll, roll again and choose the better result.

name: Spectral Ally
description: The shadow that once haunted you is now your companion. It acts independently of you, but will attack hostile targets, causing them to run in fear. The spectre cannot be Attacked, and is not visible unless it is Attacking a target.
