itemeffect: The shadow that once followed you is now your companion. Acts independently of you, causing hostile targets to run in fear.

name: Font of Life
description: While allied characters are within short range of you, they cannot die. Any damage that would cause them to go over 8 Harm is nullified.
tooltip: While allied characters are within short range of you, they cannot die. Any damage that would cause them to go over 8 Harm is nullified.

name: Natural Advantage
description: You now have control over any parts of your body that have the skin condition. Add three dice to your dice pool for any physical Task made using those body parts.
tooltip: Add three dice to your dice pool for any physical Task made using your body parts affected by your skin condition.

name: Curse: Broken
description:
After so long, you've finally done it. The curse that has held your family hostage for generations has been broken. What's more, the scales have tipped greatly in the other direction. As the curse breaker, you now have access to an additional Ability. Select one of the following based on the curse you were afflicted with:

  • Death – Font of Life
  • Flesh – Natural Advantage
  • Misfortune – Lady Luck's Favour
  • Shadow – Spectral Ally

name: Legendary Awakening
description:
You count yourself as lucky. You know what you purpose in life is. You have a direction—a goal to strive for, something to look forward to, and dread all the same. Your destiny written for you; all you need to do is fulfill it. Select one of the following as the source of your destiny:

  • Ancient Prophecy
  • Family Legend
  • Scientific Prediction

Through your destiny, you are not necessarily a Chosen One. You may just be instrumental in ensuring the future comes to be, or does not come to be. Even still, you may have such a small role to be insignificant. Discuss the details of your destiny with the GM after selecting an option above. The GM may not provide specific details on your destiny, choosing to only give you vague hints.

name: Ancient Prophecy
description:
In your research of ancient lore or religious texts, you've stumbled onto something incredible: a text that describes not only events past, but the future as well. The accuracy of the predictions are so awe-inspiring that you can't help but believe that the future described therein will come to pass. With this knowledge in hand, you vow to do your part in ensuring that the future detailed within comes to pass.

Discuss the prophecy with the GM. The prophecy can describe either bright or dark future. However, it must also describe the opposite in case of failure. The prophecy may be vague and ambiguous, depending on what the GM decides. You are also trained in research.
tooltip: You carry with you an ancient prophecy for the future. You do what you can to ensure this future comes to pass.

name: Family Legend
description:
This burden has been passed down, generation by generation in your family. And now, this task is now your responsibility. The details of your destiny have been eroded over countless years, but one thing remains certain: if you fail, it could mean the end of all things.

Discuss the details of your family's legend with the GM. It could be forbidden knowledge, or the protection of a specific set of ruins, or even ensuring that a specific bloodline survives. Regardless, the legend may be vague and ambiguous, depending on what the GM decides. You also have a contact with in-depth knowledge of your family's history.
tooltip: You are burdened with responsibilities stemming from your family's history. You do what you can to fulfill those responsibilities.

name: <hide>
itemeffect: Has in-depth knowledge of your family's history and of the legend tied to them. Could be a relative, but does not have to be.

name: Scientific Prediction
description:
No, no, no! This isn't good, at this rate...unless. You've conducted the experiments, tested the theories, planned the models and tried all the variables. There's no doubt about it. Unless you do something, something really bad is going to happen. But there's a chance. A small one, but if you do everything correctly, you could pull it off. Through scientific research, you've found out a catastrophic event will occur soon unless specific steps are taken to stop it. You are the only person that you know that has figured this out, so it's up to you to change the future for the better.

Discuss the details of your predictions with the GM. It could be something that affects a small group of people, or even an entire world. Your predictions may be vague and ambiguous, depending on what the GM decides. You are also trained in a scientific Skill related to your predictions.
tooltip: You have predictive a catastrophe in the near future. You do what you can to prevent it from happening.

name: Maximum Effort
description: You must succeed—the future depends on it. Through sheer force of will, you automatically succeed on a Task of your choice. Usable once between each Rest.
tooltip: Through sheer force of will, you automatically succeed on a Task of your choice. Usable once between each Rest.

name: Question Fate
description: Whether you have fulfilled your destiny or not, you can't help but doubt that everything you've worked for has been a lie. Could it be that you misinterpreted the signs? Or should you be actively working against fate? These are the questions you want answered. You may ask the GM one question regarding your destiny and they must answer truthfully. Usable once between each Rest.
tooltip: You may ask the GM one question regarding your destiny and they must answer truthfully. Usable once between each Rest.

name: Revving Up
description: If you spend your Action doing nothing but standing restlessly in anticipation of the next Action you're going to take, add a die to your dice pool for the next Task taken in the next round. You must spend your Stored Energy, or you take a small amount of Harm.
tooltip: You do nothing but stand around restlessly, activating Stored Energy. You must spend your Stored Energy or you take a small amount of Harm.

name: Stored Energy
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool on your next Task. If you do not use this Ability, take a small amount of Harm.

name: Do Better
description: You know you can do better. Add a die to your dice pool for any physical or combat Task.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for any physical or combat Task.

name: Refined Taste
description: You have a very specific taste in what you'll allow to be in your possession. Whenever you receive an item, roll 1d2. If you fail the roll, you throw the item away in disgust as it does not fit your tastes.
tooltip: Whenever you receive an item, roll 1d2. If you fail the roll, you throw the item away in disgust as it does not fit your tastes.

name: No, Not Like That
description: As long as you keep pointing out ways in which a target who can understand you is not doing something correctly, they remain distracted and focused on you as they attempt to either correct the mistakes you're pointing out or they argue with you that, no, they are doing it right and you're bonkers.
tooltip: You distract a target who can understand you, keeping them occupied for as long as you keep pointing out things to them.

name: Clear the Room
description: You let forth a nasty fart, causing all targets within immediate range to retreat up to short range.
tooltip: You let forth a nasty fart, causing all targets within immediate range to retreat up to short range.

name: Targeted Strike
description: Taking wind speed and direction into consideration, you aim your rear end at a target and let loose a targeted gas attack, stunning them for 1d4 rounds.
tooltip: You aim your rear end at a target and let loose a targeted gas attack, stunning them for 1d4 rounds.

name: They Who Smelt It
description: Add a die to your dice pool when trying to pin the blame on someone who can understand you.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when trying to pin the blame on someone who can understand you.

name: Stinky
description: While not strictly your fault, it's true all the same—a lingering scent of flatulence hangs around you, acting as a barrier to any meaningful interactions. Remove a die from your dice pool on all social interactions.
tooltip: Remove a die from your dice pool on all social interactions.

name: Glasses
description: You stsrt the game with a stylish pair of glasses. While wearing the glasses, add a die to your dice pool on all perception Tasks and during positive social interactions, because you just don't look the same without them. If you lose your glasses, you can always purchase new ones.

name: I Can't See Without My Glasses!
description: Whenever you are wearing glasses, add a die to your dice pool on all perception Tasks and during positive social interactions, because you don't look right without them.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool on all perception Tasks and during positive social interactions as long as you are wearing glasses.

name: Looker Than You Smart
description: You might not be automatically more intelligent for wearing glasses, but that doesn't mean people don't think you are. Add a die to your dice pool if you are trying to bluff someone into thinking you are more knowledgeable in something than you are. You can also use this Feat to supplement an existing knowledge Skill.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool if you are trying to bluff someone into thinking you are more knowledgeable in something than you are.

name: Be Heard
description: Add two dice to your dice pool for any social interaction in which you want your opinion to be heard.
tooltip: Add two dice to your dice pool for any social interaction in which you want your opinion to be heard.

name: Forgive
description: If a character or creature that can understand you has harmed you in some way, you can forgive them. If they accept your forgiveness, you heal a small amount of Harm on yourself. The person you are forgiving must be forgiven first-hand for this Ability to trigger.
tooltip: You forgive a character or creature that previously harmed you in some way, healing a small amount of Harm on yourself in the process.

name: Never Forget
description: If a character or creature has harmed you in the past, you gain a piece of Insight on them without needing to pay any XP. You can only gain one piece of Insight per target using this Ability, unless they hurt you again after using it.
tooltip: If a character or creature has harmed you in the past, you gain a piece of Insight on them without paying any XP.

name: You Are Not Prepared
description: If you spend at least one round out of combat talking over a specific Task another character wants to accomplish, they can add a die to their dice pool the next time they tackle that Task, no matter when they tackle it and even if you're not trained in that Task. Only works for one kind of Task at a time, so if you use this Ability again for a different Task, the target character no longer adds a die to their dice pool for the previous Task.
tooltip: You spend at least one round out of combat talking over a Task with another character so that they add a die to their dice pool the next time they tackle that Task.

name: Reject Authority
description: Because you don't ascribe yourself to any of the major belief systems or consider yourself a part of any governing bodies, you don't really respect any authority figures. Add two dice to your dice pool on any Task which flies in the face of what an authority figure wants you to do. This could be escaping a jail cell, protesting the demolition of a historical site or just spitting in their face.
tooltip: Add two dice to your dice pool on any Task which flies in the face of what an authority figure wants you to do.

name: Social Aptitude
description: You're something of a social expert. You're trained in social entertainment, such as dancing, karaoke, a team sport, wine tasting, playing tabletop games, and so on.

name: Social Aptitude
description: You're something of a social expert. You're trained in social entertainment, such as dancing, karaoke, a team sport, wine tasting, playing tabletop games, and so on.

name: Do Unto Others
description: If you Help another character with a Task and they succeed in that Task, you gain Mudita, automatically succeeding on the next Task you take on. If they critically succeed, you also gain 1 XP.
tooltip: You Help another character with a Task. If they succeed, you gain Mudita. If they critically succeed, you also gain 1 XP.

name: Mudita
tooltip: Cultivating your joy and happiness in seeing someone you Helped succeed, you automatically succeed on a Task.

name: Glamour
description: You use Psi Magic to amplify your beauty and mystique in the eyes of a target withing Short range, making them do what you want. You issue a simple command to a single living being. The target must be within short range and able to hear and understand you. The command can't inflict direct harm on the target or its allies, so “Commit suicide” won't work, but “Flee” might. In addition, the command can require the target to take only one Action, so “Unlock the door” might work, but “Unlock the door and run through it” won't.
tooltip: You issue a simple command to a single living being within short range that can hear you.

name: Downcast Climate
description: So strong is your gloom that it hangs around you, palpable to everyone around you. They can just feel the dismay radiating off of you, strong enough to infect people near you. Yourself and all targets within immediate range, hostile and friendly, remove one die from their dice pool on all Task rolls.
tooltip: Yourself and all targets within immediate range, hostile and friendly, remove one die from their dice pool on all Task rolls.

name: Sorry, Sorry, Sorry
description: With a sincere apology to any affected parties, you forgo an Action you were going to take after seeing the results of the dice roll, but before the Action plays out. Usable even if you've already acted this round. This means if you fail a roll or get a mixed success, you can decide to not take the Action that resulted in roll and avoid any negative consequences.
tooltip: You forgo an Action you were going to take after rolling, but before the Action plays out. Usable even if you've already acted this round.

name: Travel Skill
description:
You are skilled at navigating and finding your way. Select one of the following Skills:

  • Land Vehicle Piloting
  • Pathfinding
  • Riding
  • Starship Piloting
  • Urban Navigation

name: Chart Map
description: You've become so good at charting your own path that you're now able to generate physical maps to share or sell to others. If you've spent at least a week in an area, add a die to your dice pool for your efforts in charting an accurate a map of the area you travelled. Can be used to chart previously uncharted star systems, planetoids, wilderness, cities, or just provide a more detailed map of an existing area. For example, a city's map may not include secret passageways below the city, whereas your map will.
tooltip: After spending at least a week in an area, add a die to your dice pool to chart an accurate a map of the area you travelled.

name: Hot Goss
description: You gotta get in to that action. During any social interaction, add a die to your dice pool to gain Insight about a specific person or group of people without needing to pay XP.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool in order to gain Insight about a specific person or group of people during a social interaction.

name: Busybody
description: What's the point in knowing all this stuff about people if you can't tell anyone? You gain a contact that you can safely divulge the secrets you've learned about people, knowing that they will, to the best of their ability, spread that information to everyone they know. They can also provide you with Insight in exchange for any Insight you provide them.
itemeffect: Contact who will spread that information you provide them to everyone they know. They can also provide you with Insight in exchange for any Insight you provide them.

name: Tête-à-tête
description: With your extension library of personal secrets, you're able to bring out the gossip in just about anyone. As long as you have a relevant piece of Insight, you can gain another piece of Insight regarding a person or group of people during a social interaction without needing to pay XP.
tooltip: Using a relevant piece of Insight, you gain another piece of Insight regarding a person or group of people during a social interaction.

name: Busybodies
description: What's the point in knowing all this stuff about people if you can't tell anyone? You gain three contacts that you can safely divulge the secrets you've learned about people, knowing that they will, to the best of their ability, spread that information to everyone they know. They can also provide you with Insight in exchange for any Insight you provide them.
itemeffect: Contact who will spread that information you provide them to everyone they know. They can also provide you with Insight in exchange for any Insight you provide them.

name: <hide>
itemeffect: Contact who will spread that information you provide them to everyone they know. They can also provide you with Insight in exchange for any Insight you provide them.

name: <hide>
itemeffect: Contact who will spread that information you provide them to everyone they know. They can also provide you with Insight in exchange for any Insight you provide them.

name: Spread Rumour
description: People are so predictable. All you need is a to know a little information about them, and you can tell exactly what they'll do—whether they've realized it themselves yet or not. Whenever you wish, you can create a piece of Insight regarding a person or a group of people for which you have at least three pieces of related Insight in your possession. This Insight cannot be wildly out of character for the person or group, but may be shocking or surprising based on your own assumptions of the target person or group. Discuss with the GM whether the Insight makes sense within the context of the narrative, though you decide the implications of the Insight. Using this Feat costs 2 XP as normal.
tooltip: You create an in-character piece of Insight regarding a person or a group of people for which you have at least three pieces of Insight.

name: Thank You
description: People give and give, and you just can't express enough how much it means to you when they do. You attempt to express your gratitude to a target who can understand you after they do something for you. If successful, you gain 1 XP.
tooltip: You express your gratitude to a target who can understand you after they do something for you. If successful, you gain 1 XP.

name: Gratitude
description: Sometimes you just need to sit down and really appreciate what you have, and what you've been given. Everytime you Rest, heal an additionnal small amount of Harm on yourself while you contemplate all you have and express gratitude for it.
tooltip: Everytime you Rest, heal an additionnal small amount of Harm on yourself while you contemplate all you have and express gratitude for it.

name: Personal Torment
description: Something is bothering you. It's always on your mind, nagging at the back of your thoughts. You dread telling others about it; it's your burden to hold, and no one else's. Whenever you get a mixed success on a mental Task, you fail instead and get an Intrusion related to whatever occupies your mind.
tooltip: Whenever you get a mixed success on a mental Task, you fail instead and get an Intrusion related to whatever occupies your mind.

name: Impeccable Logic
description: Rationaility. Sensibility. These are what you value. You automatically succeed on a Logic roll. Usable once between each Rest.
tooltip: You automatically succeed on a Logic roll. Usable once between each Rest.

name: Double Time
description: You can complete Tasks in half the amount of time by working twice as hard. You'll most likely use this Ability for crafting Tasks, but it can be used for everything except travel by vehicle and Resting. You can also use this Ability to empower a Feat that requires multiple rounds of preparation. You need a minimum of one round to complete such a task, and you can't combine other Tasks within the same round.
tooltip: You complete a Task or Feat in half the amount of time. Minimum of one round, and you can't combine other Tasks within the same round.

name: Again!
description: You re-roll one of your rolls without paying XP. Usable once between each Rest, and usable even if you already acted this round.
tooltip: You re-roll one of your rolls without paying XP. Usable once between each Rest, and usable even if you already acted this round.

name: Its Own Reward
description: They say that you learn more from failure than success; you don't agree. You believe hard work and dedication can benefit you just as much, if not more. Whenever you critically succeed on Task, you gain 2 XP; you keep 1 XP, and immediately give 1 XP to another player and justify the gift, as if you got an Intrusion.
tooltip: Whenever you critically succeed on Task, you gain 2 XP; you keep 1 XP, and immediately give 1 XP to another player.

name: Anticipate
description: You look ahead to see how your actions might unfold. If you spend your Action looking one round into the future, gain Foresight, adding a die to your dice pool on your next turn. Foresight is spent as soon as you take an Action, or at the end of your next turn.
tooltip: You look one round into the future, gaining Foresight to add a die to your dice pool on your next turn.

name: Foresight
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool if you spent the last turn to Anticipate. Last this round only.

name: See History
description: You touch an object, read the subtle echoes of its existence through time, ask the GM a question about the object’s past, which they must answer honestly. The answers are often in the form of brief images or sensations rather than specific answers in a language you know. Usable once between Rests.
tooltip: You ask the GM a question about an object’s past, which they must answer honestly. Usable once between Rests.

name: Time Loop
description:
You call yourself from a few moments in the future to help you in the present. On the round you use this Ability, your future self appears anywhere you choose within immediate range and takes an Action. On the second round, you and your future self both take Action. On the third round, you and your future self both disappear. On the fourth round, you catch up to your future self, reappear wherever your future self initially appeared in the first round, and can take your Actions normally.

Your future self shares your stats, so any Harm that either of you takes applies to both of you. If your future self is killed, you and your future self disappear in the third round (as normal) and you reappear, dead, in the fourth round. Neither you nor your future self can use Time Loop again until you reappear as your future self in the fourth round. While active, you have full control over your future self, controlling their Actions and rolling for them.
tooltip: You call yourself from the future. Your future self takes an Action in the first round, you both takes Actions in the second round, and you both disappear on the third round only for you to reappear in the fourth round.

name: Call Through Time
description: You call a creature or person from the recent past, and it appears next to you. You can choose a creature that you’ve previously encountered (even if it is now dead), or you can allow the GM to determine the creature randomly. The time-shifted creature does your bidding for as long as you concentrate on it, but you must use your Action each turn to direct it; otherwise it returns to the past.
tooltip: You choose a creature or character that you’ve previously encountered to do your bidding. You must use your Action to direct it each round.

name: Temporal Doppleganger
description: A perfect copy of you appears within an immediate distance. This doppelganger is a version of you from an alternate timeline. The doppelganger is the same Tier as you and shares all of your Abilities, though they do not have any equipment except simple clothing. It has your mind and memories, and you control it as if it were you in another body, rolling for it in encounters. In effect, while this Ability is active, you have two bodies. It remains for up to one minute, but disappears if killed or if you use an Action to dismiss it. If the doppelganger is killed, you take a small amount of Harm and you lose your next Action. If you are killed while the doppelganger is present, you live on as the doppelganger (it becomes your character instead of being an NPC that disappears).
tooltip: You summon your doppelganger an immediate distance away. They remain for up to one minute, but disappear if killed or if you dismiss it.

name: Mourning Period
tooltip: If your doppleganger is killed while active, you take a small amount of Harm and are stunned for one round.

name: Time Travel
description: You and up to three willing characters you choose within immediate range travel to a random point in time. The point in time will be within ten years of the present, as decided by the GM. When you appear in the new moment in time, you do so in the same position you were in when you used this Ability. Usable once per session.
tooltip: You and up to three willing characters you choose within immediate range travel to a random point in time.

name: Divine Aegis
description:
As long as you are conscious, you have access to a small plane of Divine energy, which takes on a shield-like shape. You must hold the aegis in one of your hands and you can use it a blunt melee weapon; however, you can only attack with either your shield or a one-handed weapon, not both. When you are unconscious or sleeping, the aegis dissipates.

If you have a physical shield equipped, the Divine energy radiates outwards from its centre, increasing the size of the shield by at least fifty percent.
tooltip: As long as you are conscious, you have a small plane of Divine energy, which takes on a shield-like shape and can be used as a blunt weapon.

name: Avenger's Shield
description: You can throw your Divine Aegis up to short range away as a range attack. Whether the aegis hits or misses, it immediately dissipates and then reforms in your grasp. If you are holding a physical shield, only the aegis leaves your hand to attack a target, while the shield remains attached to your arm.
tooltip: You throw your Divine Aegis up to short range away as a ranged Attack. It immediately dissipates and then reforms in your grasp.

name: Divine Pulse
description: You temporarily increase power of the Divine energy emanating from your Divine Aegis, causing it to damage a target in melee range.
tooltip: You temporarily increase power of the Divine energy emanating from your Divine Aegis, causing it to damage a target in melee range.

name: Shield Wall
description: You can trigger the energy in your Divine Aegis to expand outward in all directions to create a plane of Divine energy up to 20 feet (6 m) or up to two hexes ⬢ or squares ■ in diameter for as long as you concentrate on keeping the shield wall active. The plane of Divine energy conforms to the space available. While this Ability is active, you cannot use any of your other Abilities that require the Divine Aegis, and you can only move an immediate distance each round.
tooltip: You cause your Divine Aegis to expand outward in all directions to create a plane of Divine energy up to 20 feet (6 m) or up to two hexes ⬢ or squares &#9632 in diameter.

name: Avenger's Shield
description:
You can throw your Divine Aegis up to short range away as a range attack, bouncing from your initial target to two other targets within short range. Whether the aegis hits or misses, it immediately dissipates and then reforms in your grasp. If you are holding a physical shield, only the aegis leaves your hand to attack a target, while the shield remains attached to your arm.

Your aegis now hits two additional targets within short range before dissipating.
tooltip: You throw your Divine Aegis up to a target at short range, bouncing hit two additional targets within short range.

name: Shield Burst
description: When you make a melee attack and hit with your Divine Aegis, it releases an explosion of energy, inflicting damage on the target and everything within immediate range of the target.
tooltip: You hit a target in melee range with your Divine Aegis, inflicting damage on everything within immediate range.

name: Shield Bash
description: This is a pummeling melee attack you make with your Divine Aegis. Your attack dazes a target in melee range for one round.
tooltip: You make an attack using your Divine Aegis against a target in melee range, dazing them for one round instead of dealing damage.

name: Animus
description:
You hate them—all of them. There's no way anyone could ever convince you otherwise. Whenever you encounter the source of your hatred, add a die to your dice pool in addition to any other modifiers for a related task.

Make a note of what it is that you hate so vehemently. It could be a person, a group of people, an object or an idea. The source of your hatred shouldn't be too vague (i.e. people or rocks), but no too specific (i.e. Jerry from 4th grade or an obscure book). Ideally, you would pick a famous person, a species, a popular food item or something similar. Discuss with the details with the GM.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool in addition to any other modifiers for a related task whenever you encounter the source of your hatred.

name: <hide>
description: Make a note of what it is that you hate so vehemently. It could be a person, a group of people, an object or an idea. The source of your hatred shouldn't be too vague (i.e. people or rocks), but no too specific (i.e. Jerry from 4th grade or an obscure book). Ideally, you would pick a famous person, a species, a popular food item or something similar. Discuss with the details with the GM.

name: Wholly Dependent
description: For one reason or another, you are unable to do anything on your own. Either due to a disability or your personality, you must always have someone to help you with your Actions, though you may be able to do everyday things without assistance. In practice, this means you must always get Help before performing an Action. If you wish, you can afford yourself a certain amount of autonomy; for example, you may be able to speak in social interactions without assistance, or be able to move immediate and short distances on your own. But for the most part, another character must Help you for you to do anything signigicant. You can also still Help others, though in a limited fashion. Discuss the details with the GM.
tooltip: Either due to a disability or your personality, you must always get Help before performing an Action.

name: Magical Source
description:
Since the moment you were born, you've felt the energy flowing through you. Some may call it untapped potential, but you know better. It is as much a curse as it is a gift—a raging river of Magical energy that, at any moment, could burst through and cause untold carnage.

Within you is seemingly unending fount of Magical energy, whose type and nature is unknown to you. All you know is that any with Magical Abilities are empowered by your presence. As long as you are within immediate range of another Magic user, they gain an additional die when rolling for Magic, and Tech users can channel your power into a relevant device they are using, if applicable. The user must touch you to gain the effect, and does not have to be friendly. If you are a Magic user yourself, you do not gain this benefit.
tooltip: Magic users gain an additional die when rolling for Magic, and Tech users can channel your power into a relevant device while in immediate range of you.

name: Live Fast
description: You tap into the Magical power within you, allowing you can take two separate Actions in this round. In the following round, remove a die from your dice pool on any Task roll. You cannot perform this Feat two rounds in a row. You can perform a Feat for your second Action, if you so choose.
tooltip: You take two separate Actions in this round. In the following round, remove a die from your dice pool on any Task roll.

name: Recovery Period
tooltip: Remove a die from your dice pool on all Task rolls for one round after using the Live Fast Feat.

name: Overflow
description: For a moment—just for a moment—you allow the energy within yourself to break through, envelopping you in an aura of Magical energy. You limbs stretch out as you float a few inches off the ground, your eyes and mouth shining brightly with Magic. The sudden outflow of energy is so surprising that it roots all targets within short range as they gaze at you, mouths agape and eyes wide for 1d4 rounds. You return to your normal state at the end of your turn. The GM decides which type of Magic you display when this occurs.
tooltip: Your Magic overflows the confines of your body, intimidating all targets within short range for 1d4 rounds.

name: Beacon
description:
Over the course of two rounds, your eyes and mouth glow with Magical energy as a Magical aura envelops you. Your body itself becomes Magic, leaving nothing but a bright silhouette. A beam of pure Magical energy extends out from within you, extending out to envelop you and reaching the heavens.

While this beam is active, the bonus from your Magical Source Ability extends up to a short range away (so that Magic and Tech users no longer need to touch you to gain its effect) and all targets you choose within immediate range fall to their knees and lose their next Action. Affected targets cannot defend themselves and are treated as helpless. You are rooted in place while using this Ability, but you can maintain it over multiple rounds as long as you spend your Action each turn doing so.
tooltip: You cause the bonus from your Magical Source Ability to extend to short range. All targets you choose within immediate range become stunned.

name: At Both Ends
description: You attempt to burn away the Magical energy within you to take two separate Actions every round for up to a minute. In the first round you use this Ability, you can perform a Feat for your second Action, if you so choose. Afterwards, you can perform any two Actions for up to a minute through the Excess Energy Ability, or until you stop to Rest. After a minute has passed or you perform a Rest, you immediately collapse from Exhaustion and begin a Long Rest, which lasts at least 8 hours.
tooltip: You take two separate Actions every round for up to a minute before collapsing from Exhaustion.

name: Excess Energy
tooltip: You can perform any two Actions for up to a minute. Both Actions can be Feats, if you so choose.

name: Exhaustion
tooltip: You collapse and begin a Long Rest, which lasts at least 8 hours. Excess Energy and At Both Ends trigger this Ability.

name: The Power Within
description:
For too long, you have been a source of Magical power for others. Now, at long last, you have learned to fully tap into that power and unleash Magical energies unlike anyone has ever seen. Select one of the following Abilities:

  • Centrifuge
  • Unleash Magic

If you do not have access to Magic, Centrifuge is useless to you. However, if you do have access to Magic, then either option is viable.

name: Unleash Magic
description:
You let forth a Magical barrage at a target within short range, Attacking them with a random type of Magic. Roll 1d6 when using this Ability to determine the type of Magic used:

  1. Aura Magic
  2. Divine Magic
  3. Elemental Magic
  4. Primal Magic
  5. Psi Magic
  6. Spirit Magic
tooltip: You let forth a Magical barrage at a target within short range, Attacking them with a random type of Magic.

name: Centrifuge
description: Using the Magical torrent stored within you, you can roll at least two Magic dice when rolling for Magic this round.
tooltip: You roll at least two Magic dice when rolling for Magic this round.

name: Aura Magic
description: Whenever you use the Magical Abilities from your Focus, you are using your body's innate energy through Aura Magic. Aura Magic focuses on self-discovery, the strength of self and the ability to materialize inner strength for external use. Aura Magic is most often used to increase an individual's physical capabilities beyond their natural limits. Aura can also be manifested as an external force to push or pull in a given direction. All sentient beings have an aura, ch'i or spirit which can be sensed by those adept in Aura Magic. An individual's aura contains their essence and can be read, manipulated or destroyed.
tooltip: You can use Magic, and your Magical Abilities from your Focus use Aura Magic.

name: Bloodline Technique
description:
You have access to a very powerful Ability, one passed down through your bloodline. As such, the Ability is unique to you and your family; others may claim to have mastery over this Ability, but only you and your closest kin can use it. Whether you have a relationship with your family or not, this Ability is a part of who you are and defines you.

At the beginning of the game, select either a major effect, such as fear, poison or stasis, or of up to two minor effects, such as blind, daze or taunt. Whenever you Attack with this Ability, you apply the chosen effect(s) in addition to dealing damage. You also decide the execution and form of your Bloodline Technique; it can take whatever form you decide, as long as it falls within what Aura Magic allows. Aura Magic focuses on self-discovery, the strength of self and the ability to materialize inner strength for external use. Aura Magic is most often used to increase an individual's physical capabilities beyond their natural limits. Aura can also be manifested as an external force to push or pull in a given direction. For example, this Ability could be used to strike fear into a target through your gaze alone, or could be used to manifest Aura energy in front of your outstretched hands as an energy beam. Discuss the details with the GM.

You can use your Bloodline Technique once between each Rest, and your target must be within immediate range.
tooltip: You Attack a target within immediate range, applying a major effect or two minor effects using Aura Magic.

name: Secret Training Regiment
description: Through constant self-improvement and mastery over your Bloodline Technique, you are trained in a skill related to your bloodline technique.

name: Improved Bloodline Technique
description:
You have access to a very powerful Ability, one passed down through your bloodline. As such, the Ability is unique to you and your family; others may claim to have mastery over this Ability, but only you and your closest kin can use it. Whether you have a relationship with your family or not, this Ability is a part of who you are and defines you.

You can use your Bloodline Technique once between each Rest, and your target must be within short range.

You've achieved a measure of mastery over your Bloodline Technique, allowing you to use it at short range. If your chosen Ability requires you to interact with the target within melee range, this Ability now allows you to also move quickly within immediate range of your target, regardless of any obstacles in the way.
tooltip: You Attack a target within short range, applying a major effect or two minor effects using Aura Magic.

name: Experimental Technique
description:
As you continue to improve your mastery over your inherited Ability, you also begin to carve your own path, not only making your mark on your family's legacy, but helping to creating your own legacy as well. You have access to a new, powerful Ability, one which you developped yourself. The Ability can be related to your Bloodline Technique, but does not have to be. Regardless, only you and possibly your descendants can use this Ability.

Select either a major effect, such as fear, poison or stasis, or of up to two minor effects, such as blind, daze or taunt. Whenever you Attack with this Ability, you apply the chosen effect(s) in addition to dealing damage. You also decide the execution and form of your Experimental Technique; it can take whatever form you decide, as long as it falls within what Aura Magic allows. Aura Magic focuses on self-discovery, the strength of self and the ability to materialize inner strength for external use. Aura Magic is most often used to increase an individual's physical capabilities beyond their natural limits. Aura can also be manifested as an external force to push or pull in a given direction. For example, this Ability could be used to strike fear into a target through your gaze alone, or could be used to manifest Aura energy in front of your outstretched hands as an energy beam. Discuss the details with the GM.

You can use your Experimental Technique once between each Rest, and your target must be within immediate range.

name: There Is Another
description:
The notoriety of your Bloodline Technique is far reaching, as is your constant mastery over it and your development of new techniques. So much so that you have been approached multiple times by budding adherents looking for your guidance. Whether a younger family member or a complete stranger, you have decided to take on one of them as your student to help them reach their potential.

You now have a companion that follows you around, acting as an apprentice to your teachings. They will follow almost any command given to them without question, as long as it does not obviously put them in unnecessary danger. They will join in almost every encounter, including combat, but they act independently of you and you do not roll for them. If the follower is a family member, they begin with the basic version of your Bloodline Technique OR your Experimental Technique. If they are a stranger, they begin with a basic version of their own Bloodline Technique OR your Experimental Technique, if it is not directly related to your bloodline technique. If they have their own Bloodline Technique, the GM decides its form and function. Your apprentice is also trained in one physical or combat Skill of your choice.
itemeffect: Apprentice who will follow almost any command given to them without question, as long as it does not obviously put them in unnecessary danger. They will join in almost every encounter, including combat, but they act independently of you and you do not roll for them. They have access to either a Bloodline Technique or your Experimental Technique, depending on their origin and your choices.
itemvalue: Physical or combat Skill (of your choice)

name: Mastered Bloodline Technique
description:
You have access to a very powerful Ability, one passed down through your bloodline. As such, the Ability is unique to you and your family; others may claim to have mastery over this Ability, but only you and your closest kin can use it. Whether you have a relationship with your family or not, this Ability is a part of who you are and defines you.

Your target must be within short range.

You've fully mastered your Bloodline Technique, allowing you to use it at short range and whenever you wish without need to Rest. If your chosen Ability requires you to interact with the target within melee range, this Ability allows you move quickly within immediate range of your target, regardless of any obstacles in the way.
tooltip: You Attack a target within short range, applying a major effect or two minor effects using Aura Magic.

name: <hide>
description: At the beginning of the game, select either a major effect, such as fear, poison or stasis, or of up to two minor effects, such as blind, daze or taunt. Whenever you Attack with this Ability, you apply the chosen effect(s) in addition to dealing damage. You also decide the execution and form of your Bloodline Technique; it can take whatever form you decide, as long as it falls within what Aura Magic allows. Aura Magic focuses on self-discovery, the strength of self and the ability to materialize inner strength for external use. Aura Magic is most often used to increase an individual's physical capabilities beyond their natural limits. Aura can also be manifested as an external force to push or pull in a given direction. For example, this Ability could be used to strike fear into a target through your gaze alone, or could be used to manifest Aura energy in front of your outstretched hands as an energy beam. Discuss the details with the GM.

name: Rational Animal
description: You may be brimming with talent, but your emotional intelligence could use some work. When a situation would normally ask that you roll for Feelings, you do not roll your Feelings die. This means you will need to rely on Magic or Tech to solve the problem, or automatically fail the roll. You could also always reason that Logic is more appropriate, though the GM will need to agree with you.
tooltip: You cannot roll for Feelings, and must rely on Magic or Tech to solve Feelings-based Tasks.

name: Pack Mule
description: You have a follower who carries your incredibly large inventory of items for you, allowing you to quickly access anything you need while on the go. Any items carried by your Pack Mule are considered stashed, and can be readied or equipped using an Action. Your Pack Mule can take any form you wish, including a person, an animal or some kind of robot. They will not help you in any other capacity beyonds holding your equipment. They act independently of you and will find cover during combat.
itemeffect: Carries your incredibly large inventory of items for you. Any items carried by your Pack Mule are considered stashed, and can be readied or equipped using an Action. Will not help you in any other capacity beyonds holding your equipment. They act independently of you and will find cover during combat.

name: Hope for the Future
description: You gain an optimistic, uplifting piece of Insight about something in the near future without needing to pay XP. Only usable once between each Long Rest.
tooltip: You gain an optimistic, uplifting piece of Insight about something in the near future without needing to pay XP.

name: Tearbend
description: Overwhelmed by intense feelings of yearning and optimism for the future, you burst into tears, your words barely audible as you try to convey the full breath of your emotions to a target who can understand you. Add a die to your dice pool anytime you're trying to appeal to someone's emotions for something.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool anytime you're trying to appeal to the emotions of a target who can understand you.

name: Announce Intentions
description: If you spend your Action saying what you will be doing on your next turn, add a die to your dice pool for any Task roll in the following round. You cannot use this Ability two rounds in a row.
tooltip: You announce what you will be doing on your next turn, adding a die to your dice pool for any Task roll in the following round.

name: Best of Intentions
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool on any Task roll if you spent the last round announcing your intentions.

name: Set the Scene
description: Add three dice to your dice pool for any seduction Task as long as you spend at least two minutes gathering materials and organizing them in a small area to create an alluring display for someone you're trying to seduce. As an example, you could light some candles, lay down some pillows and satin sheets, and ensure there's some calming, entracing music playing when your target arrives. The materials to create the scene should either be on your person, easily accessible or provided by someone with little effort.
tooltip: Add three dice to your dice pool for any seduction Task as long as you spend at least two minutes preparing.

name: Love Conquers All
description: You can re-roll if you fail a roll or get a mixed success without paying the XP cost. Usable once between each Rest.
tooltip: You can re-roll if you fail a roll or get a mixed success without paying the XP cost. Usable once between each Rest.

name: Pull Up a Chair
description: You make an ally feel at ease, allowing them to take an extra Short Rest in addition to their normal Short Rest(s). Only usable once between each of your own Rests.
tooltip: You make an ally feel at ease, allowing them to take an extra Short Rest in addition to their normal Short Rest(s).

name: Make Yourself at Home
description: Your genial and sociable nature puts people at ease. Add a die to your dice pool during any positive social interaction.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool during any positive social interaction.

name: Homebody
description: Being known for your hospitality is great and all, but it means you haven't been able to focus on yourself as much. Remove a die from your dice pool for physical activities that normally require dexterity, such as running, climbing, balance or stealth.
tooltip: Remove a die from your dice pool for physical activities that normally require dexterity, such as running, climbing, balance or stealth.

name: Even in Failure
description: You don't let anything get you down. Whenever you fail a roll and get an Intrusion, you can perform another Action immediately out of turn, removing a die from your dice pool for the Task. If you fail at this second Action, you must take the second Intrusion. Otherwise, the first Intrusion is nullified and you continue as normal.
tooltip: You perform an Action out of turn after failing a roll. Get an Intrusion if you fail the second Task.

name: Counter!
description: Whenever you receive damage during combat, you can take an Action immediately out of turn, even if you've already acted this round. This Action cannot be a Feat.
tooltip: You take an Action immediately out of turn after receiving damage in combat, even if you've already acted this round.

name: Uphold Ideals
description: Add a die to your dice pool whenever you perform an Action that upholds your ideals or that works toward your higher purpose. Make note of your ideals, goals or purposes in your Notes.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool whenever you perform an Action that upholds your ideals or that works toward your higher purpose.

name: <hide>
description: Some time ago, you decided to hold certain ideals to a higher standard, or you set yourself a set of goals for you to reach for in hopes of achieving your higher purpose. Make note of those ideals or your purpose here, as they will inform many of your Actions.

name: Crisis of Faith
description: Remove a die from your dice pool whenever you perform an Action that directly goes against your ideals or your higher purpose.
tooltip: Remove a die from your dice pool whenever you perform an Action that directly goes against your ideals or your higher purpose.

name: Just the Thing
description: Using an extensive network of contacts and the limitless knowledge available to you, you find the right tool, person or solution for whatever problem you're encountering. For example, if you need a hammer to finish contruction on something, you're able to make one easily from materials at hand. Or, if faced with a puzzle, you can figure out the solution without the need for Insight. Often whatever result you're able to produce is uncanny, almost improbable in its execution as you can use this Feat to solve almost any problem you're faced with. Usable once between each Rest.
tooltip: You find the right tool, person or solution for whatever problem you're encountering in an uncanny manner.

name: Stealth Skills
description:
You are trained in your choice of the following Skills:

  • Deception
  • Disguise
  • Insight
  • Lockpicking
  • Pickpocketing
  • Sleight of Hand
  • Stealth

name: Understudy
description: You are becoming a household name among fellow performers. You have gained an understudy, someone who follows you around wherever you go, learning from you and providing help when they can. They will assist you in most non-combat Tasks, adding a die to your dice pool for the associated roll. Otherwise, they act independently of you, spending most of their time studying you as you work. They will not engage in combat, finding cover as soon as combat starts.
itemeffect: Follows you around wherever you go, assisting you in most non-combat Tasks by adding a die to your dice pool for the associated roll. Otherwise, they act independently of you and will not engage in combat, finding cover as soon as combat starts.

name: Theater Troupe
description:
You now have a group of performers who travel with you and will put on shows on demand, in exchange for lodging, food or other forms of payment. All of them are skilled in Performance and will follow your directions when it comes to putting on show. However, they will not follow you into most encounters unless you can convince them they will be needed as performers. They otherwise act independently of you and will remain together at a safe and comfortable location until you return.

You also have access to a vehicle of some kind with all of the equipment needed to put on a show. This could be a shuttle, a caravan or even a small starship. Discuss the details with the GM.
itemeffect: Follows your directions when it comes to putting on show, but they will not follow you into most encounters, acting independently of you and remaining with other troupe members at a safe and comfortable location until you return.

name: <hide>
itemeffect: Follows your directions when it comes to putting on show, but they will not follow you into most encounters, acting independently of you and remaining with other troupe members at a safe and comfortable location until you return.

name: <hide>
itemeffect: Follows your directions when it comes to putting on show, but they will not follow you into most encounters, acting independently of you and remaining with other troupe members at a safe and comfortable location until you return.

name: <hide>
itemeffect: Follows your directions when it comes to putting on show, but they will not follow you into most encounters, acting independently of you and remaining with other troupe members at a safe and comfortable location until you return.

name: <hide>
description: You have access to a vehicle of some kind with all of the equipment needed to put on a show. This could be a shuttle, a caravan or even a small starship. Discuss the details with the GM.

name: The "O" Word
description: Bringing all the facts to the table, you prove that something is, without a doubt, objectively true. This can be used in most social encounters, but may be used to refute Intrusions as well if a well reasoned, objective truth is provided. Add two dice to your dice pool for the associated Task. Usable even if you're already acted this round, and only once between each Rest.
tooltip: You prove that something is objectively true, bringing someone to your side in social encounters or refuting an Intrusion.

name: Fool Me Twice
description: You've built yourself quite the reputation as an agent of chaos, so much so that people can recognize you solely on the stories they've heard from a friend of a friend of a friend. In such cases, remove a die from your dice pool on all social interactions with them if they express that they recognize you. Similarly, if interacting more than once with someone you've tricked or pranked, remove a die from your dice pool on subsequent social interactions.
tooltip: Remove a die from your dice pool in social interactions in which you can be reasonably recognized.

name: Not a Penny
description: Due to a series of unfortunate circumstances, you do not begin the game with any items, except for two of the inexpensive items granted to you by your Type and any items granted by your Focus.
tooltip: You do not begin the game with any items, except for two of the inexpensive items granted by your Type and any items gained from your Focus.

name: Make Do
description: If you so choose, you can ignore one a part or component required when crafting or repairing something.
tooltip: If you so choose, you can ignore one a part or component required when crafting or repairing something.

name: Cold Shoulder
description: You turn your back, non-chalantly telling the person you were interacting with that they're no longer worth your time. Add a die to your dice pool when exiting any encounter. This could count towards a stealth, escape, running or social Task, as long as you are trying to get out of the encounter.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when exiting any encounter via a stealth, escape, running or social Task.

name: Special Snowflake
description: You have a skill that no one else has, that defines who you are. Perhaps even it's an integral part of your identity, and informs everything you do. In any case, select a Skill no other person has. If you meet someone with your Skill, or someone near to you suddenly becomes trained in your Skill, you may change your Special Skill to ensure you don't confirm to the norms.

name: Taking Your Time
description:
You may not be efficient, but you still get the job done. It takes you twice as much time to complete Tasks as normal. However, if you fail your roll, you fail immediately (receiving your Intrusion) and can take another Action the following round.

In most cases, this means your Actions and Feats require two rounds to complete instead of taking effect immediately. In times where it would take you more than one round to complete a Task, the time required doubles.
tooltip: You take twice as long to complete Tasks. If you fail your roll, you fail immediately and can take another Action the following round.

name: Time Moves Slow
description: Your perception of time is so warped that you cross through a threshold, being able to do twice as much than normal for a short moment in time. In practice, this means you can perform two Actions over the course of two rounds as normal, instead of needing to spend two rounds performing one Action, as if you were not slower than normal. Only one of the Actions can be a Feat, and only usable once between each Rest.
tooltip: You perform two Actions over the course of two rounds, instead of on Action over two rounds. Only one of the Actions can be a Feat.

name: Immovable Object
description: As long as you do not move on your turn, you are passively in a Guard state. Additionally, any enemy who charges at you in an attempt to knock you down or move you bounces off of you and falls to the floor. You cannot be knocked down, toppled, or moved without your consent.
tooltip: As long as you do not move, you are pasively in a Guard state. Any enemy who charges at you is knocked down. You cannot be knocked down, toppled, or moved.

name: Rooted
description: You stand firm, unable to be moved. However, this means you aren't that flexible. Remove a die from your dice pool for any physical Action requiring flexibility, such as jumping, running or escaping bonds.
tooltip: Remove a die from your dice pool for any physical Action requiring flexibility, such as jumping, running or escaping bonds.

name: Reversal
description: You set yourself into a Guard state, halving incoming damage from an Attack, but also immediately countering the Attack with one of your own. When this occurs, you can take an Action out of turn, even if you've already acted this round. The Action must be an Attack of some kind.
tooltip: While Guarding, you counter an Attack with one of your own, taking an Action out of turn to Attack, even if you've already acted this round.

name: Instigator
description:
You've always been a bit of a troublemaker. Or perhaps, it's just that people don't like it when someone takes the initiative as much as you do. Regardless, whenever you cause something to happen, such as the beginning of a combat encounter, a meeting with a stranger or the collapse of a bridge, activate The Problem, adding a die to your dice pool for any Task roll in the following round.

This effect cannot occur more than once every other round. If you do not use the bonus in the next round, it is lost until you cause the next problem.
tooltip: Whenever you cause a significant event to occur, activate The Problem.

name: The Problem
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool on any Task roll after causing something to happen in the previous round.

name: Face of the Party
description:
You've earned a reputation for being the most charismatic—or at least the most forward—member of your traveling party. As such, you have become adept at making their wishes known to people you meet. Your fellow adventurers know this and, instead of speaking to people themselves, can whisper what you should say in social interactions. You know, since you're so good at it.

This Ability makes it so anyone Helping you during a social interaction Task automatically succeeds, adding a die to your dice pool for the associated Task. This Trait only works for social interaction Tasks, and you must be able to understand the person Helping you. Additionally, when this occurs, you may also take as long as needed to say what the person whispering to you wants you to say, as if you were taking an extra turn. You can move and perform a social interaction Task during this extra turn, but nothing else.
tooltip: When someone Helps you during a social interaction Task, they automatically succeed. You must be able to understand the person Helping you.

name: Queued Attack Rotation
description: Once per combat encounter, at the beginning of the encounter, you can launch a series of  fiveAttacks against your foes in quick succession. The GM decides when combat starts and ends.
tooltip: You launch a series of five attacks against your foes. Usable only at the beginning of combat, and only once per combat.

name: Hungering Beast
description:
You have a constant hunger inside of you. It gnaws at your guts, hammers your mind and rips your soul apart. There is no way you'll ever satisfy the beast within. But at the very least, you can calm it for a short time.

Every 24 hours, you must attempt to satiate your hungers or desires. If you don't, remove a die from your dice pool on all Tasks until you've done so. Enable The Beast: Fed status once you've fed your desires. This effect lasts until your next Rest, or 24 hours—whichever comes first. Discuss with the GM what your desires are; they could be related to sex, drugs, food or material objects.
tooltip: Remove a die from your dice pool on all Tasks until you've satiated your hungers.

name: The Beast: Fed
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool on all Task rolls after indulging in your hunger or desires.

name: To the Loser
description: You're willing to fully own up to your mistakes—unlike some people. Whenever you get an Intrusion, you receive two XP as normal, but do not give any XP to another player, pocketing both XP for yourself.
tooltip: Whenever you get an Intrusion, you receive two XP as normal, but do not give any XP to another player, pocketing both XP for yourself.

name: I'll Do it Myself
description:
Some people just can't be helped. Whenever you Help another player and they fail their roll or get a mixed success, you may immediately take an Action out of turn even though you already used your Action to Help, in the hopes of correcting for their failure.

You can only perform this Action if someone you Helped fails or gets a mixed success on their subsequent roll. Using this Feat negates any negative consequences or Intrusions for the roll you Helped with. However, if you get a mixed success or fail when using this Ability, the person you Helped as well as anyone else who Helped that person shares in your negative consequences or Intrusion if you get a mixed success or fail your roll, as if they Helped you instead.
tooltip: Whenever you Help another player and they fail their roll or get a mixed success, you may immediately take an Action out of turn.

name: Nothing At All
description:
A crisp summer breeze. The feeling of starship hull on your skin. Sand in between your toes. The sensory experience is indescribable. What's more, the boost to your confidence is without equal, as you hide nothing from the world. As long as you are wearing no clothing, add a die to your dice pool on all Task rolls, except for social interaction Tasks.

Anything that masks parts of your body is considered clothing, even if only decorative in nature. For example, small jewelry and hairpins are okay, but shawls, scarves and weapon holsters are not. The only exception to the rule is you''re allowed to have a small- to medium-sized bag to hold inventory items, but nothing larger than a duffle bag.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool on all Task rolls except for social interaction Tasks if you are wearing no clothing whatsoever.

name: Eyes Up Here
description: No matter how respectful someone might be, they can't help but feel uncomfortable with your nudity as they stare directly into your eyes, unsure where they should be looking. Remove a die from your dice pool for all social interaction Tasks when speaking to non-nudists,
tooltip: Remove a die from your dice pool for all social interaction Tasks when speaking to non-nudists,

name: Find Target
description: At the beginning of each encounter, select a target. The target can be a person, creature or an object. For as long as you focus solely on your chosen target, add a die to your dice pool on all Tasks associated with that target. If the target dies, is destroyed or you lose sight of it, you lose your Target Acquired bonus. This Feat automartically succeeds.
tooltip: At the beginning of an encounter, select a target. Gain the Target Acquired status.

name: Target Acquired
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for all Task rolls related to the target you chose at the beginning of the encounter.

name: Role
description:
You've been together with your friends long enough to know what role each of your serves in your little gang. Select one of the following roles for yourself going forward:

  • The Leader
  • The Jack of All Trades
  • The Brains
  • The Heart
  • The Mascot

Selecting a role grants you an Ability or Skill befitting your role. Every player with the Meddles with the Gang focus in the group must select a different role, if applicable.

name: Let's Do It, Gang
description: Addressing your group of friends, you give them a simple set of instructions. As long as they perform a Task with the instructions you provided, they add a die to their dice pool for said Task, no matter when they decide to tackle it. You only roll once, and the instructions given can be different for each person, but you must give them to everyone all at once. The people you Helped can perform other Tasks before the you one you instructed them to do without losing the bonus to their dice pool for the Task. Once they perform the Task they were instructed to do, they lose the bonus.
tooltip: You give instructions to your friends, adding a die to their dice pool the next time they tackle a related Task.

name: Daily Skill
description: Everyday, pick a Skill for the day. You are trained in that Skill. You may pick the same Skill multiple days in a row.

name: Closer Look
description: When you spend time thoroughly exploring an area no larger than a typical room, you can ask the GM a question about the area of interest and they must answer truthfully. Can only use once between each Rest.
tooltip: You can ask the GM a question about a specific area if you spend the time exploring it.

name: Emotional Response
description: You have a pure heart, one untainted by negative feelings or emotions. Whenever you roll for Feelings, roll twice and choose the better result. Does not apply if performing an Action that would directly harm a person or creature.
tooltip: When you roll for Feelings, roll twice and choose the better result, unless you are causing direct or indirect harm to a character or creature.

name: Catchphrase!
description: You are loveable, perhaps a bit annoying, but charming all the same. Your simple outlook on life combined with an adorable disposition makes it so you can disarm most tense situations just from interjecting at the right time. Add a die to your dice pool to yell out a catchphrase, distracting all targets within short range so that they do nothing else but defend themselves for a round as they focus on you. You can also use this ability to add a die to your dice pool during positive social interactions.
tooltip: You distract all targets within short range, or add a die to your dice pool during positive social interactions.

name: Nosey
description: Add a die to your dice pool for all investigation related Task.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for all investigation related Task.

name: Found Family
description: Through thick and thin, your friends have been there, and you've been there for them. Whenever you or another person from your friend group within short range receive an Intrusion, the effects of that Intrusion are shared among you and all your friends within short range of you, mitigating the effects so that they are not concentrated on one person. In practice, this could mean that instead of being killed by an Attack, everyone gets a small amount of Harm, or instead of being arrested, everyone is slapped on the wrist. Your friend group consists of yourself and the other player characters, as well as any companions you or they have.
tooltip: The effects of Intrusions are shared among you and all your friends within short range of you, mitigating the effects.

name: Cybermancer
description:
The Hold. The most deadly force the Coalition of Planets has ever known, and perhaps ever will know. The combination of Psi Magic, Spirit Magic and technology has allowed this collective of cyborgs to accomplish what the Megor could not, in a fraction of the time: bring the Terran Republic to its knees. Many have come to fear their power, and rightly so. There is nothing natural about raising the dead, imbuing them with both Magic and cybernetic enhancements to create super soldiers, loyal to the end. However, you know that even the most vile and repulsive methods are worth studying—and study you have. Using the lessons learned from the Hold's overwhelming successes, you bridged the gap between Psi Magic, Spirit Magic and technology to be able to speak to and raise the dead, and enhancing their capabilities through the use of advanced cybernetics. The process has weighed heavily on you, corrupting your Magic, your body and soul. The trade off, however, is power never before seen in the star cluster.

As a Cybermancer, you have access to specialization Foci specific to your type:

  • Harbours a Familiar
  • Masters Clairvoyance
  • Masters Telekinesis
  • Separates Mind From Body
  • Teaches Other Recondites

name: Scry Aura
description: Attuning yourself to another's aura, you read the essence of their being, gaining a greater understanding of them and their purpose. You can ask the GM one question about a living target, including their state of being, their weaknesses or their intentions, and they must answer truthfully. You do not need to pay XP for this Insight, though you can only use this Feat once between each Rest.
tooltip: You ask the GM one question about a living target, which they must answer truthfully.

name: Ch'i Blast
description: You extend your aura outwards in front of you, striking the physical and spiritual form of a target within short range.
tooltip: You extend your aura outwards in front of you, striking the physical and spiritual form of a target within short range.

name: Palm Healing
description: Through touch and massage, you correct the energy flows of any target, including yourself, healing a small amount of Harm.
tooltip: You correct the energy flows of a target, healing a small amount of Harm.

name: Flash Step
description: You concentrate your aura into your limbs, allowing you to seemingly disappear from one location and reappear at another. You can move up, down, or across to anywhere you choose within short range if you have a clear and unobstructed path to that location.
tooltip: You seemingly disappear at one location and reappear at another a short distance away.

name: Impart Serenity
description: You wrap a target within short range in a calming aura, pacifying them for 1d6 rounds.
tooltip: You wrap a target within short range in a calming aura, pacifying them for 1d6 rounds.

name: Combo String
description: You make a melee Attack against a target. You only need to succeed on your initial roll to continue Attacking over multiple rounds as long as you do nothing but make melee Attacks and move.
tooltip: You make a melee Attack against a target, Attacking over multiple rounds as long as you do nothing but make melee Attacks and move.

name: Tear Down Defenses
description: Your careful manipulation of a target's aura tears apart their defenses. Any energy-based defenses it has (such as a force field or a Ward Ability) are negated for 1d6+1 rounds. If the target has no energy defenses, it is instead dazed for 1d6+1 rounds.
tooltip: You tear apart the defenses of a target using Aura Magic, negating an energy-based defense or dazing them for 1d6+1 rounds.

name: Stabilize Aura
description: Whenever you're about to die, you can make a 2d Magic roll to avoid dying. Each time you attempt to save yourself with this Ability before your next Long Rest, remove a die from your dice pool for this Action. You can perform this Feat even if you already acted this round.
tooltip: You make a 2d Magic roll to avoid dying. Remove a die from your dice pool each time you perform this Feat before Long Resting.

name: Pressure Point
description: When you get your exact number or a critical success on a melee Attack roll, you can kill the target outright. If your target is a PC, the character is near death instead. You must Rest between each use of this Ability.
tooltip: You make a melee Attack against your target, killing them outright if you roll your exact number or a critical success.

name: Ultimate Attack
description: Gathering as much energy within yourself as you can, you create an explosion of Aura Magic centered on a spot you can see within 1000 feet (305 m) or up to fifty hexes ⬢ or squares ■. The area within 250 feet (76 m) or up to eighteen hexes ⬢ or squares ■ is reduced to almost nothing as the sheer force of you power leaves nothing but a blighted scar where structures and terrain were before. Creatures and characters caught  within the explosion are badly damaged, or in some cases vaporized instantly if their auras are too weak to withstand the assault. Any creatures or characters left alive are badly wounded, exhausted or lay prone, as the GM decides. Creatures and characters with strong auras may be able to withstand the Attack.
tooltip: You create an explosion of Aura Magic centered on a spot you can see within 1000 feet, damaging all targets in the explosion's range.

name: Boldly Go
description: Add two dice to your dice pool the first time you explore or tackle something new.
tooltip: Add two dice to your dice pool the first time you explore or tackle something new.

name: LARP
description:
For you, it's not enough to just go through the world as you are. You want to truly live, to be greater than you are. You want, in other words, an adventure. And what adventure is not complete without an adventurer to conquer it? For this reason, you've fashioned a fantastic persona for yourself, one which, with proper preparation, allows you to immerse yourself in a fantasy world in which you are the hero.

At the beginning of the game, create a second character sheet in addition to this one. This second character sheet will be your fantasy persona. You can build the second character sheet however you wish, though you must reasonably be able to perform the Actions of the persona, including but not limited to Magic and Abilities that would require access to specific states or items. Also, if picking a different species than the one on your primary character sheet, you must have some way to regularly disguise yourself well enough not to be recognized for what you truly are.

You can use Abilities and Skills from either character sheet. However, getting into character for your fantasy person requires work. You need at least an hour to switch to your second character sheet the first time you do it in any given day, and you remain in character until your next Long Rest, until you volountarily drop the facade or when using an Ability or Skill from your primary character sheet. After breaking character, you must wait at least thirty minutes before re-activating your fantasy persona. The only exception is if you temporarily break character to speak casually with people without a Task roll involved. Items are shared between character sheets; you do not get duplicate starting equipment from your Type(s).
tooltip: You have a second character sheet that represents a fantasy persona. When in character, you can use its Abilities and Skills at will.

name: Fantasy Persona
tooltip: You are embodying the character of your fantasy persona. You can use its Abilities and Skills at will.

name: Get Into Character
description: Taking the time to build a convincing costume, to recite some prepared lines and to warm up your vocal cords, you prepare to get into the character of your fantasy persona. Once activated, you remain in your fantasy person until your next Long Rest, until you volountarily drop the facade or when using an Ability or Skill from your primary character sheet. After breaking character, you must wait at least thirty minutes before re-activating your fantasy persona. The only exception is if you temporarily break character to speak casually with people without a Task roll involved.
tooltip: You get into the character of your fantasy persona. After breaking character, you must wait at least thirty minutes before re-activating.

name: Got You Pegged
description: Add a die to your dice pool when passing judgement on someone to a group of people who can understand you, convincing them that your judgement is reasonable. Passing judgement can have many effects, including ostracization, enforcement of local law, or the pardon of past crimes. It all depends on the context and what kind of judgement you pass.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool to pass judgement on someone, convincing a group of people who can understand you that your judgement is just.

name: Damn Machines
description: You just don't understand why people like these things. They're a menace! When a situation would normally ask that you roll for Tech, you do not roll your Tech die. This means you will need to rely on Magic, Logic or Feelings to solve the problem, or automatically fail the roll.
tooltip: You cannot roll for Tech, and must rely on Magic, Logic or Feelings to solve Tech-based tasks.

name: Getting By
description: Because of your adversion to technology, you start the game with an explorer's pack containing crafting tools, a bag of light tools, a book on a subject of your choice and a univeral translation pocketbook to help you navigate the world without the need for science-fiction gizmos. You should also take care when selecting your starting equipment to ensure you only have low-tech items in your inventory.

name: Peer Review
description:
