Science is a collaborative endeavour; no person is an island when it comes to the discovery and application of knowledge. As such, you jump to action whenever you see one of your allies fail in a Task with the goal of replicating whatever it is they were trying to accomplish—with their assistance, of course.

You immediately take an Action out of turn after seeing an ally fail a Task roll. You cancel any Intrusions they might have received and then add two dice to your dice pool to perform the same Action. If you are unable to take the same Action due to lacking the proper tools or Abilities, you perform a similar Action instead. If appropriate, the person you intervened for can Help, even though they already acted that round. Regardless of whether they do or not, if you fail on your attempt, you are both affected by the Intrusion. You cannot perform this Feat if you already acted this round.
tooltip: You immediately take an Action after seeing an ally fail a Task, cancelling any Intrusions and performing the same Action with their Help.

name: Pray
description: Taking a moment to collect yourself, you kneel down, close your eyes and pray to source of your religious faith, healing a small amount of Harm on yourself without the need for medical equipment. Each round you keep your prayer going heals an additional small amount of Harm without the need to roll to heal again.
tooltip: You heal small amount of Harm on yourself without the need for medical equipment, healing each round you keep the prayer going.

name: Have Faith
description: Your higher power works in mysterious ways. People sometimes forget this and you've come to realize that it's up to you to remind them. Whenever you see an ally fail a Task roll, you can allow them to re-roll without paying any XP by appealing to their sense of faith (or yours, if they aren't religious). Performing this Feat counts as your Action in any given round, and you can't use it on yourself.
tooltip: You allow an ally to re-roll a failed Task roll without paying any XP.

name: Effort-less
description: Remove a die from your dice pool for any Task requiring physical exertion, such as running, jumping, lifting, pushing or breaking things.
tooltip: Remove a die from your dice pool for any Task requiring physical exertion, such as running, jumping, lifting, pushing or breaking things.

name: Family Name
description: You are a part of a very influential and powerful family within your culture's society. Those within that society recognize your importance by name only, though you yourself don't necessarily have anything to boast about beyond your name. In fact, all you've done so far with your life is be groomed by your family to continue with the family's affairs once you are of age, which includes the best education one can buy as well as training in social norms.
tooltip: You are a part of a very powerful family within your culture's society. Those within that society recognize your importance by name only.

name: Death Magic
description: Whenever you use Magic from your Focus, you are actually connecting with the spirits of the deceased, drawing on their remnant life force to give you otherworldly powers. The primary purpose of Spirit Magic is communication of the dead, but intermediate users of Spirit Magic can imbue spirit remnants into objects or living beings, allowing the deceased person to walk among the living once more.
tooltip: You can use Magic, and the Magical Abilities from your Focus use Spirit Magic.

name: Raise Dead
description: Using your mastery over Spirit Magic, you cause an inanimate corpse to rise up for 2d8 rounds that acts as you direct each round. Directing the elemental is an Action, and you can command it only when you are within long range of it. Without a command, the animated corpse continues to follow your previous command. You can also give it a simple Action, such as “Wait here, and Attack anyone who comes within short range until they're dead.” While animated, the corpse can make most of the Actions it could do while alive, though it cannot speak or use Magic. The corpse can be fresh, or simply the skeletal remains of a character or creature. Once their time is up, the corpse collapses to the ground and becomes unusable.
tooltip: You cause an inanimate corpse to rise up for 2d8 rounds that acts as you direct each round.

name: Android Avatar
description:
Your primary method of interacting with the world is no longer through your physical form, but rather through a robotic android which you control remotely. The android is apparently autonomous—and surprisingly self-sufficient—to those unaware that you are in control. The android can survive in almost any environment, including in vaccums and underwater to a depth of 4 miles (6 km). It can see in the dark up to a short distance, and does not require any refuelling as it relies on a powerful Crystal energy source. If some reason the android is destroyed, it takes you up to a week and the necessary materials to construct a new one at your remote location. The android is also equipped with a built-in Automatic Translator.

While the android is active, you essentially control two characters. First is the android itself, which goes on adventures, performs physical Actions and interacts with the majority of the world. The other is your true self, which remains stationary at a remote location and controls the Actions of the android, as well as providing its voice and personality. The android is not conscious or sentient in any way; it acts only as an empty vessel for you to occupy from afar. The range on your control is infinite, so you can choose any location for your true self to reside. Although, some Intrusions may cause you to lose contact with your avatar.

Whether you are performing Actions for your true self or your Avatar, you are using the Abilities and character attributes of your true self. The only difference is you can only use the Abilities from your Focus when controlling the android; you are not able to perform Actions reserved for your avatar when performing an Action as your true self. Additionally, whenever you act in a given round, you can only perform an Action as your true self OR as your avatar, not both (unless an Ability allows you to perform more than one Action per round).

The android must be humanoid in shape, and can't be larger than the largest humanoids (7'8" [240cm] tall, 595 lbs [270 kg] in weight), but it does not need to conform to any known humanoid's appearance. Most of the phsyical Actions your android takes can be achieved through a Tech roll. Your android cannot be healed through traditionnal methods, and must instead be repaired. Long Resting as the android causes it to power down, which allows your true self to Rest; a Short Rest can be considered a quick reboot of the android's systems. If your connection to your android is lost, it powers down as if Long Resting.
tooltip: You control an android remotely, acting as your avatar and the primary method for you to interact with the world.

name: <hide>
itemeffect: Controlled remotely, acting as your primary method of interacting with the world. Can survive in almost any environment, including in vaccums and underwater to a depth of 4 miles (6 km). It can see in the dark up to a short distance and is equipped with a built-in Automatic Translator.

name: Haptic Interface
description: Using an improved haptic interface, you temporarily increase your android's physical capabilities, adding a die to your dice pool for any physical Task, including melee or ranged Attacks.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when controlling your android for any physical Task, including melee or ranged Attacks.

name: Self-diagnostic
description: Your android performs a self-diagnostic and repairs itself for a moderate amount of Harm.
tooltip: Your android performs a self-diagnostic and repairs itself for a moderate amount of Harm.

name: Arm Cannon
description: Your android temporarily reconfigures their arm into a cannon, allowing it to project blasts of Psi energy. These blasts inflict damage with a range of 200 feet (61 m) or up to fifteen hexes ⬢ or squares ■.
tooltip: Your android fires blasts of Psi energy from an arm cannon at a target within 200 feet or up to fifteen hexes ⬢ or squares ■.

name: Martyr Protocol
description:
You android sacrifices its physical form to cause a tremendous explosion of Psi energy. The area within 250 feet (76 m) or up to eighteen hexes ⬢ or squares ■ is saturated with visible psionic energy for five minutes, causing widespread damage to structures and terrain in the area. Objects and structures randomly disintegrate under the stress of such power, causing building to collapse, walls to topple and cliffs to crumble. Creatures and characters inside collapsed buildings or beneath a crumbling cliff or falling wall are subject to crushing damage and may have to dig themselves free, as the GM decides. Creatures and characters can also be damaged by the psionic energies directly.

It takes a round for the android to reach critical mass before exploding, allowing any allies to get out of the immediate area (if they are able and willing).
tooltip: Your android explodes with tremendous Psi energy, causing widespread damage to characters, creatures, structures and terrain.

name: Reconfigure
description:
Your android can now change its shape from its normal humanoid form to something else in order to assist your allies. Select one of the following options going forward:

  • Reconfigure: Armour
  • Reconfigure: Vehicle
  • Reconfigure: Weapon

Your android can transform to its new form and back at will, though reconfiguring requires an Action each time.

name: Reconfigure: Vehicle
description: Your android reconfigures into a vehicle large enough to carry at least one person, maybe two depending on the size of your android, in a shape reminiscent of a hoverbike or speeder. While in vehicle mode, your android can fly up to 310 mph (500 kph) in any direction, though your passenger(s) are not protected against the elements. Either you or one of your allies can control the android while transformed; if you ally controls it, they can treat it as they would any vehicle. Action to reconfigure; Action to revert.
tooltip: Your android reconfigures into a vehicle reminiscent of a hoverbike or speeder, flying up to 310 mph (500 kph).

name: Reconfigure: Weapon
description: Your android reconfigures into a large, heavy ranged weapon that needs to be mounted on a tripod to aim properly. While transformed, your android adds two dice to the weilder's ranged Attack and allows them to use its Arm Cannon Feat to Attack foes. Your android can also act as a turret without assistance, though there is no additional benefit to doing so. Action to reconfigure; Action to revert.
tooltip: Your android reconfigures into a lranged weapon that adds two dice to the weilder's ranged Attack and allows them to use its Arm Cannon.

name: Reconfigure: Armour
description: Your android reconfigures itself into an artificial exoskeleton that wraps itself around an ally, providing them with the same benefits as Power Armour would while equipped. The android-now-exoskeleton provides breathable air for up to eight hours and a comfortable environment even in bitter heat, cold, or underwater to a depth of 4 miles (6 km); and it allows your ally to see in the dark up to a short distance. It also allows your ally to fly up to a long distance as their Action, and they can use all of your android's Abilities. However, you do not have control over your android while transformed into the Power Armour. Action to reconfigure; Action to revert.
tooltip: Your android reconfigures itself into an exoskeleton that wraps itself around an ally, giving them a temporary suit of Power Armour.

name: Recognition
description: Whenever you Long Rest with your allies, you can recognize the talents of one of your allies in front of their friends and colleagues. That character adds a die to their dice pool for all Tasks related to a specific Skill that you praised them for until their next Long Rest. Only one character can benefit from this bonus each day. You can target the same chracter multiple days in a row.
tooltip: Each Long Rest, an ally adds a die to their dice pool for Tasks related to a specific Skill that you praise until their next Long Rest.

name: Dualtask
description: You perform two Actions in a single round. Only one of the Actions can be a Feat. Only usable once between each Rest.
tooltip: You perform two Actions in a single round. Only one of the Actions can be a Feat.

name: Night Owl
description: While Long Resting, you can perform a crafting or repair Task at a quarter of your normal proficiency, or whatever you can do within the span of two hours.
tooltip: While Long Resting, you can perform a crafting or repair Task at a quarter of your normal proficiency.

name: Tripletask
description: You perform three Actions in a single round. Only two of the Actions can be a Feat. Only usable once between each Rest.
tooltip: You perform three Actions in a single round. Only two of the Actions can be a Feat.

name: Re-do
description: You can re-roll any Task roll while performing more than on Action per round. Only usable once per multi-Action Feat.
tooltip: You re-roll any Task roll while performing more than on Action per round. Only usable once per multi-Action Feat.

name: Quadtask
description: You perform four Actions in a single round. Only three of the Actions can be a Feat. Only usable once between each Rest.
tooltip: You perform four Actions in a single round. Only three of the Actions can be a Feat.

name: Multitask
description: You perform four Actions in a single round. Only three of the Actions can be a Feat. Only usable once per encounter.
tooltip: You perform four Actions in a single round. Only three of the Actions can be a Feat.

name: Diamond Hands
description:
Being a stockbroker takes a lot of skill. Selecting one of the following Skills to be trained in.

  • Bartering
  • Computers
  • Deception
  • Mathematics
  • Persuasion

name: More Than Just Skill
description: You have an additional 1d6 Luck die which you roll at the same time as your dice pool, but does not count towards you dice count. Instead, you can choose to substitute the number rolled on of your other dice with the one from your Luck die. If you already have a Luck die from another source, you now have two dice you can use to substitute your usual dice.
tooltip: You can substitute the result of one of your dice with the result from an extra 1d6 Luck die.

name: Adulting
description: Add a die to your dice pool when you perform an Action that could be considered something an adult would do, such as paying taxes, calling customer service or buying a house. Discuss whether an Action could be considered something an adult would do with the GM.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when you perform an Action that could be considered something an adult would do.

name: Bad Back
description: Whenever you get a mixed success on a physical Task, you fail the roll instead and get an Intrusion.
tooltip: Whenever you get a mixed success on a physical Task, you fail the roll instead and get an Intrusion.

name: Moral High Ground
description: You have constructed a set of morals for yourself which dictate what is right, and what is wrong. Briefly describe your moral code in your Notes.

name: Like the Dead
description: You revel in death, disease and suffering. Whenever you witness another character die or take significant Harm (5 or more) in a single round, you gain 1 XP and heal a small amount of Harm on yourself.
tooltip: If you witness another character die or take significant Harm in a single round, gain 1 XP and heal a small amount of Harm on yourself.

name: Something's Not Quite Right
description: Something about you just rubs people the wrong way. Maybe it's your looks, or the way you act. Whatever the case may be, you are unable to refuse Intrusions as a result of social interactions, though you still receive XP for them.
tooltip: You can't refuse Intrusions from social interactions.

name: Format: Guardian
description: Add a die to your dice pool on all Net related activites. The Net is a connective network of computers and other devices spanning across the entire star cluster, and is used by all civilizations within the Coalition of Planets for communications, commerce and more. A datapad, computer deck or console with access to the Net is required for this Trait to have effect.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool on all Net related activites. A device with access to the Net is required for this Trait to have effect.

name: Mend & Defend
description: Add a die to your dice pool when repairing any technological device.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when repairing any technological device.

name: Glitch Tool
description: Bodily harm isn't the only way to hurt someone. You cause financial ruin or the social downfall of a target of choice by hacking into their profiles in the Net. Requires access to the Net, and for the target to have a Net presence. However, the effects of this Ability are equivalent to an Intrusion on the target. Requires you to spend at least two minutes infiltration the target's accounts, and you can only do this once between each Rest.
tooltip: You cause financial ruin or the social downfall of a target of choice by hacking into their profiles in the Net.

name: Virus Protocols
description: Add a die to your dice pool to deploy or remove a virus from a device.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool to deploy or remove a virus from a device.

name: Download a Shuttle
description: When Helping another character, you can choose to halve the amount of time and materials needed for them to craft something instead of adding a die to their dice pool, with a minimum of one Action and one material to build something. You do this by downloading the necessary schematics from the Net. Whether you do this legally or not is up to you and the GM.
tooltip: When Helping, you halve the amount of time and materials needed for them to craft something instead of adding a die to their dice pool.

name: Tap Network
description: When you wish it, you can contact up to ten beings known to you, no matter where they are, as long as they are connected to the Net. All targets must be willing and able to communicate. All beings in the network are linked and can communicate via their device of choice with one another. They can also “overhear” anything said in the network, if they wish. The network lasts until you choose to end it.
tooltip: When you wish it, you can contact up to ten beings known to you, no matter where they are, as long as they are connected to the Net.

name: Need to Clean
description: Mess and disorder—you just can't let it go. Whenever there's a mess or any kind of disorganization within long range, you must roll twice on every roll and take the worst result. If you fail, your Intrusion involves your attempt to fulfill your need to clean.
tooltip: Whenever there's a mess within long range, you must roll twice on every roll and take the worst result.

name: Shape of Square Things
description: Add a die to your dice pool when organizing or cleaning something.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when organizing or cleaning something.

name: The Devil May Care
description: You don't really think about the consequences your Actions may have on people—nor do you care, really. Whenever you receive a mixed success on a Task involving at least one other person, there's a chance that you ignore its effects. In practice, this means the DM will roll 1d2 when you get a mixed success involving another person to determine whether it takes effect or not.
tooltip: Whenever you receive a mixed success on a Task involving at least one other person, there's a chance that you ignore its effects.

name: Kill with Kindness
description: Add a die to your dice pool in positive social interactions in which you are being overly nice to your target.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool in positive social interactions in which you are being overly nice to your target.

name: Cause a Ruckus
description: You bang on metal objects, scream and shout, and do whatever you can to hold a target's attention, distracting them for as long as you keep making noise. The target must be able to hear you and must be within long range.
tooltip: You make noise to hold a target's attention, distracting them for as long as you keep at it.

name: Bad Reputation
description:
You've done something so noteworthy, so horribly damning that now everyone knows who you are and, more importantly, what you did. Wanted pictures with your face decorate every bar, restaurant and law enforcement from Plumeth to the far reaches of Coalition of Planets space. People recognize you almost immediately, or can be convinced of your reputation relatively easily after only a few minutes of speaking to you about what you've done.

When speaking with an intelligent being who can understand you and isn't hostile, add a die to your dice pool if you use your Action to try to intimidate them into doing something for you if they know what you've done.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool if you use your Action to intimidate an intelligent being to do something for you.

name: Dastardly Deeds
description: Make note of what it is that you makes you so notorious, including any evil, illegal or generally unethical deeds you've comitted.

name: Bounty
description:
Due to your past actions, you have a sizeable bounty on your head that stretches across all of Coalition of Planets space. Bounty Hunters and law enforcement alike are always on the lookout for you, ready for the chance at cashing in the prize for your capture—or your execution.

The bounty on your head is equivalent to a Very Expensive item. You can attempt to pay off the bounty—or maybe even figure out a way to cash it in yourself. However, until the bounty is lifted, the GM can inflict an Intrusion on you in the form of bounty hunters or law enforcement hunting you down for said bounty. You can't refuse the Intrusion, though you still get XP. This can't happen more than once per session.
tooltip: The GM can inflict Intrusions you can't refuse, where bounty hunters or law enforcement hunt you down for a Very Expensive bounty.

name: Incognizant
description: Tact? Nope. Paying attention? None of that here. Saying the wrong thing at the wrong time? Oh yeah, all the time. You're just not that good at picking up on social cues. Remove a die from your dice pool on all social interactions.
tooltip: You're just not that good at picking up on social cues. Remove a die from your dice pool on all social interactions.

name: Weird Magic
description: If you don't already use Magic, you are tapping into the unbound power of Psi when using your Abilities from your Descriptor. Proficiency in the use of Psi Magic is dependent on the knowledge of the individual and is limited by their constitution. Individuals can only use Psi Magic for so long before succumbing to fatigue or worse.
tooltip: You can use Magic, and all of your Magical Abilities from your Descriptor use Psi Magic.

name: OIl Baron
description: You start the game with three bottles of oil that you can use on yourself to enable your Abilities. Each bottle represents one use.

name: Grease Up
description:
A technique passed down generation by generation. An unconventional one, perhaps, but an effective one nevertheless. You're an oil wrestler, a fighter who prepares for every fight by first covering your body in oil to allow for some unique fighting moves.

This Ability is what you use to cover yourself in oil. To be able to use this Feat, you need to first have as little clothing as possible, with specific focus on leaving your abdomen, arms and legs bare. Having leather or clothing impervious to oil would also help. Next, you need access to some kind of oil. If you spend at least 2 minutes covering yourself in oil, you automatically succeed and activate the Slippery status for an hour, or until the oil is forcibly removed from your body. Some examples of forced removal including being cleaned or having it burned off. If you're in a hurry, you can roll for Feelings to accomplish this Feat within a single round.
tooltip: You cover your bare skin in oil, activating the Slippery Status. Automatically succeed if you spend 2 minutes oiling yourself up.

name: Slippery
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool on all Escape tasks. Allows the use of the Slide Feat.

name: Slide
description: You make a running dive towards a target up to a long range away, using the oil on your stomach to effortlessly glide towards them and make an unarmed Attack, all in one round. Requires the Slippery Status, and the path between you and the target needs to be flat and uninterrupted.
tooltip: You make a running dive towards a target, using the oil on your stomach to effortlessly glide towards them and make an unarmed Attack.

name: Pilot Suit
description: You start the game with a patented, highly specialized bodysuit that interfaces with your meka, allowing you to pilot it with increased accuity. While wearing the suit, the line between where you start and the meka ends is blurred, as your body movements are accurately conveyed by your meka to the point that it almost feels like its anticipating what you will do. Equip and unequipping the bodysuit requires an Action. You can pilot your meka without the bodysuit, though it will be slow and at times unresponsive if you do.

name: Meka
description:
You own or have access to a meka, which you are trained to pilot. Meka are bipedal exoskeletons, originally crafted during the Megor invasions to combat their superior physical capabilities. The meka is approximately twice as large as you, and is vaguely humanoid in shape, though the design can change depending on the manufacturer. The standard load out for a meka includes a heavy assault rifle and an energy dagger, which is strapped to its side. The meka provides breathable air for up to eight hours and a comfortable environment even in bitter heat, cold, or underwater to a depth of 4 miles (6 km). Getting into the meka requires an Action (and, of course, access to your meka).

The meka does not have any special movement Abilities by default, and moves as if in difficult terrain:

  • Immediate – Your meka cannot move an immediate distance as part of another Action on your turn. Your meka can only move an immediate distance as your entire Action on your turn.
  • Short – You must roll if you want your meka to move a short distance as their Action on your turn.
  • Long – It is (basically) impossible for your meka to move a long distance. Your meka may be able to move a long distance if you critically succeed on your roll to move a short distance.
tooltip: You own or have access to a meka, which you are trained to pilot.

name: Ownership Rights
description:
You either have full ownership of the meka, or you are using it under the watchful gaze of another organization. Select one of the following:

  • You have full ownership of the meka
  • You use the meka with permission of an established organization

While you may have more freedom if you have full ownership of the meka, you are responsible for replacing it if it is destroyed. Working for an established organization allows you to be more reckless with the meka, if that is your wish.

name: Rental Period
description: You have access to a meka, provided to you by an established organization. Disccus the details of the organization with the GM. It can be anything from a wealthy CEO, to a secret undeground military research company, or even a sports team. Regardless, since they provide you with the meka, they also have the power to take it away if you don't meet their expectations. They will, however, also replace the meka if ever it is destroyed at no cost to you. Make a note of the company you're beholden to.

name: All to Myself
description: You purchased or built a meka of your own, using what's available currently on the market. If your meka is destroyed, it takes two weeks and the necessary materials to build a new one, or you must pay the equivalent of an Exorbitant Item to purchase a new one.
itemeffect: A bipedal exoskeleton approximately twice as large as you, vaguely humanoid in shape. Includes a heavy assault rifle and an energy dagger, which is strapped to its side. Provides breathable air for up to eight hours and a comfortable environment even in bitter heat, cold, or underwater to a depth of 4 miles (6 km).

name: Maneuvering Modifications
description:
You've attached rocket boosters to your meka, adding additional movement capabilities. Select one of the following Abilities to represent the upgrade:

  • Read Thrusters
  • Rocket Charge

name: Rear Thrusters
description: You fire off your meka's rocket boosters, allowing it to move a long distance in any direction you can see as long as it has a clear and unobstructed path.
tooltip: Your meka moves a long distance in any direction you can see as long as it has a clear and unobstructed path.

name: Rocket Charge
description: Using rocket boosters attached to its back, your meka charges at a target within short range, grabbing onto them and pinning them to the ground or to a wall once you stop moving. The target must then spend at least one Action trying to extract itself from your meka's grip. You must have a clear and unobstructed path to your target.
tooltip: Your meka charges at a target within short range, pinning them to the ground or to a wall once you stop moving.

name: Travel Mode
description: Your meka can now transform into a speeder-like vehicle large enough for one person to ride. While in travel mode, your meka can fly up to 310 mph (500 kph) in any direction, though you are no longer protected against the elements and you cannot use any of its Attacks, as it is only a vehicle and not a meka. Action to transform; Action to revert back to meka form.
tooltip: Your meka transforms into a speeder-like vehicle large enough for one person to ride, flying up to 310 mph (500 kph) in any direction.

name: Combat Modifications
description:
You've improved the combat capabilities of your meka. Select one of the following Abilities to represent the upgrade:

  • Arm Cannon
  • Retractable Swords

name: Arm Cannon
description: Your meka now has an arm-mounted energy cannon, allowing it to project blasts of Psi energy. These blasts inflict damage with a range of 200 feet (61 m) or up to fifteen hexes ⬢ or squares ■.
tooltip: Your meka fires blasts of Psi energy from an arm-mounted cannon at a target within 200 feet or up to fifteen hexes ⬢ or squares ■.

name: Retractable Swords
description: Your meka now has energy swords embedded into both of its arms, which you can deploy and retract at a press of a button. While the blades are out, your meka can make two sword Attacks against targets in melee range, making both Attacks within the same round. Your meka cannot hold anything while the swords are deployed. You can deploy or retract the swords as part of another Action in the same round, but you can only do either one once per round.
tooltip: With its swords deployed, your meka makes two sword Attacks against targets in melee range.

name: Call Meka
description: Regardless of how far away your are from your meka, you can call it to you. Once it arrives, you can spend an Action to get into it, or use its Abilities without you getting into it. Each Action your meka performs while you're out of it requires an Action on your part.
tooltip: You call your meka to your regardless of where it is. You can use its Abilities without getting into it.

name: Core Implosion
description: You cause your meka's core to implode, triggering a tremendous explosion of Psi energy. The area within 250 feet (76 m) or up to eighteen hexes ⬢ or squares ■ is saturated with visible psionic energy for five minutes, causing widespread damage to structures and terrain in the area. Objects and structures randomly disintegrate under the stress of such power, causing building to collapse, walls to topple and cliffs to crumble. Creatures and characters inside collapsed buildings or beneath a crumbling cliff or falling wall are subject to crushing damage and may have to dig themselves free, as the GM decides. Creatures and characters can also be damaged by the psionic energies directly.
tooltip: Your meka explodes with tremendous Psi energy, causing widespread damage to characters, creatures, structures and terrain.

name: Skilled Approach
description: Add a die to your dice pool for any Task in which you are skilled. Only usable once between each Rest.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for any Task in which you are skilled.

name: Practice Makes It
description: You no longer have to remove a die from your dice pool when performing the same Action multiple rounds in a row.
tooltip: You no longer have to remove a die from your dice pool when performing the same Action multiple rounds in a row.

name: Skilled Approach
description:
Add a die to your dice pool for any Task in which you are skilled in. Only usable once between each Rest.

You need one less die to succeed when performing this Feat, meaning getting 0 successes gives you a mixed success, and you only need one die to succeed.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for any Task in which you are skilled. You need one less die to succeed at this Feat.

name: Skilled Approach
description:
Add two dice to your dice pool for any Task in which you are skilled in. Only usable once between each Rest. You need one less die to succeed when performing this Feat, meaning getting 0 successes gives you a mixed success, and you only need one die to succeed.

You now add two dice to your dice pool instead of just one.
tooltip: Add two dice to your dice pool for any Task in which you are skilled. You need one less die to succeed at this Feat.

name: Perfection
description: You automatically succeed on a Task of your choice. Only usable once between each Long Rest.
tooltip: You automatically succeed on a Task of your choice.

name: Bleeding Heart
description: When performing acts or saying things that would improve your standing with a hostile target, they become friendly immediately instead of becoming neutral.
tooltip: Hostile targets become friendly instead of neutral when you do things that improve your social standing with them.

name: Trust Me
description: Add a die to your dice pool to change someone's mind about you, making a hostile target neutral or a neutral target friendly. The target must be able to understand you, and only usable once between each Rest.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool to make a hostile target neutral, or a neutral target friendly. They must be able to understand you.

name: Inspire Pity
description: You do something so pitiful, so pathetic that a hostile target becomes neutral to you (and you alone).
tooltip: You do something so pitiful, so pathetic that a hostile target becomes neutral to you (and you alone).

name: Improve Disposition
description: Add a die to your dice pool to change the social disposition of a target from hostile to neutral, or neutral to friendly. Only usable once per target.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool to change a target from hostile to neutral, or neutral to friendly. Only usable once per target.

name: Hostile Banter
description: Add a die to your dice pool for social interactions with hostile targets who can understand you.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for social interactions with hostile targets who can understand you.

name: Certification
description: You have a portable, wallet-sized piece of ID that identifies you as a professional belonging to your chosen profession, and that you are certified to do the work that you do.

name: High Standards
description:
You have a certain set of standards that you adhere to as a professional. These standards inform everything that you do. Whenever you succeed on a roll, you get a critical success instead if you followed the standards of your profession. This means you would only need two die for a critical success instead of three.

Make note of the standards for your profession; there should be at least three, but no more than ten. Discuss the details with the GM.
tooltip: Whenever you succeed on a roll, get a critical success instead if you followed the standards of your profession.

name: <hide>
description: Make note of the standards for your profession; there should be at least three, but no more than ten. Discuss the details with the GM.

name: I Did This
description: You just love it when you accomplish something. Gain 1 XP in addition to the extra effect you get when you critically succeed on a Task.
tooltip: Gain 1 XP in addition to the extra effect you get when you critically succeed on a Task.

name: Business Casual
description: You have in your possession a set of clothing that paints you as a professional, who's still approachable and casual when you need to be.

name: Therapy Session
description: You sit down with a target who can understand you, going over their problems in excrutiating detail for up to an hour, keeping them focused on you for the entire duration. You don't need to interact directly with the target for the entire hour; however, you do need to remain within long range and within line of sight, and must respond to them every minute or so.
tooltip: You distract a target who can understand you within long range for up to an hour, keeping them focused on you for the duration.

name: Unusual Methods
description:
You have a very particular, and perculiar, way of treating your patients. Some may call it cruel but, all you can say is that it is effective. Select one of the following Abilities:

  • Drug Cocktail
  • Hypnosis
  • Shock Therapy

name: Shock Therapy
description: You imbue a target in melee range with fifty thousand volts of electricity using a small, handheld device in short pulses, stunning them for 1d4 rounds. Once the stun ends, the target has a 25% chance to heal 1 Harm. In practice, this means the GM will roll 1d4 to determine whether the target heals or not.
tooltip: You stun a target in melee range using electricity for 1d4 rounds, with a 25% to heal 1 Harm once the stun ends.

name: Hypnosis
description: Using kind words and a visual aid, you cause a target who can see or hear you to fall asleep for 1d4 rounds. This counts as a Short Rest.
tooltip: You cause a target who can see or hear you to fall asleep for 1d4 rounds. This counts as a Short Rest.

name: Drug Cocktail
description: You inject a target in melee range with a drug cocktail of your own making, putting them into a state of confusion for 1d4 rounds while the side effects wear off. Once they do, the target has a 50% chance to heal 1 Harm. In practice, this means the GM will roll 1d2 to determine whether the target heals or not.
tooltip: You confuse a target in melee range for 1d4 rounds using drugs. Once the effect wears off, they have a 50% chance to heal 1 Harm.

name: Diagnosis
description: If you spend your Action trying to convince an intelligent being that can understand you that they are suffering from a specific mental illness which you have diagnosed them with, add two dice to your dice pool for the associated Task. The diagnosis does not need to be true.
tooltip: Add two dice to your dice pool as you try to convince an intelligent being they are suffering from a specific mental illness.

name: Time is Money
description: Keep a ten second timer next to you. As long as you name your Action and roll for the Action within ten seconds, add an additional success to your result in addition to any successes received from your roll. This does not apply to rolls failed due to another Ability, or to Intrusions received outside of rolls.
tooltip: Add a success to your dice roll result as long as you name and roll for your Action within ten seconds.

name: Murmurs
description: You must always been within immediate range of a target for them to be able to hear your voice properly. Otherwise, any words you speak become indiscernible. This also applies to any device that would normally apmplify your voice or allow you to speak over long distances; your voice is too quiet for the devices to pick up. However, this does not affect any telepathic communication you may have.
tooltip: You must always been within immediate range of a target for them to be able to hear your voice properly.

name: Pay the Price
description: No matter how good you are at what you do, the consequences of your actions will eventually catch up to you. Every successive time you have a social interaction in which you are being deceptive or insincere with someone after your first interaction, there is a 25% chance you will automatically fail and receive an Intrusion instead, even if you succeed at your roll. In practice, this means the GM will roll 1d4 to determine whether you fail. This manifests itself as the person you're interacting with being tired of your shenanigans.
tooltip: Every time you interact insincerely with someone after your first interaction, you may automatically fail and receive an Intrusion instead.

name: Dispel Illusion
description: You know what's real, and what isn't. If you use your Action to accruately describe why something or someone in front of you is an illusion, you are able to dispel a single illusion within long range, causing it to lose shape, showing you the reality behind it.
tooltip: You accruately describe why something or someone in front of you is an illusion, dispelling a single illusion within long range.

name: Rewrite History
description: Using your expansive knowledge of history, you correct a mistake in the history of the world around you as written in texts or as described to you by another person. These changes send ripples throughout the world, causing changes in perspective and culture. Discuss with the GM what changes you'd like to make. Usable only once per session.
tooltip: You correct a mistake in the history of the world around you as written in texts or as described to you by another person.

name: Reconciliation
description: Add a die to your dice pool when performing an Action that seeks to rectify something harmful you've done to someone, whether indirectly or directly.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when performing an Action that seeks to rectify something harmful you've done.

name: Practical Application
description: Add a die to your dice pool when you apply your training in a particular Knowledge Skill in a practical manner. For example, you could use your knowledge of history to find treasure in ruins, or your knowledge of biology to help cure a sick animal.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool when you apply your training in a particular Knowledge Skill in a practical manner.

name: Your Loss, My Gain
description:
Whenever another person fails at a Task that would net them a reward of some kind, such as looting a corpse or collecting the reward for a bounty, you can take a turn out of order to immediately attempt the same Task, adding two dice to your dice pool for the Task.

You can only perform this Feat once the other person has resolved their turn; you must wait if they decide to re-roll, or they perform a second Action as part of their turn. You can perform this Feat even if you've already acted this round, but you cannot act again if this is your first Action.
tooltip: You take a turn out of order to get a reward another person failed to get, adding two dice to your dice pool for the associated Task.

name: Squishy
description: Is it fur? Is it fat? Or is it just baggy clothing? Whatever the case may be, your body is able to withstand blows much more than other people. You take half as much damage from physical melee Attacks, and no damage from physical melee Attacks when guarding.
tooltip: You take half as much damage from physical melee Attacks, and no damage from physical melee Attacks when guarding.

name: Comforting
description: If an ally hugs you (with your consent) during their Rest, they heal one additional Harm. If they're already at full health, they instead add a die to their dice pool for their next non-combat Task.
tooltip: If an ally hugs you during their Rest, they heal one additional Harm or add a die to their dice pool for their next non-combat Task.

name: Nest Egg
description: You begin the game with a credit chip that is the equivalent of an exorbitant item. You are very, very reluctant to part with the money on this credit chip, and will likely never, ever use it. In fact, you'd much rather add onto your wealth rather than spend it.

name: Cooking Tools
description: You have everything you need for cooking in your trusty pack, including an all-in-one cooking utensil, a cooking pot, a firestarter, and a fire source of your choice, such as a portable gas stove or a small fire pit. You also have a cooking journal you use to store your recipes as you travel.

name: Make Rations
description: Add a die to your dice pool to create a batch of five Rations, which you can store in your inventory or give to someone else. Requires the necessary ingredients, as well as five minutes of uninterrupted cooking time. This Feat can be used up to ten times during a Long Rest.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool to create a batch of five Ration. Requires the necessary ingredients.

name: Culinary Skill
description:
To be a chef, it's not enough to be good at cooking. You can always benefit from some training in other areas to make your cooking more effective, to create tools for yourself, or to make your dishes more exciting. Select one of the following Skills to be trained in:

  • Blacksmithing
  • Botany
  • Chemistry
  • Hunting
  • Pottery
  • Primitive Construction
  • Survival

name: Cook Simple Meal
description: Add a die to your dice pool to create a five Simple Meals, which you can store in your inventory or give to someone else. Requires the necessary ingredients, as well as ten minutes of uninterrupted cooking time. This Feat can be used up to five times during a Long Rest.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool to create five Simple Meals. Requires the necessary ingredients.

name: Culinary Skill
description:
To be a chef, it's not enough to be good at cooking. You can always benefit from some training in other areas to make your cooking more effective, to create tools for yourself, or to make your dishes more exciting. Select one of the following Skills to be trained in:

  • Blacksmithing
  • Botany
  • Chemistry
  • Hunting
  • Pottery
  • Primitive Construction
  • Survival

name: Heroes' Feast
description: Add a die to your dice pool to create a veritable feast for up to ten people, including yourself, lasting at least thirty minutes. Those that partake in the Heroes' Feast count the time spent eating as an additional Short Rest, have their hunger satiated for the day, and add a die to their dice pool on all non-physical Tasks for an hour following the feast. Requires the necessary ingredients and at least one hour of preparation. You can add additional participants as long as you spend an additional six minutes on preparing the feast per extra person. You can perform this Feat once during a Long Rest.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool to create a feast for up to ten people, including yourself. Requires the necessary ingredients.

name: As Long As It Takes
description: You don't care how many tries it takes—you're going to do it your way, or no way at all! You no longer remove a die from your dice pool on successive attempts at performing an Action you failed in previous rounds.
tooltip: You no longer remove a die from your dice pool on successive attempts at performing an Action you failed in previous rounds.

name: Makeover
description: Add a die to your dice pool in addition to any other bonus you may get from Skills when Helping another character change their appearance in some way.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool in addition to any other bonus you may get from Skills when Helping another character change their appearance.

name: Finish the Job
description: Add a die to your dice pool for any Task roll, as long as that Task would finish something or bring an end to something. For example, striking the final blow on an enemy, or eating the last piece of pie in a pie eating contest.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool for any Task roll, as long as that Task would finish something or bring an end to something.

name: Twitchy
description: You don't like it when people get into your personal space. You become distracted the first round anyone gets into immediate range of you, as you have to spend your turn shooing them away instead of taking your normal Actions. While distracted, you can only Guard or move.
tooltip: You become distracted the first round anyone gets into immediate range of you. While distracted, you can only Guard or move.

name: Wouldn't Hurt a Fly
description: Either by choice or through your very nature, you are unable to bring harm to any creature, or really anything at all. You are eternally pacified, meaning you cannot Attack, but can take other Actions and use Abilities, as long as those Abilities aren't Attacks. If you already have Abilities from other sources that are Attacks, discuss with the GM on how you can use those Abilities in ways that would not be considered an Attack. You are also immune to attempts to pacify you.
tooltip: You are eternally pacified, meaning you cannot Attack, but can take other Actions and use Abilities.

name: Calming Presence
description: When you look at people, your eyes seem to stare into their very soul. While you focus on a target, they share your tranquility, becoming distracted for as long as you spend your Action each round focusing on them.
tooltip: You stare at a target, causing them to be distracted for as long as you focus on them.

name: Too Cool for School
description: Whether due to circumstances or your own choices, you've never had a formal education; everything you know, you've learned on your own. Remove a die from your dice pool for any Task requiriing knowledge.
tooltip: Remove a die from your dice pool for any Task requiriing knowledge.

name: Street Smarts
description: Education and book smarts are great and all, but you shouldn't discount what you can learn from a hard working, simple life. Sometimes, intutition and life lessons are enough to get through hard times. You can gain Insight without paying any XP related to a problem you are facing that would normally require extensive knowledge on the subject. Only works once per problem or encounter. The GM will decide where one encounter or problem ends, and another begins.
tooltip: You gain Insight without paying any XP related to a problem you are facing that would normally require extensive knowledge on the subject.

name: Unhelpful
description: You do not provide any bonus when Helping another character, nor receive any bonus from another character when receiving Help. In other words, the Help Action is useless to you.
tooltip: You do not provide any bonus when Helping another character, nor receive any bonus from another character when receiving Help.

name: Occam's Razor
description: As part of your Help Action, you provide a simple solution for the Task the person you're Helping is trying to accomplish. If they follow your solution and you succeed on your Help roll, they add two dice to their dice pool. If they don't listen to you, they only add one die. Regardless of whether they listen to you or not, if they fail at their Task, instead of Intrusion, you can take a turn out of order to perform the Task yourself, using the advide you provided previously, or the nearest approximation if you don't have access to the same Abilities as the person you Helped. If you fail at the Task when performing it yourself, both you and the person you Helped previously share in the Intrusion.
tooltip: You provide a simple solution to someone you're Helping, adding two dice to their dice pool if they listen to you, or one die if they don't. You can then perform the Task yourself if they fail.

name: Zealotry
description: You have a strong, energetic desire to see something done, to uphold your ideals, your cause, or to support a specific person. Whatever it is that you're passionate about seeing succeed, you devote all your energy towards it. Make note of your cause, ideal, or who or what it is you support. Add a die to your dice pool whenever you take an Action that works in favour of what you support.
tooltip: Add a die to your dice pool whenever you take an Action that works in favour of your cause, ideal or the people you support.

name: <hide>
description: You devote all your energy towards something or someone. Make note of your cause, ideal, or who or what it is you support.

name: Aura Magic
description: Whenever you use magic, you are using your body's innate energy through Aura Magic. Aura Magic focuses on self-discovery, the strength of self and the ability to materialize inner strength for external use. Aura Magic is most often used to increase an individual's physical capabilities beyond their natural limits. Aura can also be manifested as an external force to push or pull in a given direction. All sentient beings have an aura, ch'i or spirit which can be sensed by those adept in Aura Magic. An individual's aura contains their essence and can be read, manipulated or destroyed.
tooltip: You can use Magic, and your Magical Abilities use Aura Magic.
